Dear IKEA Customer Service Team, I hope this message finds you well. My name is Limor Hefetz, and I am writing to file a complaint regarding the unacceptable and unprofessional service I experienced at the Buyback service desk at your Paramus, New Jersey, location on March 22nd. On March 8, 2025, we received a buyback estimation for our IKEA shelving unit in 'as new' condition (Estimation Number: 137****). On March 22nd, 2025, in order to facilitate the return, we proactively purchased appropriate wrapping materials and rented a U-Haul vehicle. Upon arrival at 1:05 PM, my husband was assisted by a representative named Cristina. Her initial attitude was aggressive, indifferent, and hostile. Despite acknowledging the excellent condition of our unit, she insisted that the bottom panels, which we had brought separately, be attached. My husband understood this requirement and was prepared to comply.

Our experience with Ikea has been so awful. First, they told us they had a rug in stock at their College Park store. By the time we got there, less than an hour later, they didn't have it. Then we ordered the rug and a rug pad online, and they arrived 3 days late. The rug pad was so thin and useless that we've been trying to return it. I paid for return shipping, and they told me to expect a delivery person between 9 am and 9 pm on July 11th.

The transporter called me half an hour before the time slot ended to tell me that he could not make the delivery (oven) necessary for the installation of the kitchen the next day. I lost one day waiting for him, and I have to take another day permit to wait for the oven after the kitchen has been installed. In addition, I lost another day because some pieces were delivered in advance on a different day from another vendor. IKEA never again.

My small-town post office doesn't deliver to homes; there are only PO Boxes, and if a package comes, they hold it for us. So I put in my PO Box number on my order, and unlike other websites that won't ship to PO Boxes and give you an error message SAYING SO, the Ikea website just lets it go through. Then, when it comes time to ship your items, they look and say OMG, it's a PO Box, we don't ship to them! So they look up the last address they have for you, and FedEx it to that. In my case, my PO Box is in southern California, and the last address they have for me is in Oregon. So they sent it a thousand miles away.

I kept and built a defective cabinet which I could have exchanged because I was told I would receive a $50 digital IKEA gift card as compensation. Required a ton of extra effort on my part and turned out OK but not nearly as nice as it was supposed to be. And then, no gift card in spite of 3 follow-up calls from me. (Emails are totally ignored.) More promises made but none of those happened either. AND, to make it all a lot worse, the only reviews you can give are about the agent, not about receiving any actual help. The whole situation TOTALLY sucks.

Updated by user Feb 21, 2025 Company fixed the issue and I have been provided with apology. I kept calling and emailing the company. Original review Jan 21, 2025 This entire situation has gone beyond ridiculous. I trusted IKEA to accommodate the order and complete the transaction of my new kitchen. I met three times with store personnel, and confirmed with an online planner that my order could be delivered, would be delivered, and that if I used the delivery service, ALL items on my list would be available. I then paid the amount on the invoice with that trust in place. I have made about 7 phone calls to IKEA, and have spoken with multiple people who are unable to assist in any way. This is so absurd that it deserves a full-scale evaluation and case study by anyone at IKEA who may be remotely interested in figuring out how to really mess up a customer order.  I still do not have but two small boxes delivered by FedEx a day late. What is going on? And why can IKEA not assist? No one can. Every single phone call is met with the same set of confusion.  BACKGROUND  The order has been delayed for over 3 weeks. I have made multiple calls. I have paid $10,000+ for a complete kitchen that was supposed to have been delivered on December 30, 2024. Each call to a customer service representative results in two different stories. 1. The items are not all available. 2. The delivery company is delayed. The delivery company has attempted to deliver one time on a date that was not scheduled. I was not home. This has ceased to be appropriate, or truthful, or even sane. What is going on? Why can't IKEA be honest? Manage this order? Report the situation accurately? Locate my order? Get the $10,000 in materials to my location? Redirect the order? Allow me to pick it up? Solve this situation? I have a completely gutted kitchen ready for the cabinetry and all associated parts. IKEA has no idea what's going on.  Can anyone assist? Or am I intentionally being delayed, dealt untruths, or simply caught up in an organization that has no real people in it?

This is not right! First I want to tell you a little about myself. From 1986 to 1991 I lived in Europe. When we arrived in Germany we bought 2 second-hand IKEA sofas. And since the sofas were still impeccable, I decided to reupholster them. I am a loyal IKEA customer and when I needed a new sofa of course it had to be from IKEA. The sofa is very comfortable but unfortunately the upholstery is falling apart, it is literally falling apart! Every time I sit down I end up with pieces of the couch all over my clothes. And the cushions are falling apart as well. After going through cancer and a stroke I can't resist this anymore. The truth is I am very disappointed and I would like IKEA to give me a solution. I called IKEA Usa many times, from the end of February until today. Also, on March 5th I sent photos. Entered Ikea wearing a mask, with my younger child in tow, also wearing a mask, even though we have medical/behavioral exemption issues... (Per Gov. Wolf).But, not wanting to "wreck" others experience, or be mask shamed by other customers as has happened before, we complied. Met a really nice rep in the couch section, really sweet and helpful. Asked to speak to her Supervisor, and gave him a glowing review of her. She knew how hard times are with masks, sweating, etc.. and was really pleasant. Anyway, went then to mattress section, laid my purse down to write something on paper, and was promptly yelled at by two older employees, because my mask had slipped below my nose. I wear glasses, and so they fog up.. No excuse, but needed to see.. So from time to time, the mask has to be below, in order to unfog.. Right? Anyway, I was told, "you need to put your mask over your nose," and I said, "I cannot breathe, just give me a minute." I told him I don't even need to wear one, but am doing so as a curtesy. So instead of letting it go, he does this. He gets on his phone, and loudly says into the phone, "we have a non-mask wearer here, we have a non-mask wearer here." Like I was in Nazi Germany or something!!! And the other employee is hollering, "Masks save lives, masks save lives." So both my son and I stop shopping and leave to check out as fast as we can. So here is the other *** and *** thing.. We get in line, and then the line "monitor whispers something to the clerk, who turns around and stares at me, and then he tells another clerk something, and she turns around and stares at me too. So I get in line with the clerk who was staring at me, since there were only two lines open, and she does not say ONE SINGLE WORD TO ME the entire time. Not hello, nothing. So different from the gal in couch section. So, I check out, and THEN over the loud speakers, this women says, "To our customers at IKEA under Gov Wolf orders you must wear a mask in the store, and it must cover your mouth and nose at all times You must wear a mask. Thank you." Do you think that was meant for me, or just a coincidence? There are THREE exceptions to that order; Mental, Behavioral and medical... I have never been treated so *** in my whole life.. I/we did wear a mask, although I/we have the exemption... and was treated like a criminal just because I had to pull it down for a minute. You gotta be kidding me. I will never ever shop at IKEA again. You have lost a customer because you are treating them as if they are a leper... shame on you. So I have left a message for this gentleman today, down below, since you can never reach customer service on a good day.. I asked for him to call me back so we can discuss this issue. Deep within the bowels of Ikea's Website, you can find their Chat line. This will bypass having to call them. Here's what to do: Go to the U.S. website. Place an item into your shopping basket via the buy online tab. Double click on the basket. It will take you to a page where, on the left-hand side of the screen, you can put in your state and ZIP Code.

Had I known the delivery company IKEA works with and it’s telephone support network was so sub-par, I would have saved myself the 4 hours I spent waiting for my order today and simply gone to the store. After not receiving any update on my order past my due delivery time, I called IKEA customer service only to be informed that my item had not been collected that morning. If that was the case, it would have been really considerate had someone contacted me to let me know rather than leaving me to wait all day and requiring me to call up to find out where my items were. Sandy, the customer service representative I called then assured me my items would be delivered on Monday evening and I would be able to receive a shipping refund if I stayed on the line. Of course, as soon as she tried to transfer me the call dropped so I spent a further 50 minutes on hold trying to reach a new representative only to be told it wasn’t IKEA’s responsibility but the shipping company and I would have to reschedule directly with them. I’m absolutely disgusted with the level of customer service I have received from the company and the company IKEA uses to ship your products.

we did an order for beds for our kids about $1700.00, XPO the delivery/assembly company, says they showed up, complete untruth, we had 2 phone calls no messages from a cell phone.we have a ring door bell which lets us know when someone is at the door (it was open anyways) and it also records when there is motion, there was no motion and no recording and I'm sitting 15 from the door on my laptop The only call we got with a message was a call to reschedule no message from the driver just the call the day before telling us the time window. We called Ikea, they passed us off to XPO,(they driver couldn't of been 10 mins away if he actually came) sat on hold for 30 mins then opted for the call back option (never got called back) but we proceeded to call them back in an hour XPO gave us a case number 4360****, to give to Ikea, we gave that to Ikea, called them talked to a nice/professional Rep named Dennis he went through the paper trail, and confirmed all the information was accurate, then after he confirmed all the data I had to be on hold again for 20 mins, this other rep at Ikea said the same crap the other rep said, after I had to repeat myself on what went down, after being on hold again she came back with an offer of a $50 gift card, So I wait at my house all day don't get my furniture, get the run around from 4 xpo reps and 3 Ikea reps, unbelievable!!!!

What year are we in now that IKEA online has no order tracking system??? *** your orders don't even show up when you log into your account. There is no 'order history' record of ANY sort. Called in March 2018 to get a replacement cushion for my couch (warranty replacement). Let me start by saying that we are long term IKEA customers, over the years, we bought bedrooms, sofas, tables, etc . About 2/3 of our furniture is IKE. I have spent 3 days and a total of 5 hours on hold to cancel a order I placed. Hello, every person I know that is over 18 years old I know has a job!! Those are those things we go to all day so that we can afford to buy the things we do at IKEA. A person told me about Ikea's chat line on their website and I got to use it a couple of weeks ago. I tried again today and it looks like it's not working anymore. I have been a loyal IKEA customer for decades, even having visited their flagship store in Malmo, Sweden. Ordered online as store didn't have items in stock. Checked again 3 days later and items were in stock so purchased and then tried to cancel order. "Richard" tells me, despite the long email chain attached to his response with all of these details, including "Thomas"’s claim it was scheduled for 10/20, the Case ID and my new order number that my order was already delivered on 10/11 and that if I am missing something, he can submit a replacement for me. I am done speaking to incompetent people who are unable to do anything but hem and haw and go in circles with paying customers. 19) Nothing is resolved. They say you take the biggest risks when you are going down. After IKEA dressers and cupboards were found with a flaw that could kill (and killed!) infants, IKEA launched one of the biggest recalls in furniture history. The truth - they never paid out refund checks to the millions whose items were recalled! After spending 35 hours on the phone over 14 phone calls, and being promised the check for all my furniture that was recalled, after 5 months of harassment and constantly being lied to, I'm asking other customers in a similar boat to reach out - let's punish IKEA together. Already a few neighbors have joined hands.

This is incompetence in it's highest form. IKEA SUCKS! They are thieves. Updated by user Nov 14, 2017 On Oct 8, I placed an order with IKEA online for an 8 drawer dresser and a 6 drawer chest. I needed it shipped because I recently had surgery and am unable to lift heavy objects.  I work weekdays so needed a weekend delivery and the earliest Saturday delivery I could get was Oct 21, so I set it up. They sent me emails, Order Shipped, Ready to Deliver. I was supposed to get a phone call with the time frame of delivery 4 hr window or 12 hr window but it never happened. Saturday came and I waited and waited and then got an "Your IKEA order was not delivered as scheduled" email.  It tells you to contact Customer Support but doesn't give you a phone number, just a link that takes you to IKEA customer support page that gives you their hours and FAQs. Not really helpful. I search and find a way to send them an email asking why they didn't deliver my items. Within an hr I get a call from the delivery guy saying that one item was damaged and it was IKEA's policy not to delivery damaged items.  He gave me two options, deliver both items and I could take back the damaged one for replacement myself - gee, why would I do something stupid like pay for shipping if I was willing and able to do that? Or have them send a replacement and set up a new shipping date. Well I didn't really have much of a choice and I wasn't going to pay for damaged goods, so I chose the latter option. Then I got an email on Oct 23 with the IKEA customer service number, finally a way to speak to a 'human'.  877-686-**** it included a pdf with information on the replacement. On Oct 31, I finally get notice that my item has Shipped, on Nov 1, my order was ready to deliver and on Nov 3 I got a call with a delivery window of Saturday Nov 4 between 10am to 2pm. Another Saturday I sit waiting, making sure I have space for the boxes, area for assembly and I realize it's after 1pm, I get a phone call from the delivery guy, he's running late, he should be here by 2:30. What could I say, ok, whatever.  Promptly at 2pm, I get an email from IKEA stating that my items were delivered. Hmmm, No, No they hadn't. So I responded to their 'no-reply' email anyways stating that I hadn't received anything yet. Now, it's 3:30 and still no delivery, I call the delivery guy back and he says he's 7 minutes away.  He brings in three boxes, I said that my order was for 2 items, a dresser and a chest. All he had was one - so I told him that I wouldn't sign for it since it was not a complete order. They packed it back up and took it away. When they leave I call IKEA customer service and speak to Ashley, I had to put pressure to get them to refund both the order and the shipping costs, but finally after speaking to her manager, it was approved.  Note that I'm taking this from her words, I asked for an email stating that everything was going to be refunded but as of Nov 8, I still have not received that email. Nov 7, I check my bank account and still no refund. It is one day shy of a month of this IKEA incompetence and I still have nothing, no refund for an order that wasn't delivered complete. I called IKEA customer service again, demanding that my refund happen NOW.  The initial rep said that there was a 20 minute wait to speak to a manager - their tactics seem to be, annoy the person enough so that they give up - I told her, I've waited just about a month so far and gotten nothing, 20 minutes doesn't matter, so she put me on hold. I was put on hold for a total of 40 minutes of just shy a one hour phone call.  More great IKEA customer service. Then a customer service resolution specialist got online, I explained the whole situation once again to him, he put me on hold and came back saying he'd do his best to have my refund processed the next day.

Do not rely on the ikea call center for help. Go back to the store if at all possible. The phone lines overload so no one can get through to them. My elderly mother has a home in the country, not close to any big cities. We used IKEA online to order a kitchen item for a rental unit. It is with a heavy heart that I write this horrendous review of my recent experience with IKEA. I have been an avid IKEA customer and advocate for the past twenty years, and have always raved about how much I love IKEA. However, my loyalty and love for IKEA all ended at the beginning of this month. On May 6, 2017, I visited the IKEA store in Orlando, FL to purchase a second HEMNES 3 drawer dresser for our new nursery. It takes me about an hour and $10 in tolls to get to the nearest IKEA store, but I had no problem doing this because we really wanted this dresser. The next day, my amazing husband got to work building the dresser, and we discovered that the holes were drilled incorrectly in four major parts of the dresser.

For over 10 years, I have loved shopping at IKEA for everything from rec room storage solutions, to breakfast room furniture, to dorm room shopping for oldest. However, it is definitely a day trip. The closest IKEA is over an hour away and the traffic is frustrating, so when I was eyeing a 4 piece media unit online, I decided to have it delivered. Since it was on sale, it made the $170 delivery fee not so bad. The day of the delivery, the driver was an hour late from the window provided and I called the company info given in my email, and they could not reach the driver; thus, I was late picking up my daughter from school. Of course, that's not IKEA's fault, just the company they contract with.
Shame on IKEA for not having handicapped scooters in their Columbus store. We don’t always have someone to push us around in a wheelchair! Will NEVER spend my money there.

We ordered an armoire that was supposed to be delivered last Friday. They called the day before as planned and said that someone would call us 30 minutes before making the delivery. Really really really sucks!!! Reps not following numbering order and letting people transact out of order. Will never shop here again and will tell everyone i know.

I will no longer use any of IKEA services. My experience was horrible with them. I bought items online and place my order early October. In November when i didn't hear from them I called. I'm too tired to go into all the detail. Two deliveries. First one showed up at 9:30 p.m. for a 1-5 window. Fine. Second one showed up on time -- damaged. First, this is not a judgement on the IKEA business model or the quality if IKEA products. Their product is popular and that Portland store was very well managed. My experience at the store in Centennial has been quite different.

Ordered a sofa bed in store. No room left in my truck after other smaller items on board so I paid $199 for shipping. Big mistake! Delivery cancelled on day of twice. A week later it finally delivered but I had to bust my but to get it assembled for holiday guests arriving. XPO said it was IKEA's fault and that I should get the shipping charge refunded. Attempted to call Customer Service four times and gave up in frustration after 40 minutes on hold (they don't even have the guts to tell you how long you should expect to wait!) So I sent an e-mail.

I ordered $1300.00 worth of furniture and after trying three times to get it delivered after the delivery company said they were bringing it and didn’t (didn’t even have it on their truck!) "Lure with $$ and then Give Away customers' private information to unknown parties!" 1) I had problems with them setting up a delivery without calling me. 2) I spent hours on hold trying to get through to Customer Service on several occasions 3) Before my son even moved into the room, he banged into the edge of the bed and the veneer came off like a banana peel. 4). I first purchased 2 koppang dressers, got them home started to put them todether when I realized the holes were not lining up. after about 30 min. it was not me but them. soo I returned them. then I purchased them again but had ikea put them together at a high end price. 3 weeks later the deliver them except they were not assembled, they wanted to do it at my place and take 3 hours of my time. why did I pay all that money and then have to be inconvienced. again I returned everything, wanted my money back but they refused to give me my delivery money back.

Came to buy some things... stopped to eat lunch with my son.. the cashier overcharged me for a cake.. when i told her.. it took long.. my son was eating by himself and then i told the manager to just give me another kids meal for the same price.. she said she just couldn't... customer service is clearly not a priority.. i wasted more time getting a few dollars refunded versus just giving me another plate of chicken and fries.. what a waste of time.

This is the letter I sent to the IKEA customer service email address. On Thursday, August 10, I went to your store in Tampa to purchase a sleeper sofa for my 90 year old mother. I picked one out. As I was buying it I asked two very specific questions - if she didn't like it could I return it? And, would they pick it up if assembled? Matt, the sales person, told me that I had a year to return it. He also said they would pick up for free, assembled or not. Saturday, August 12, Mom decides the couch is "horrible." So, I attempt to call to get a return pick up schedule. The first try at the customer service number, I gave up after an hour; the second try I gave up after 40 minutes. I finally got through on the third try after 1 hour and 28 minutes.

I have ordered a sofa from Ikea, PA in the store. Paid over $100 shipment and a week later sofa was delivered but was damaged. Then I called Ikea spent many hours on hold finally a manager reordered a new sofa. A week later the delivery never came. Again I spent many hours on hold and finally they connected me to a manager, he reordered once more and said the sofa will be delivered after 9 days. So I called the delivery company today to check if they have the order.

Literally the WORST customer service experience! Ordered furniture online, and was given an estimated delivery date. Date comes, no delivery, no email, no notification from IKEA that the date has been changed. After calling TWICE, and being on hold for OVER 45 MINUTES each time, they were finally able to figure out that my order was actually not ready, and they did not know when it was arriving. I then received an email notification with another date, this time it said "confirmed" on it. We had assistance on hand ALL DAY that day (that specifically came in to assist us in this large delivery) and I made sure I was available during that time frame to accept and check the delivery.

I paid $99 in the Minneapolis Minnesota store for a delivery between 5pm-9pm Saturday. I confirmed 5-9pm Saturday before I left. My paperwork says 5-9pm Saturday. We've been through an unbelievable series of snafus connected with our on-line purchase of some office furniture. Order kitchen to be delivered, they called the might before and set time for between 3 to 7 pm. I called delivery company at 6pm sskrd if they intended to deliver in the rain. In addition I sat around all day and I know they never called. I called again and complained, this time they said that they had called at 12 pm that day.

I left the call center about a month ago. I was there for three years. They implemented a new call system to better help. When I left, customers now were routinely on hold for 30 minutes. Need to be transferred? 45 more minutes. Callers asking for help building something can expect an18 year old who never bought an Ikea item to guide them. They hired and trained about 300 people in the year before I left. But during that time 300 leave. Management there is not concerned about finding ways to better treat customers or eliminating long call times.

I have exhausted every fiber in my body trying to resolve an online order that was placed back in January 2017. My son was moving into a brand new apartment in Lynnwood, WA and he wanted to purchase furniture from IKEA to furnish their new apartment. So, once he selected the items online and placed them in the online cart, I logged on and paid $2200.00 for the items with a scheduled delivery date of approximately 3 weeks from the date of the order. Feb. 8 or 9 came and when the delivery showed up, it was missing the couch and 2 lamps. My son being the patient person that he is placed numerous calls and kept getting the run around.

That's was my first time shopping furniture at IKEA and the last time. I am coming from Europe and there are miles away with there service from IKEA in Europe. I also read nothing than negative reviews on consumer affairs. There only have 1 star no wonder i just experienced my self with IKEA. Horrible costumer service. Will never buy anything again from IKEA
It took one year to resolve an issue and each phone call was an hour wait. I will never do business with them again or recommend them to anyone

Bought Hemnes desk from Brooklyn IKEA and when I went home to assemble it I realized there were missing parts and the directions were different than the parts that were included so I was unable to complete the assembly of my dresser without additional parts. I called customer service to get the correct parts. After confirming with the rep multiple times they were not going to be sending me the exact same parts that I originally received I hung up. After waiting the estimated 7-10 days for delivery I called back on the 10th day to find out they never sent the items. This time I was put on hold 3 different times for over 30 minutes. This call did end up in me receiving the parts the following Tuesday.

Be home 12-4 for delivery. Never called so we tried at 4, they will be closer to 6. Nothing at 6, we called again should be before 8. Then the driver calls said by 8:30. We eat dinner put the kids to bed. Call again at 8:30, they will be there around 10:30. Who get furniture delivered at 10:30. Yes at 10:35 they show, and not very happy. How did I know because in the morning I started getting the boxes ready to assemble and noticed they spit all over the back side against the wall and on my floor.

This is the second time I bought from IKEA in a row where the product I brought home and was assembling was milled/cut wrong. I have a bed I bought for my daughter. The bed was put together and worked out, though it took all Saturday. There are drawers to go under the bed and I'm constructing those when I discover that the back panels to the drawers weren't milled with the holes needed for the pegs to connect to the sides! So now what? I'll be expected to dismantle this whole thing and bring it back in to get a replacement that may or may not have every piece milled correctly?

We installed two of these mirror vanities in our master bathroom, exactly 1 year later the light on one started flickering when the cabinet door was opened, and soon stopped turning on completely. The problem seems to be due to a wire connecting the light that crimped when the door was closed; the wire casing has split at that location. We thought that it was covered by a multi-year warranty that covered a similar mirror cabinet, but we learned that there are no replacement parts to repair it and no warranty.

Ordered a kitchen and told that the sink is not in at this time, that was February. The store tells me it may take several months that's right months. To this day it's still not in. What real *** bags. The founder I can tell must have been a real *** himself because they leave people hanging for months and then when you say you like to order from another store they tell you we don't operate that way so basically it's okay to screw people over make them wait.. Funny I questioned the countertop people about placing the order when I do the countertop and Ikea charges $40 for each flight of stairs yet the company doesn't see any part of that money that's just a scam Again by the *** of Ikea

Same issues as everyone else. When I found out that they only give you there delivery window the night before they will deliver, I thought it was absurd. How could anyone plan for that? So I canceled the order; but they went on to try to deliver the item anyway, not once but twice. Ikea acts like Big Brother: "do it our way or pay" "dont confound our system or you will die" Its a bit extreme but take it to the ultimate *** if they do not have to be accountable and can take money from us without having to operate appropriately or even deliver, which in US laws would be called theft, then why will they every be held accountable for anything. If a driver runs over a baby, will they blame the customer or the parents?

Wow, What can I say. The design of this store is really not customer friendly. It is down right ridiculous! Trying to find anything results in walking thru every section/department. And then, checking out,you follow arrows forever..probably a mile. No other store makes you walk thru every department to check out. I went on a favor for my son who lives 200 miles away and he owes me big time! I spent an hour and 1/2 searching and walking for things on his list. I live right down the street from IKEA and I will never, never, never step foot in this store again. Great marketing strategy whoever designed the floor plan...NOT!

After purchasing some cabinets (45 minute wait), We decided to change the color, but since it was another 45 minute wait to see anyone, we decided to just call the store or customer service and handle this. Store is 2 hr round trip for us. Called customer service and was told (after another 30 min.) they couldn't help and I needed to drive back to the store to do this. REALLY? Ok, so let's just cancel and I will reorder on-line. NOPE! Drive to the store for that. This is the worst customer care ever. It took me 45 minutes and asking for a supervisor to simply cancel an order. After telling me over and over she couldn't do it, I said I'd just call cc company...then she says, well I can just cancel it.

Just went to the new Ikea last week, the lines were ridiculously long there was a terrible wait for everything and then extreme wait of 30 to 40 minutes just to pick up Warehouse Goods. Same experience today 32 people in line before me for a return. Note, these were not weekends or peak times.

IKEA #1 WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE OF THE CENTURY! I hope I don't forget and trust this company again. I have shopped in the storm in Paris and it's all so nice. Who could ever imagine a somewhat respected company worldwide with good products could *** people around as Ikea does. They send an email of the order confirmation, then NOTHING else. You have no way to find out anything. Even their "tracking", haha, you have to write your name, email, etc., AND your tracking number only to have the "request" disappear into the ethos. They'll let you know about your order in 24-48 hours! Hilarious, but I'm seething angry. So, while trying to find something online, I called and was on the phone 45 minutes, most of it on hold.

Order # 24206**** I purchased two bathroom cabinets on-line via Ikea website. The delivery schedule, for the same city, 20 miles away was 11 days from purchase. Really? That long? Then the delivery company "Dynamex" in Dallas tried to deliver the product to a business on a Sunday, when the business was obviously closed. They did not try to redeliver on the following Monday or Tuesday. It took numerous phone calls to Dynamex and Ikea to try to straighten things out. They were never going to try to redeliver. I had to call and reschedule, they wanted to charge me another $50.00 on top of the $100.00 delivery fee I already incurred. This "redelivery" was not scheduled for another 2 days.

Let me give you a short summary on my “experience” with purchasing a kitchen from Ikea Step 1- design & measurement Done with Ikea 3rd party. 1. Measurement wrong- see attached picture of short drawer & wide corner panel piece- should be a wider drawer confirmed by installers that a wide drawer would fit. 2. Need to change 2 electric locations for cooktop & hood & gas location as well- due misplace when designed - cooktop must be 6 inch away from cabinets(picture attached)

I recently purchased a home and needed furniture and heard from a good friend that IKEA was a good place to start so I started looking online and eventually did an online order since the closest store is about an hour away and I usually don't get off work until an hour before the closing time. After realizing I should change delivery address to my parents home as I was having a driveway refinished about the same time it was being delivered and it would be much more accessible by a larger truck, I called and asked if they would be able to change it and was told no despite the fact that it was only a mile and a half away and much closer to a main road.

i had IKEA came out and measure my kitchen then my family and i went to IKEA to design a kitchen with the measurement at the sunrise store we schedule tradesman installation we had to wait one month before they can come when they first came all the cabinet that go on one wall cant fit so they couldn't do nothing so we had to return the cabinet to the store they and get the wright one one week later tradesman came back to install every thing i been almost one month with out a kitchen and the manager at the sunrise store was so rude to me i will never shop at that store again

We have been a very loyal IKEA USA customer since we moved to the US three years ago. Three years ago we bought all the furniture for our home from IKEA store along with delivery and assembly services. Unfortunately, we had bad experiences with delivery and assembly services back then. But, we took it sportingly and considered that as a fluke and moved on. But, our recent purchase experiences really exhausted our patience to the limit. Let me begin my saying IKEA has the worst customer focused services in the world.
ikea delivered and charged me for things that I didnt even need!!! when i asked why they said we assumed you did.

I have exchanged numerous emails over warranty issue with a sofa. The warranty means nothing and they tell you to bring the sofa in so they can inspect it ?!!!! WHO CAN BRING A SOFA IN??? Then said I need the receipt for a three year old sofa...had charge slip...they said needed receipt and they couldn't find my purchases. Yet I have purchased three sofas and a chair from them. (thank heaven the others aren't the same sofa) Credit card company has changed my number three times due to their systems being compromised.

Me and my family waited 30 minutes at your paramus nj store to eat at your food court. Not only are they rude and inconsiderate. The servers were arguing with the cashiers . When i asked if they could not talk like that infront of my 9 year old stacy ann just ignoted me

Ordered a large collapsible bag on 1/8/17, cc charged on 1/9/17. Paid huge and *** amount for shipping of a .99 bag but had to have a second one! Got email confirming order but nothing since. Tried tracking at IKEA and no order found. Called and rep said they're having problems with tracking on website, that fed ex was at fault for not emailing shipping/tracking info and bag should arrive 1/19. Eleven days to ship a bag that folds up to the size of my palm.

If only I had checked online instead of just seeing my friend's kitchen. I ordered $5,000+ worth of kitchen cabinets 11/20/2016. I was told they would be delivered 12/16. I heard nothing from them. When I called 12/16/16 afternoon to check on it I was told that the two largest cabinets were damaged and they were unsure when my cabinet order would be delivered. I told them to deliver the order and include damaged cabinets. I could fit two in my car for return. Cabinet order arrived 12/29 and the two largest cabinets were not included. I was told they would be delivered 1/6/17. I called 1/6/17 and delivery date has been changed to 1/21/17.

I have been doing my Christmas shopping online for years so I am not a novice with online shopping. Their website was the most frustrating, difficult experience I have ever encountered. It took 3 nights of fighting with their website to get the order to go through. The only reason I kept at it was because I was ordering the child table and stools for my granddaughter for Christmas and I couldn't find anything like it on any other websites. The confirmation email said it wouldn't be delivered until Dec 26th but I was just happy that I finally got the order to go through. On Dec 29th I called to find out why they hadn't received it.

DO NOT USE THEIR DELIVERY SERVICE!!!!! IKEA partnered with some third party sub service. Information about the delivery is not available, you don't get any updates about who took your stuff, their rating or ethics. When you beg to get a number they share a toll free number that never answers! We had to email them and then get a different number. When we finally got them they hung up twice, then claimed the driver was stuck and couldn't call us to reschedule. We canceled a days work to be lied to and jerked around. IKEAs customer service was even worse!!! They refused to issue a refund until they will get their stuff back from their awful delivery service!

Buyers beware !!!! If you are planning on getting cheap furniture from ikea, please dont. It will be a good idea to throw your money away instead buy stuff from ikea. We have a very very bad experience buying stuff from this place. Their products strat crumbling down in no time and the quality is extremely low. Just pay a little more and you can get quality stuff from other compatible stores. We bought beds, wardrobes, shoe racks and kitchen ware.
I'm very sorry that I ordered to this *** company with poor customer service !!! They charged me for delivery a lot & I never received my order!!!!

My husband and I went to my local College Park,MD IKEA store to buy a sectional sofa. We had some hesitation and store clerk told us that we can place our order online and "it is all the same". And assembly cost $40 if we order the delivery to our house. We recently bought another couch from IKEA store and it was exactly like this - we paid delivery and couch was put together at the time of delivery for $40 by the third party delivery company. So September, 17th we placed our another order online on IKEA website. September,25th I contacted IKEA customer service about delivery and assembly service, but I was sent to the third party delivery company. I called to this company and SURPRISE, this company doesn't provide assembly service at the delivery time. As I was told they could do it "couple of days later after delivery" and for the price "started 89 dollars".
Your commercial with the woman thinking she ripped you off I find appalling. You're teaching a whole generation that being dishonest is OK. Norm baker 248;442710

Went to ikea early. In fact first customer at your closet center. Was ignored from the whole two hours I was there to design my closet. Other customer were helped, in fact one customer was given a hug after he was helped. What was it about me that I was treated so badly. I don't know. Oh yes I am brown. ????? Have complained to their customer service. See what happens.

I bought the Micke desk online, it showed up late and jacked up. Ikea sent me a new one it also showed up jacked up. So now I have waited 2 months for a desk for my business that I needed 2 months ago! This has been a big hassle and headache dealing with customer service and trying to do my job without a desk. Does Ikea care? NO, they could care less they are not concerned with making their customers happy, no compensation for their mistakes.

I placed an on-line order today for furniture with Ikea. About an hour after the purchase I changed my mind and tried to cancel the transaction. I COULD NOT DO IT. They wouldn't allow it. There is no option on-line to cancel. The only way is to call their 888 phone line and go insane while you listen to their recorded sales pitch and earthy crunchy PSA's on loop for hours (kill me now!). I literally spent hours on hold this morning. When someone (usually very rude) did answer, the response I got was "we are having unusually high call volume today, and you are in the wrong dept anyway so I can't help you. Let me get you over to the right dept." Then more "save the earth" PSA's while on perma-hold for another hour only to be told the same thing yet AGAIN. Gaaaaah!

Spent over $1000 on cabinets and inserts. Boxes were missing pieces and the installers said I would have to go back to the store (and wait over an hour in returns/exchanges?) to pick up the pieces. Then I would have to reschedule the installers to come back out and fix. The installers acted like this was business as usual and were in a race to get out and on to the next unfinished job. I called customer service and asked for a refund on the labor and they said they can submit a request. I'm sure the representative did not submit the request (on the phone for over 30 minutes waiting for a representative, now waiting over 15 for a manger).

I ordered a sofa, desk and drawers from Ikea and paid $99 for home delivery. In Texas, Ikea outsources their deliveries to Dynamex. A day before the scheduled delivery, Dynamex called me and gave me a 4 our delivery window (8 to noon). They failed to show up. I called Ikea at 1:30 PM and the contacted the delivery company (Dynamex). It told Ikea that they had never gave a delivery window and Ikea believed them.

Delivery delayed day after day and no one calls / communicates to let us know. Hours and hours on the phone until we are able to reach customer service and then they say expect delivery tomorrow and at the same time no apology given neither over the phone or otherwise. The receipt below, order # 23267**** goods purchased Wednesday to be delivered Thursday until now (Monday) nothing has been delivered. No communication from IKEA!

The Falster outdoor set is GOD AWFUL. Did anyone test this set before deciding to sell it in stores? It does not come clean. We are talking NOTHING will clean it. Have a kid at the BBQ with greasy hands? Good luck because you'll be staring at those grease stains for months. Pretty awesome. Ikea claims this is the first they've heard of this issue but I can find it all over online. The fact that this set is still being sold in stores is remarkable. I once sat on one of the chairs with suntan lotion....

Placed July 30th order for bathroom sink with cabinet, shelves, table, etc., cost 700.00 with 99.00 delivery. Truck came at 8:40 p.m. 40 minutes late. Driver said sink was broken, what did I want to do? Said I'd take the whole delivery when the new sink came in. Shipping Company (North American logistics) said, "No Problem," then delivered TWO sinks, with no notice on Sept. 8, left in driveway, with no one to accept. BOTH were shattered. Spent 55 minutes waiting for customer service by phone. Tech said the rest of my order had been cancelled without my permission.

I BOUGHT A WHOLE KITCHEN THRU IKEA , ALL APPLIANCES FRIDGE , STOVE , MICRO , 2ND OVEN , DISHWASHER , HOOD , IN 3 YRS EVERY APPLIANCE HAS HAD A ISSUE EXCEPT VENT HOOD. THE COMPANY THEY CONTRACT WITH FOR WARRANTY WORK ( QUALITY ELECTRONICS ) GRANTS PASS IS A JOKE !! EVERY CALL HAS BEEN A ABSOLUTE FIASCO ! THESE PEOPLE ARE NOT APPLIANCE REPAIR PROFESSIONALS . IT WOULD TAKE HOURS TO TRY AND DOCUMENT EVERY CALL FROM THEM. AND IKEA ?

Third time in the Brooklyn store in one week. Only to arrive to find out the piece I need is out of stock. Already spent over 1K and really disappointed that the reps can't guarantee any stock even if we call ahead of time. It's not easy getting around in NYC! They also won't waive the delivery fee. I've been waiting in the store for a sales rep that the store manager sent. Nowhere to be seen. I would say IKEA is the Spirit Airlines of furniture stores. You get sucked in by the prices but completely regret the decision you made because quality is low and customer service is low.

I am shocked and sad regarding the poor service and processes from IKEA. We have purchased items from them many times from their store in Philadelphia. This time, we ordered some bedroom furniture from Ikea for a surprise birthday for our daughter's bedroom. I had scheduled next day delivery and as promised it was scheduled but never delivered. The driver claimed that they there at the scheduled time, but left even I got there. I spoke to company representative after being on hold for a good amount time only to be given a case number (which Ikea claimed was just a courtesy to us after taking the money). I was notified that a representative would call me within 24-48 hours. Lo and behold no one called and I finally got tired of waiting and called them. This time the wait was even longer over 95 minutes. Fortunately I had dishes to do - so I left my phone on speaker and just hung on until I spoke to a live person.

My order was originally scheduled for delivery on November 27th, and only part of the order arrived. I went back and forth with IKEA customer service as well as the shipping company, and eventually the shipping company delivered some missing boxes, but the order was still missing parts. After two weeks of back and forth and not getting any help, we bought a bed somewhere else and called to cancel our IKEA order. We were told FedEx would be coming to take the boxes back and a refund would be issued. After another week, nobody showed up to get the boxes and we have not received a refund. We called the customer service AGAIN and were told the previous customer service rep did not process a refund, did not even cancel our order, and did not schedule a driver to pick up the boxes. We scheduled a pickup at the time and were assured a refund would be given. It is now December 23rd and the delivery drivers (who were NOT FedEx, btw) just now picked up the boxes from my house. We still do not have a refund. And now I have learned that the delivery fee is non-refundable.

In 2014 I spent almost $5000 on a new Ikea kitchen. Major selling points were my previously positive Ikea experiences, the offered warranty, and the fact that I would be able to switch cabinet doors at a later point if I wanted a different look. I was going with white gloss on the top and black at the bottom, a look that will be very 2014 in a couple of years. For the bottom cabinets I used the dark Gnosjo doors, since they were the only dark slab doors available. I realized at the time that these doors were being sold at bottom prices, but I had faith in Ikea and its advertised 25 year warranty, and in the back of my head I was already picking new doors anyway, since the Gnosjo show every fingerprint and water drop. I was so sold on this concept and the general idea of renewability and corporate accountability, I pitched Ikea’s greatness to every- and anybody whenever the opportunity arose no matter if they wanted to hear it or not.

I visited IKEA which is an hour from my home. I purchased over $300.00 worth of items. During the time of my purchase I presented a coupon that was $20.00 off if you purchased over $150.00 in items. I didn't realize till later that the coupon was never scanned in or taken off my purchase. So I called IKEA, I was transferred to 4 different people and I was on hold for a total of 105 minutes! After all of the waiting, I was told "sorry, you need to come back to the store for us to credit you the coupon" Like I said, over an hour drive, over $300.00 spent, over 1 hour on the phone and that is how I am treated over a $20.00 coupon. Kelli and Dan from the Stoughton, MA were unreasonable and not willing to help.

A few months ago I purchased kitchen cabinets for use in remodeling a home. The cabinets have some nice features and reflect the price you pay for them. Since I live a great distance from an ikea store I purchased cabinets for several different uses in the house (not in the kitchen, didn't care for quality). Unless you have good carpentry skills these cabinets are not easy to put together. Overall the cabinets will work for their intended use. The problem came when I discovered I was missing a drawer.

Updated by user Jun 19, 2016 2 1/2 hours on the phone to get an item I ordered, paid for and they never send. they are also not willing to speed up the shipping after they did not ship it the first time. most horrible customer service, if one can call it that. Original review Jun 18, 2016 I made the mistake to order two items. got one. not way to email them. waited 1/2 on the phone to get told he will transfer me to the "solution center". 2 hours later, inundated in advertisement, on one yet. at the sales link I get a person immediately.

I bought a 4 drawer chest and it fell apart in no time at all because drawers bottoms and chest back were made with thin cardboard. Then, there was a recall because of chests tipping over and people injured. However, despite IKEA's advertisements to refund the cost of the chest and to pick it up, they were a no-show on the pick up date and have been impossible to contact ever since, despite me making numerous phone calls and getting a recall number 201607****92 When I reached their agent by phone today I was put on hold and endured 3 long music sessions before I was cut off.

Last year I bought the Hemnes 6 Drawer set for a guest room for $200. I thought it would last because it would not see much use. Was I ever wrong. Four out of the six drawers already have the bottom falling out. I was able to put 3 back together but the fourth will need more work. The screws are plastic and they still split the cheap pine from which this chest of drawers is made. I plan to glue, screw, and clamp the chest of drawers back together so I can still use it. Piece of garbage, do not buy.

The IKEA delivery service is terrible. I should have looked on consumer affairs site before placing my order because there are 700+ complaints. When ordering from IKEA, my computer did not show all the details on my screen when ordering office furniture for our business (at the time I did not know this). Maybe it was due to our computer security, but I did not see all the areas to fill out and the area to select the delivery date. They came on a Saturday and of course no one was at the office. I came in on Monday and saw an email about scheduling a re-delivery and they wanted to charge $53 to redeliver on another day.

Today me and my wife shopping at ikea,when we done for shopping,go to check out ,have one item ring out not match price on sticker,than i ask for return,cashier start get mad on me ,she throw that item i ask to return to next cashier line ,act very angry,i ask her ,what i did wrong,she just tell me to go next cashier to cash out ,she doen't want do check out for me ,by that time she almost finish my all item i want to buy,then move to next line to check out ,i have start over again.i ask to see manager .when i see manager, he do the same ,he's not try to find out what happen,just move me to next line for check out ,he's not professional,he's not care customer,he should not in that position.

I purchased a Frostig refrigerator along with several thousands of dollars worth of cabinetry and installation services. The refrigerator, made by Whirlpool, did not function properly from the beginning. When I called to inquire about the warranty I was redirected to Whirlpool, who told me that the warranty does not cover items that are not located in a Single Family Dwelling. Since we are using this fridge in an office building it will not be repaired by Whirlpool without me paying additional money.

I have placed a scheduled delivery order from Ikea Online store and they sent me an email mentioning that the order will be delivered on another day. And when I call the customer service after keeping me on hold for more than an hour a representative mentions that they cannot change the delivery date that they mentioned in the email. Every online order that you place from the Ikea website is a nightmare until your order is delivered. It just makes me feel bad to buy from Ikea. I will never buy a ikea product and I will never recommend to buy anything from Ikea.

Ingolf white junior high chair; I successfully installed this little piece of ___. But got to tell you, this is one the worst designs ever after paying 50 dollars. I can use every bad word in the world against the designers. They deserve a severe punishment of community service for one whole year because of selling this item.

Had two IKEA wardrobes delivered, having paid up front for both, and for delivery installation. But, because of latest law suits, etc., the installers were not able to assemble my units (refusing to tie them into the ceiling joists in my bedroom). When calling a month later to ask IKEA why they had not credited the $159 they had charged me for an installation that had not been done, I was put on hold for almost an hour. Why don't they have a "billing questions" button on their options menu? And why, every time I call, do I have to listen to their 3 minute apologia regarding the tip over problems.

Worst customer service ever. The cashier denise was just down right rude. Made us take everything off the cart when the bar codes were already facing out. The she laid everything back on the ground and threw a fit that we had a couple items in a cart. She made it seem like we were an inconvience. No freaken smile either. If you hate people and ur job just quit. You make people not want to come back

Re: Ikea online and phone customer service - Southern California area I placed and paid for an order to be delivered to my home. I have written (as instructed by Ikea) FOUR emails with questions about my order and have NEVER received any return response. My emails were sent over a week time period -plenty of time for the 24-48 hour period response time from Ikea. Additionally, I called Ikea customer service two times and both times received poor service. The representatives in both cases were impatient and rude concerning my questions and concerns. It is very rare that I come across such poor service when dealing with customer service representatives on the phone at other companies.
Went to get a bookshelf, couldn't find our way out of the store hardly! Finally after going crazy and getting physically ill, found our way out, (without the bookshelf) will get one from Amazon!

I Ordered a table which arrives with two wrong legs. After calling and complaining, they said they would expedite the legs in 5-7 business days (which I thought was absurd since it was their fault for sending the wrong legs so the least they could do was get it delivered faster). Ok, on the 8th business day, nothing! And not a word also, no email or call giving us any type is status on the delivery. I called again and guess what? They said the same thing!

Horrible service! Lines are huge on the weekend but no one cares. The staff works slowly, engage in conversations and simply don't care. During the week there aren't even enough people to serve you. There was no milk to get coffee, the guy who served my food had a long beard that was uncovered, and when I asked to speak to a manager the cashier smirked at me. Worst service ever!!!! You have to be extremely patient and have plenty of time in your hands because it will take forever to get the food and pay for your stuff!!!

Don't buy in Miami until you check the prices in Broward. Bought office chairs a@ $39.99 in Miami and Broward had the same chair for $24.99. One store will not honor the other store prices. That's crazy!
Not a review. Just noticed that an ikea commercial featured two lesbians celebrating an anniversary. So sick. Am through with ikea.

I recently bought POANG chair online and while assembling it realized that nuts that are inserted in the wood are of such bad quality that it's impossible to tighten the screws without stripping the thread. I ended up going to Home Depot and purchasing nuts and bolts to finish the job. I paid $150 for this piece of ***. When I called customer service I was on hold for 20 minutes without anyone picking up.

Ikea has some cool stuff, but if it ever breaks, forget it. I had one of their futons that can slide up to be a couch, or down for a bed. 4 wooden slats broke. There's no way to find replacements on the website. There's also no phone number to call, but I eventually came across one and called. It took 3 minutes to get through the phone tree, then after about 5 more minutes of being on hold, the very nice woman said she couldn't help me. I spite, rather than pursue the repair, I took it to the dump.

I have been fighting bedbugs for two years. My came through the slats. Everyone asks are you sure it was IKEA. Yes, we don't travel, we didn't collect things from anywhere. And no one stays here. The ONLY new thing was bed slats. But who keeps receipts of 2 years for bed slats. Unfortunately, word has not spread enough and others I have come across are purchasing beds with slats and are getting the same results. I have contacted IKEA, but they ignore all transaction. I even went to the store and went to the slat section and found a dead bedbug.

We bought 2 settees from their Phoenix store for our holiday home and they were barely used over the 2 years that we had them. At least two of the cushions were never even used so when I took all the covers off to wash them together, I was dismayed to find that 3 of the seat pads were falling apart - literally crumbling. I e-mailed the company 3 times and each time it took a week to get a response. They insisted on a receipt for an exchange or failing that, the exact date, amount of sale etc and they would look for proof at their end (2 years later!!). As it took 3 weeks to get to this stage it was too late for me to start accessing bank statements etc so I'm back home but left with 2 useless settees in our holiday home. They were most unhelpful and don't give a stuff about their customers.

I purchased a TV stand online and had it delivered. When it arrived I was worried because the shipping box it came in was kind of beat up. Even though I was hoping for the best, I knew I would be lucky if everything was fine. Well it turned out everything was not fine. The most important part, the top was crunched in 3 of the 4 corners. Let the game begin... I called the number on the shipping confirmation to request a replacement top. After being on hold for almost 1 hour, I finally got through to someone. They assured me that a new replacement top would be arriving shortly. About two weeks later it arrived. Again..., the shipping box was beat up, but this time worse then the original. I didn't even bother opening it, because I could tell from the ripped open smashed corner that the top was badly damaged.

All around customer service is poor. Store is horrible. Nobody to answer a simple question. Want to order by phone or online but want to know delivery time? No information. Call the listed phone number, it asks you to press # and when you do, it bids you goodbye. It is as if some juvenile is playing a prank. You can NOT get anyone to talk to if your delivery is 5 days late. the company said earlier that delivery is private. It looks like it was intentionally designed this way to evade accountability by diffusing it. How do people like these stay in business???
Bought a Latex mattress, delivered a useless steel hook. Where am I going to sleep on this week!???
After seeing commercial "happy anniversary " ...you can bet I won't spend a dime on anything from ikea!

I canceled an order of over $500 and was told I was being refunded in 3-5 business days. On the 6th business day I called IKEA. The agent told me my cancellation hadn't been processed (???) and that after that it would take 3-5 business days. That's absurd! How long does it take to process a cancellation?? I asked to speak to a supervisor and after what added to 1 hour waiting on the phone he said I'd be refunded on the next day.

I made a purchase (over $1500) over a month ago. I paid for delivery and assembly as well. When my items arrived, two items were missing. So not only were they not delivered, but they were not assembled. One of them was made of glass, and they sent a replacement to me two separate times with absolutely no packing and both times it arrived completely shattered. They said they wouldn't try sending it a second time but they would send me a gift card in the mail. That's the last thing I want and the last place I want to go again.

We purchased Hemnes 8-drawer chest in IKEA College Park, MD, together with delivery and assembly. During assembly the bottom wasn't tied up to the upper part (as it should have been), and with time the thing deformed badly and space opened wide between the parts. Actually, this is when we realized that the screw was missing. We stopped using it, because the whole thing could break down and injury somebody in the family (we have a kid). As this is a clear case of negligence by IKEA provided contractor, I requested replacement, along with delivery and assembly. IKEA rejected the claim, because it was more than 90 days since purchasing and the only way is to bring this thing back, where they would inspect it and issue the verdict. So I had to disassemble the thing and bring it to the store. Initially they said that they cannot refund it, but after some arguing with the manager, they agreed to refund the price of the item. However, they rejected compensation for delivery and assembly.

They really need to have a way to check the status of your order. Not only that, I returned an item that I purchased and was not refunded the shipping. Two packages that were ordered at the same time were shipped at different times. I called and said I didn't receive the 2nd pkg, they never contacted me but the item came the next day. Then low and behold another pkg arrived a week later. They just figured the would send out a replacement apparently. Well, now I have an extra.

I dared to enter the new Ikea store we have in Kansas to only be so disappointed by customer service (there was none). By the lack of handicap items to use in the store. They only have a wheelchair. My husband is 6'8 and 300 pounds and I'm 5'3 and a lot smaller. He wanted a cart so he could move himself. When we asked for one they said we don't use them because people ruin the furniture. So we left never to return!

We bought a king sized bed on the ikea website on the 9th of this month with the promise that it would be delivered on the 21st. I recieved a confirmation email stating that the shipping company, the same one that broke the dresser we bought a while back, picked up the bed on the 15th. I called this morning wanting to know if the bed was coming today and after a 45 minute hold, I finally got the info. They don't know and ikea swears that the shipping company did not pick it up until yesterday. They claim that STI is the shipper from Knoxville, TN but we are wondering why would they send our boxes 5 hours NE when where we live is 3 hours NW of Atlanta. I checked online and have found 0 websites or reviews for the company STI in Knoxville.

Our bed is supposed to show up today. My wife and I gave them a second chance after having a broken dresser delivered and losing out on the 50 bucks for the delivery fee. They seem to be the only game in town that make beds out of real and solid wood anymore that do not charge 2K or more. The delivery is supposed to show up today and I have not heard any word from the delivery company. I am currently calling the customer service number and in the time I found this website, read many reviews and writing my own review, I am still waiting for them to find my order.

Run from them as fast and as hard as you can. Complete rip offs. These people stiff their help and cut corners...very bad organization. That State Attroney Generals office will be going after them. Do yourself a favor and avoid at all costs. They wont return calls either...bad,bad,bad people.
I was in Ikea today...and at least 5 employees were rude and couldn't be bothered to help...they are the worst in customer service

I decided to order the PS cabinet from Ikea on March 8th. I ordered two at $99 each. I also ordered a Knalla shopping cart. Two weeks later I received my items. They came in excellent condition. After reading the frightening reviews and horror stories regarding Ikea's delivery system and customer service i realize that i was very fortunate.
Horrible Customer Service in Robinson, Pennsylvania..I love the ikea products but i should be treated as a customer not a burden..

These barstools are now inferior to the previous product of several years ago. I knew sonething was up when I picked up the featherweight box! The new ones at our home are cheap, lightweight and wobbly. Yes, they are assembled properly and firmly. I dont want our granchildren on these cheap stools for fear they will topple over.

I have purchased from the Ikea store with fairly low issues. I only needed two items, so I thought I would try online ordering. What a mistake. Two weeks after I ordered it was still not in my home. Never order from Ikea online, worst customer service I've ever experienced. Received one of three packages, it's impossible to get someone to answer the phone. Here is my story: I went down to ikea in brooklyn, was going to make a new office, spend more than $1000 on office furniture. Having ordered and purchased a "full-service" item we have now waited 45 minutes for it to arrive at the "full-service" counter. Horrible, horrible, horrible! These people have absolutely no understanding of customer centricity. On 7/25/2015 I went to the Ikea Stoughton MA location to purchase wardrobe pieces for a walk in closet. I have had the MOST frustrating experience with Ikea and it has nothing to do with their products. ( Google said they were open such and such times, but holidays might affect hours~I thought: better call before driving an hour and a half) I could not get in touch with ANYONE, NOWHERE! It shows the sales price UNTIL I go to check out...then, regular price.

I drove two hours to visit this store, spent 3 hours in the store and another 40 minutes picking up all of the pieces for the $500+ order we wanted. Feel your pain for sure, as they refused to honor my 10 Year Warranty on a Bathroom faucet that had purchased 2 years ago! OK, here’s my ongoing nightmare with the IKEA in East Palo Alto, California. I paid $2K for a bed, sofa, desk, and mattress to be delivered. No one can tell me the status. They put the onus on me to call the delivery company, Dynamex. Dynamex can’t give me the status and they can’t reach the driver on the phone. Finally, I get a call from the Dynamex driver at 3pm and he says he thinks he can come by in a “couple of hours”. At 7pm, the driver calls me and says he can come by now. Visited Ikea this past week with my Wife. She is a photographer and needed some decor for a photo shoot. I helped her pick some nice glass mugs up. Sham IKEA SHAM on You We just Purchesd 3 closet worth over $3,000 Frome IKEA and paid for Delivery after we get a licensed exspert carpenter a guy who has 35 years on job to install immedtly we notice a problem we called IKEA 800 # and the told us to go back to the store few days later we went to the IKEA store they told us there is no record of the complaind and we need to bring the merchandise back to the store because in the contract it has a privation of 48 hours well we paid for Delivery now we need to rent a truck to bring that 1 of the damage closet back well I do not think it is nice right or proper to to it to a coustemer who spend so much and get a fallty broken closet SHAM ON IKEA I will never shop there again .
IKEA are rip-offs. They charge outrageous amounts for delivery and re-scheduling of a delivery. I WILL NEVER PURCHASE ANYTHING FROM THEM AGAIN!

All we wanted were three matching bar stools, but the third was cut wrong (one of two supports for chair cut three inches short). We had to drive 25 miles there (with bad traffic) and back (50 miles total), wait in a 45 minute line to return for store credit, and wait in a 20 minute re-checkout line for the replacement. But at least we got it replaced with a new one. Well, the replacement had the same poor manufacturing issue. That's another 50 miles of driving and who knows how long wait for what will hopefully be a correctly manufactured piece of furniture.

We bought a new bed frame for our son. When we went to get it delivered, and possibly assembled, the man behind the counter gave me a quote based on my total bill, not the item itself, which is incorrect based on their own rules. The assembly charge was too rich for my blood at $159, so I declined. When I got home and glanced at my receipt, I realized that I had been misinformed by the IKEA rep and that the charge should have been $89. That may not sound like a big difference, but it's the difference between reasonable and gouging in my opinion. I tried to get the change made via phone, but got caught on IKEA's typical customer service hamster wheel and after about an hour on the phone was told the change could only be made in-store.

After 30+ yrs., we are downsizing, thinking who would buy a 5 brm house but someone 30+ yrs. younger than we are! Could they easily imagine their own chic furniture if our inherited 'brown' furniture, floral prints & all filled every room? Doubtful. By buying IKEA's white, ivory, light wood furniture (choosing light weight pieces - chaises vs. love seats), many black touches (LACK tables), their large black & white photographs, their large live plants in their baskets, with splashes of RED accents, we have a 'modern' home in rooms with crown moldings in an older setting.

Went to Ikea in Burbank to shop for the holidays. Soon did we realized that someone thought that the perfect way to help the consumers is to remove the baskets. Now what they want you to do, is go to the main department and look for a yellow frigging bag. Who, with a slightest bit of common sense, find this clever. This is not only *** and unpractical, you are making it more difficult for people to spend money in the store, which I thought was the main purpose.

I ordered an Ikea sofa online and paid $$319.19 for shipping/delivery. Since Ikea does not deliver to my area (Sapphire, NC, zip 28774), they contracted with a third party delivery service: Ian P. Climer Last Mile | Operations Manager XPO Logistics 1700 West Pointe Drive Suite E Charlotte, NC 28214 P: 305-728-**** ext 4603 C: 704-909-**** ian.climer@***.com | xpo.com Ikea failed to communicate to me that this company only delivers to my area in the a.m. on Mondays. I am a school teacher and delivery(s) was (were) scheduled for the first week(s) of school, making it impossible for me to be at home to receive the product. Initially, I did not know this, and, after receiving my delivery date via email from Ikea, I contacted the company to arrange for an afternoon delivery.

The 5 cent version: We purchased our entire kitchen system from Ikea online/telephone in October 2014 when they were doing their end sale on Akurum - with the promise that they will support the system indefinitely. At least that is what the sales gal Stephanie P. told us when we were ordering. Cut to finally being ready for our cabinets after MANY stops and starts in our kitchen (we haven't had a kitchen since Sept of 2014) bad contractors, improper not to code standards. If there was an issue - we've had it! We are finally ready to put up our cabinets and discover that Ikea delivered us MANY wrong things.

On November 7th my wife and I went to the IKEA in Atlanta and purchased a table and 6 chairs along with a few other small items. We spent over $800. I pulled the six chairs and put them on a cart and after paying my wife went and got the table (while I grabbed the truck and parked just outside the door). The table should have been three boxes but we were only given two. Four days later on my first day off since purchasing the table and chairs I went to put them together only to find out that I was missing box 3 that contains all of the hardware and legs. I called IKEA on 11/11/2015 and explained that I was missing a bunch of the parts.

I went yesterday to Stoughton, MA store and wanted to get 8 pcs of 902.756.17. I contacted a customer service representative to find out the location of this product, he said they only have one in stock and fresh stock will be available on Wednesday at 10 am. OMG i bought this frame in size queen. Boxes marked queen, papers inside marked queen. Put it together like 6 hours work. Its a full!! My mattress doesnt fit!! Now what Ikea? Open the box and measure yours before you buy it! Otherwise you will be stuck like me. Im so mad i just dont know what to say or do.

My family and I will not visit the restaurant again. It is so embarassingly apparent that they want to make more money by offering less choices, smaller portions, the shrimp sandwich had no hard boiled egg anymore, no more baked chicken and less service personnel.
