I saw four IKEA employes buying their lunch in the food court.....also Panera will get more business. The childrens menu does not include drink anymore, etc.etc. who makes these poor ,Marketing Decisions?

well i had a shipment of multiple items, on the date of delivery which was 3 weeks after i bought my items, i came to know that they brought most of the items and installed them which is good but they missed the major kitchen item and got me all the accessories that cant be fixed without this major item. i was told that someone from home delivery will call to follow up, i waited a week, two weeks. no one called. i called and raised a complaint. yet no one called, another week and two of calling then i was able to get a call back and schedule a delivery date which is 2 weeks later. the guys came, i was happy but guess what, they got the item broken, i was like are kidding me people, why did you checked it before coming, i have been waiting for a quarter to get my kitchen installed.

I want a VERY ANGRY experience rating, created just for IKEA!!! TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE First Ikea delivered the wrong package. The shipping label that was verified during delivery was different than what was printed on the box. After 2.5-3 hours on call and getting to talk with a manager after telling I will not be on hold anymore (Marcus Turner), ikea agreed to pick up the incorrect furniture (of higher value) and Marcus promised a gift card etc. No delivery time was provided no other details provided. I had informed that the delivery needs to be scheduled the same week, as I had travel plans after that. Delivery was scheduled when I was out of town. Tried messaging Marcus, no replies after several mails.

There is very long wait to pick up Furniture at East Palo Alto location . It taking up to TOW hours! They claim that they picking orders to fulfill from a *** randomly which does not make sense, it should be first comes first served. On any rate, it is unacceptable to make customers wait for their order.

Yes in-store assistance is second to none, but if you have to call the store, anticipate a 20minue wait. I'm convinced IKEA has 1 person answering the store phone on Long Island. First you dial in and get this 5 minute safety announcement, then you have to punch in your zip code then you get a recording telling you which store is closest to your home, something we already know,,,then you go through the press this number b/s, then then real wait begins...getting through is impossible, well if you anticipate a pick up before 20 minutes...3 times I've called regarding hardware issues and every time I waited 20 minutes.

After waiting 30 minutes at furniture pick-up, manager says it will be another 20 minutes. Instead of an apology, the representative tells me that because it's a Sunday, that's to be expected. Wow! My toddler couldn't take it any longer, so we ended up getting a refund. What a waste of time!!!

I am frankly quite shocked that a company the size of Ikea has such terrible customer service. I ordered something online. immediately after I finalized the transaction, they informed me that it was a three week ship time. I needed it before then. I tried to call to cancel the order but the call center was closed. I followed the links to contact them through email and cancelled the order over email.

Recently had experience at Tampa, Florida, Ikea store. I cannot for the life of me understand why there were so many un-staffed registers in both Returns and Checkout. I asked a manager to explain it and she told me that a lot of staff had called out because of the holiday. I'm thinking, holiday? What holiday? Then it dawned on me that she was talking about Halloween. What, were these absent employees hung over from a sugar high?

I visited the Charlotte nc ikea with a friend who has mobility issues. We travel and shop together frequently. I have always thought of IKEA as a progressive type of environment and did really worry about this walmart and the grocery store have accommodations for shopping. Well not ikea. They do have wheelchairs which a caregiver can push but no basket or help with shopping. We had a Hugh list of things to purchase for a room remodel and I ask for help. I was told "you can pile it all on her lap". It was a nightmare just to physically shop and carry items while pushing my friend. We need to ask questions and make decisions along the way each time we had to find an associate and wait for the right one to come to there area. We would spend time disscussing options only to be told at the end oh all that is out of stock (WHAT tell me that up front) either come back or pay 199.00$ shipping!!!

IKEA restaurant changed a food substitution policy to no substitution ;(!!! So you order meatballs or salmon and cannot have the side it comes with(potato based) Oh that's ok you have to Buy the side of veggies in addition to the entree So since many people cannot eat the carbohydrates without taking extra medicine or cannot eat them at all you are costing them extra money and increasing Ill Will

I purchased Kitchen cabinets and closet furniture from IKEA. First of all, they sent me the wrong items so I had to call and asked them to resend it. They said I'll get a call back within 24 hrs because they need to check delivery company if the misplaced product. So I told her I waited 48 hrs already and she checked the status and told me that Delivery company sent IKEA a wrong information so she told me to wait 48 hrs again. Do yourself a favor.. DONT EVER PURCHASE FROM IKEA. Unless you are in for blood boiling headaches for months. We ordered a whole kitchen from them. Mistake #1. Everyone at Ikea is pretty much incompetent and have no idea what is going on. Everyone we talked to asking the same question gave different (and wrong) answers. This order was placed online and took over 2 months to deliver, and many horrible phone calls in between. It takes an average 1-2 hours on the phone with Ikea, where 90% of the time you are on hold, and then when you get to a human, you are switched to another department, thus waiting another 45 minutes on hold. They give you no information or updates to your order. So when you are trying to plan for a re-model of a house, you can't plan anything because Ikea will give you completely wrong information or no information at all... ie: when you order will be delivered, what is the status, what is in stock. They re-booked our order, changed our order number, delivery date, everything, without notifying us (took another 2 hours on the phone to figure this out). When the order was finally received (in 3 separate shipments and 3 separate absurd delivery charges, when we requested only 1 shipment), obviously things were missing from the order... I mean we were *** to think that they would get it right after all we've been through, they are literally the dumbest people.

In 2011, I bought two mattress protectors, 365+Skydda. They seemed very nice. However… one of them was washed by a laundry, not myself, and shrank dramatically. Unfortunately the Skydda was no longer available but I assumed the quality of their new models would be comparable. After researching the two available models on Ikea's site I decided to go with the more expensive one, Rosendun.

Do not by this crib! The mattress support broke instantly on assembly and IKEA customer service has been completely worthless. Out only option now is to drive 45 minuted back to the store and wait in another hour long line to exchange an very defective and unsafe product.

My wife today spent over 1 hour waiting for an Ikea employee on the phone between two calls (she had to hang up the first time because she couldn't wait any longer) to order a bed. I suspect Ikea will suggest this is a marked improvement from those customers complaining about 1+ wait per call. It's not an improvement; it's the same company disrespecting its customers' time to squeeze out more profits by paying fewer employees. By the end of it, my wife was so frustrated she concluded, "I hate Ikea."

THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!! THEY HAVE SCHEDULED A DELIVERY 4 TIMES AND HAVE FAILED TO SHOW UP! WE WERE RESCHEDULED FOR TODAY - FIRST STOP - AND IT"S 11:30AM...STILL NO ONE! I CALLED OVER AN HOUR AGO AND WAS TOLD THEY WOULD BE HERE IN 30-40 MINUTES (TO DRIVE 20 MINUTES AWAY) STILL NOTHING!!!!!!!!! I"M GOING TO FILE A REPORT WITH EVERY AVENUE I HAVE AVAILABLE TO ME!

We ordered a bureau for my daughter's room. The appeal of this piece of furniture was its size and price. The order arrived in a timely manner and had to be assembled. Last night while putting clothes away realized that the whole bureau had popped all it's support screws and pins. The *** thing fell apart sideways. WHAT A PIECE OF ***.

I have 2 brand new Galant fine cabinets. They were professionally assembled. I set both cabinets to the same combination. I tested 1 cabinet once and it worked fine. After several days of using the cabinets without locking them, I finally had a need to lock them. But the next day when I tried to open them, the combination wouldn't work. The combination is my birthday so I'm not forgetting the number. Like other people, I called IKEA and they simply said bring the file cabinets to the store. There's no way I can lift a 3 drawer full file cabinet. And if I hire someone to move it for me, I could potentially purchase a new cabinet with the same amount of money.

To whom it may concern, My name is Tim, I live in the Cincinnati area. As you know there is a store north of Cincinnati on I-75 (Westchester) to be exact. My daughter was going off to college so we thought it would be a good idea to visit Ikea for her storage and room decorating needs. We dropped a boat load of cash, as well as some credit card purchases. During her move in the welcome mat I had purchased was too long. The display that was hanging up showed a smaller mat and I thought that was the one I bought.

I had a delivery from ikea and the delivery men that came had no covers for there shoes, as i had just had new carpets they had to leave it in my hallway, the delivery men said the assemblers would take it upstairs for me, but the assemblers are not insured to to take them upstair, just dont think they could be bothered to take them up, plus the delivery man made a racist remark saying he hadnt got his usual english work man with him, ikeas delivery service is not very reliable and just not satisfactory, they said it was my fault for not letting them upstairs with wet sluggy shoes on rediculous really, not helpful at all

This was queen size bed frame that was ordered for Christmas & I got on Dec 17. I was told no one needed to be present & that Fedex will carefully place in my covered carport. I was there withing 10 minutes of delivery. I noticed boxes were all beat up & looked like had been wet. Old dirty tape wrapped around broken areas of boxes. It was a mess. Neighbor said Fedex just dumped it. I used my debit card so actual money was deducted from checking account. Soon after I called IKEA. After two attempts (45 minute wait) & one hung up: Finally they tell me ''so sorry.. but we cannot pick up until January 8th''. It is only Dec 17.

Poor customer service in the purchase and installation of our new IKEA kitchen. First an 8 week delay with back orders. Then delays of kitchen installers arriving. No notification of installation date. If we had not called to see where they were, no one would have contacted us that the time had been delayed by a week. Then they damaged the product, and left a rookie installer alone, so it took longer than scheduled. In fact it is still not completed. Then when cupboard doors were damaged, the installers told us we needed to order and pay for new doors and they would reimburse us. Then the salesperson made an error in inputting the square footage, so the estimate was incorrect. So we may have chosen a different company due to cost.

"On 8/18/18 I purchased a sofa at Ikea Brooklyn. I was assured twice that it was in stock. Delivery was scheduled for today. An promised 8/15 confirmation call from the delivery company never came. I spent all of yesterday trying to reach Ikea or deliverer by phone. At 11PM I was told that the sofa was out of stock. At 6PM Ikea e-mailed me what looked like an order confirmation, but turned out to have a very faint, bluish printing “CANCELLED”. I spent a whole afternoon, 20 dollars on the ferry (went with a friend) and I now have no sofa, no time and I am terribly frustrated because I made a lot of arrangements in my apartment in order to accommodate the "confirmed" arrival of the sofa. I would advise NYC dwellers not to waste the day of travel to Ikea’s remote location, but shop close to home, where you can at least return promptly to the store with your complaints. My friend who teaches at the Business department of New Jersey’s premier University was quite shocked as well and plans to use the above story as an example of how not to conduct business.

I am sure I am not the only one to have this experience, but about 3 months ago, I bought over $1000 worth of shelving from IKEA. That may not sound like much, but in IKEA dollars, I walked out with a truckload. Should have known that if the product is priced that cheap, the product itself will be that cheap, and their customer service will also be cheap. I got home and the main piece on one of my shelves was totally destroyed. I immediately emailed customer service to request a replacement. After going through the ringer for several weeks, and each time I sent Ikea information from my receipt, images of the product, and them asking me for additional information, one email at a time, they finally agreed that they would send me a replacement part.

Today 7/18/2015 I was at IKEA to buy some furniture but I had to drop my kids at the play area. At the front desk I asked Rachel there employee what was the wait time and to begin with I got a very rude reply "45 min" she had the worse attitude. Well I ignored it and registered my son and daughter and informed her that my son was downstairs. To this she replied in the most impolite way" we can not hold a spot for you, if your son is not there then we will give the spot to others " again I ignored her attitude and very politely stated " ok" and continued to wait thinking I will be informed when it is our turn. But to my surprise 20 min later I hear her screaming " Mam, since your son is not here I have cancelled your spot your turn will be after 2 families" surprised I asked is the spot available, she states "no, it will be available in 10 min but I will have to give the spot to others" but all this while I have been waiting near the fron desk with my daughter who was also registered. This employee had the worst attitude.

I ordered some furniture for my house online. I paid for all the furniture and THEN they tell me that my furniture won't get to me for 3 weeks! Had I known this before I entered alllllll of my information then I wouldn't have even gotten it. But since I had already entered everything in I decided to just do it. So then the day before my order was to be delivered they called and gave me the 4 hour time window of when they would be there. Well, this was when I would be in class so I called to reschedule the time but there was over an hour wait.

I went ikea store to exchange an item. They said I need to call customer service to get reciept info. I've been waiting for a hour on the phone, still no agents pick up the call. Their customer service is really ineffient. Don't ever throw away your receipt! Their customer service is pretty useless if you were ever in that situation!

Well I say its been about 4 months since I filed a complaint with the Paramus store, I got the run around from customer service, the store manager and headquarters and nothing. After 10 plus emails of complaints my last one from the was that they were looking into the matter and would get back to me ASAP, lol what a joke, crickets. Yeah Ive completely cut the Paramus store out of list, I would rather go Walamrt, Kmart or Target before I shop at any of their store ever again.

I had a table and chairs from IKEA delivered to my home, the worst mistake. IKEA outsources their deliveries and the delivery person broke the side door of my home delivering the table and chairs. Once it was mentioned to the driver, he hands me a form with a number in New York (Yonkers) to call regarding any delivery issues. I did, the person on the other end of the phone states he will send me a claim form electronically. I fill it out and return it electronically the day I received it . I get confirmation that they received it , but that was 8 weeks ago and no response.

I found a cute couch online at Ikea and placed the order. Within a few days I get a email letting me know delivery will be between 9 a.m. and 9 p.m. Being an understanding soul I figure they will call me the night before with a shorter time frame. Sure enough the night before I get a automated calls letting me know that the delivery will be between 4 p.m. and 9 p.m. Problem is I have an appointment from 3 pm to 7 pm. So I call IKEA and wait on the phone for 90 minutes (alert #2 -- this speaks volumes of poor customer server) AND then they tell me I have to call the shipper (alert #3 -- screams out lack of ownership and dislike for working with the customer) so I wait on the phone for another 30 minutes to talk with the shipper. Net result is that the shipper cannot adjust the delivery order time. So which part of this story sound like a company that wants to pride itself on customer service?

Purchased Brimnes bed online. Delivery of 3 boxes was fine but during assembly realized I had the wrong boxes. They are marked with numbers. Should have received 1, 2, 3 and received 1, 3, 3. Note: every call to Ikea is over an hour wait time. Called, they apologized, set up new delivery and ... 2nd delivery had the same error - wrong boxes delivered. Called again and asked for free assembly or discount. No assembly available to online cuustomers (nice.) But they gave me 1/2 off delivery. Scheduled 3rd delivery but told them my blackout dates, as I was going on vacation. No problem, they said. I got a delivery date after my vacation. During my vacation, I get messages saying they will deliver on the original (3rd) delivery date, which is when I will not be home. I emailed and got a response saying, we have no information from Ikea about rescheduling. They told me to call Ikea. I said NO, I already called Ikea, don't deliver it. I get a text - "Text 'YES' if you are ok with the delivery date." I text "NO" and get a response "Thank you." Day of delivery, I get a call from the driver that they are close. I tell him I am not even in the state.

Ikea in Miami is an awesome store, but it's confusing. The weekends are crazy, I needed a lot if help and a worker named Kim in the media area was so helpful! She was patient and explained the process where I could understand it! Thanks Kim!

IKEA was hired to assemble and mount a piece of the entertainment center. they mounted the piece too low for the side panels and now because my daughter they mounted the piece too low for the side panels and now my daughter had the misfortune of believing that IKEA hires professionals went and signed the paper that it was completed and went and signed the paper that it was completed and now they will not send someone out to fix their mistake. They said I would have to pay again for someone to come out and fix it what a rip off I will never buy from IKEA again

I have been in Ikea twice this week, looking at bathroom cabinets and spoke with the salesperson and manager. I did not know if the cabinets would work with my plumbing and they were unable to answer my questions. I spoke with my plumber and he thought they would work. I returned a third time today to purchase them as I was told they were on sale in July. Upon my entrance there was n one to help for over a half hour. Also. They claimed the sale ended yesterday and no way were they going to honor the sale. I have never seen this in a large store be it Macy's, Home Depot, lowes, etc.

As I am currently passing the 30 minute mark on hold to speak with customer service to change an order, I find it interesting that when I chose "placing orders" in the automated system, a representative picked up immediately. It was only upon learning that I had already paid and just needed to make a change, that I was transferred and put on never-ending hold. I figured I'd use this time to document my experience. As I searched the internet to find a place to give feedback on my negative experience at Ikea.com, there were far too many choices.

Bought a wall full of large cabinets that come with doors. We arrange for delivery . The cabinet outer shells arrive but without the doors. We call and try to get them to deliver the cabinet doors but they flat-out refuse to do so, so we are forced to drive to the store to pick them up. We called before hand and arranged with the in-house staff to make sure that all 14 doors would be there. When we arrive, only 12 of the 14 doors are there. We talk to "David S" who tells us that "it is impossible" that we arranged to have the doors there for our pick-up. So not only are they incredibly incompetent, but they are calling us liars to our faces. This level of customer abuse is just astonishing! It is appalling.

have ordered over $800 worth of product from IKEA Brooklyn store and they delivered a dead plant with a broken pot, which I refused to accept for obvious reasons. It has been 2 months now since the delivery and I still did not get a $33 refund (for the plant and pot) from them. I have called customer service about 8 times now with wait time over an hour for each phone call. Each time I was assured that this issue will be resolved and someone will call me back. Guess what, I have yet to receive one callback from IKEA customer service.

We have gotten several furniture items from Ikea. It is good for the price point. You do have to make sure you put it together correctly and don't subject it to too much abuse. We were able to fix issues with a bed and a dresser drawer after too much weight was put on them. My son thought the dresser was for climbing and the bottom popped out of the drawer, but we were able to fix it. On one of the beds, the sides spread and the mattress fell through after I'm not sure how many kids (and adults?) decided to pile on it; we fixed that by pulling the sides together with a bracket.

I went to there a restaurant and checked out with my food I noticed a bill after I paid at the cash register that I was overcharged I informed the cashier at that time.she could not refund me the money that they overcharged me at the time she had to make me wait until a manager came over to process this I'm out I got very upset and said just forget everything and I want my money back I believe iKEA is overcharging all customers who was eating at the restaurant because this is a computer program in their registers

I went with my daughter to help her choose a sofa. She found one within 15 minutes. It took a few hours to actually purchase it! The employee didn't know the computer system, his colleague didn't want to help him and kept wandering off. He brought us to a different department, we followed. The price rang up high because the first guy who only works weekends forgot to include our family and friends card so we didn't get the sale price. We waited and waited for someone to void the sale. We were talked into just going to another register to get a refund for the difference. I just got a gift card in the mail for that refund when I assumed it would show up as a credit on my daughter's credit card. So I am still not done with that initial transaction.

Please Please Please! Everyone DO NOT buy anything in IKEA. Alright, my brother sleeps on our living room and he''s sofa bed had broken down recently so we needed a new one ASAP we looked and I found this cute and big sofa bed at ikea. Oh Boy! What a bad idea. So he goes to the closest store which is Brooklyn ikea in nyc. Within the 1st night of sleeping on the sofa bed he woke up with some sort of bites in he's legs and arms, at that time he didn't pay much attention only to find two weeks later that the sofa bed came with BED BUGS.YES! BED BUGS.

ordered a bed on line and the wording insinuated that it would be put together for the 300 dollar delivery ... which was more than the price of the bed .... it said for a fee set up and delivery ... when i punched in delivery it said 300 dollars and I (naively) will never happen again with any other company .... ordered the bed assuming it would be put together. when they arrived with the bed they said it was a drop off for the 300 dollars. i said i refuse it. tried to cancel with customer service. an hour on the phone and. extremely caustic customer service.

The clocks on the double oven lose at least 10 min per week. 1st time they came and assessed and made another appt to fix. 2 hrs into the 4 hr window they called and said the Co. that was to come out didn't fix clocks so rescheduled. 2nd X someone came & replaced a part. Still loses the same amount of X. Made another appt for a 4 hr window. 2 hrs into the 8-12am window got a call....said the tec got hurt, moved the appt to 2-4pm. At 4:30 no one yet. Called and now said 5-6pm.

I rented s pickup and drove 2 hours to pick up furniture for my daughter. The bed had missing hardware and instructions. When I called they said to drive and get it from the store. I indicated that I live out of town then they said it would be 2 days. Nothing happened. When I called back 6 days later ( each time you call you wait 30 minutes), they told me to call back because the systems was down. I asked to speak to the store manager, then they took my number and promised to call me and give me an update. That never happened. As of now no update (8 days later). IKEA has systemic problems stemmed from the top management down to the employees.

Drove to ikea (Centennial) last night for a countertop. Same girl who 'tried' to help us design a kitchen (sadly she knew less than we did) was the only one avail to help us. We showed her the silver countertop we wanted, but once again she ordered the wrong part number. 1-1/2 hours later, we open the ctn and see white with silver band. Seriously folks... the prices are great but the time spent in that obnoxious, oversized, ugly *** hole is repulsive and a waste if time if one values their time.
Customer service is the worst I've ever seen; horrendous is a desription that is too mild

I have shopping ikea cabinets for a long time and I can say that their costumer service is by far the worst in corporate America. If you need to return or get spear parts be prepared to wait for hours at the time.

After going through the process of having an IKEA "planner" ($199) design our kitchen in April IKEA sold us a kitchen. We live more than 20 miles from the closest IKEA but we travelled to IKEA and went through the process (after waiting over an hour) and bought the kitchen on May 5. Numerous pieces where "out of stock" and in the following weeks, and after checking daily, we have had to travel to IKEA seven times!!! to get out-of-stock items before the where sold to others. We still are missing parts that are not scheduled to arrive until the end of June.

When one calls to Customer Service, first of all it takes very long to get to talk to someone...sometimes it can be a wait of 45 mins to 1 hr. Then when you get someone it connects to some call center. The rep who picks up the call does not have any idea if you are asking about any product from the IKEA store near you, he/ she won't connect you to the store representative as well. There is nothing, nada, zilch help that you can get from customer service rep. It was very frustrating since he/she won't tell me about the item I was looking for from the IKEA store near me, which means I will have to drive to the store then what good is the customer service call for ?? Worst customer service experience !

I purchased a duvet and cover. Both in king size, Linnbloma style. The duvet is too large for the cover and folds over at the top inside the cover. Then it's too short in width and the cover material awkwardly hangs empty on one side . The enclosure for the cover does not stay closed and the over-sized duvet comes out constantly. The poorly designed closures flop open within minutes of replacing them. Im not happy with the design of this $129 cover and would like a replacement. It's completely unacceptable.

I went to the IKEA in Kent Washington with my boyfriend last night. We were looking for things to buy for our first house. We were both excited to pick things out, and naturally had a few questions. On multiple occasions employees were BEYOND rude and acted like we were bothering them with just a few small questions. Never want to come back!

I recently moved to America from London and all I wanted was to have a bed to rest my head. I bought a Brimnes bed frame which had drawers included as I thought that would be useful for me as sotrage space is tight in the new apartment. Little did I know the bed frame was impossible to set up, the screws do not fit in the correct holes, the wood is such poor quality that even if the nail did get it in would not stay, the drawers do not fit together well either.

You can't call the IKEA Pittsburgh store directly. You have to go through an 888 number and then they told me I had to go all the way to IKEA just to set up an appointment for a Kitchen Designer. I asked, you mean I have to travel 30 miles just to set up an appointment? I will be buying my Kitchen from another Kitchen store. Really IKEA? Really?

I ordered an item from IKEA to be delivered. An email stated that the delivery company would call me the night before to inform me of the four hour delivery window. A call came 30 minutes before they called again and said no one was there. (That's because I was at work, teaching a class, and had not had the opportunity to make arrangements because I never received a phone call the night before). When I tried to reschedule (after a 15 minute hold), I was told by a blatantly disinterested individual that I would be charged $50 by the delivery company for a reschedule. I said I would prefer to cancel my order.

I'm a loyal Ikea fan, am talking about a 30 year love affair as I'm European. I ordered a kitchen during the kitchen event and had to order some more cover panels and hinges. Lamar first of all made the mistake of charging me twice earlier this year and this resulted in weeks of phone calls to get the refund. I gave up and re-ordered during the Fall 2014 kitchen sales. I had a few items left to order and both Lamar and a supervisor named Marshall (from "The Escalation Team") refused to give me 20% off. I reminded them that Ikea is in fact a tax evading company that is registered as a non-profit in the Netherlands, that I am a single, disabled female with a spinal cord injury who could not have anticipated needing hinges and the cover panels earlier, and that the Akurum kitchen soon will be discontinued.

ikea contoured neck pillow "RÖLLEKA" has horrible chemical smell. absolutely toxic. paid $15.00- immediate strong odor and headache once the bag was opened. this is a copy cat of tempurpedic but tempurpedic does not smell at all. hoping this strong smell will dissipate. wow, my eyes are burning. unbelievable. my neck hurts and i feel like i'm in a formaldehyde factory. seriously. i wonder if i'm getting cancer as i type.

Ikea mattress policy is that you can return it if not happy within 90 days but they only give you store credit, and do not return your money. So we went to pick out a softer mattress (the first one was too firm) and they sold us one but then told us after we had paid more (because we bought a higher quality) that they were out of stock. The manager told us we could buy a "loaner" and when the one we wanted came in they would deliver it to us. So Ikea will have two rather than one used mattresses to resell and a highly pissed off customer because their corporate policy is inflexible.

I assume all IKEA stores are designed the same way. In Orlando, once you enter the store, it's not easy to exit. Multiple exit signs lead to locked doors. It's like a labyrinth. At times, I actually found myself going in circles. After 20 minutes in the store I just wanted to escape ... without purchase. When I finally found the "checkout and purchase exit" there were very few lanes that were open. The rest appeared unlit, locked and blocked. I waited in line - just to exit mind you.

I ordered a Barviken sink on line . It arrived badly broken. I called immediately to return it and have it picked up. I waited for 65 minutes to have them answer their customer service number. They gave me a reference number and told me they would send me the pick up date via email within 48 hours. My refund would be in the mail in 5-14 days. I assumed dependent on when Fed Ex picked up the item. We decided to drive the 12 hour round trip to the closest store to us to purchase another sink, rather than risk having another one arrive broken via Fed Ex.

I was helping my daughter furnish her first apartment and had many people point us towards IKEA. The E Palo Alto store was a revelation, so large, overwhelmingly so, actually. Well ater two plus hours we check out,, oops, wrong component 1 in two piece system, ok return with right one. We then need to pick up a couch at pick-up. We fpund out ticket was already listed in "pick order" We were impressed, for the last time. A rude clerk told my daughter to move our cart out of the way.

On January 26th I purchased a few items online. Over 2 weeks later when the estimated shipping date came and went I called. I was told that the items had been pulled but not yet shipped. Really? You still haven't sent them out over 2 weeks after I'd placed the order? I told them I wanted to cancel the order, but was informed that because the items had been pulled from the shelves that I could not cancel. I let them know I would contact Visa and cancel my order that way. Within minutes I received a shipping tracking notice from Ikea. Hmmmm, interesting. I thought I'd give them another chance.

What a horrible corporation. Three weeks ago, while shopping for our son's room, we purchased a number of items , including a light kit from IKEA - driving the 55 miles back home, our son was excited to have a better lighting system for his study area...... Instead, the light kit didn't function from the moment we opened the box. We immediately called the "customer service line and were promised an immediate replacement. Since then, we have called FIVE times with FIVE "Ticket" numbers - each of which was "lost".

Very irresponsible will never order from IKEA online again in my life. They gave me an estimate delivery date and when I call my order wasn't even out of the warehouse & everytime I call I get a new story. Highly upset NEVER AGAIN !

See attached photo , 2 1/2 hrs of waiting until a response !!! One shipment , we never received as forwarding agent stated we had not been at home , but we can prove it ! On top , we have a concierge service , which didn't see them either. Of course , we are requested to pay the shipping a second time ! The other shipment had missing and damaged items !

IKEA customer service is one of the worse out there. For the past year, I made close to $10k of purchasing from IKEA Brooklyn. Every single time there was a problem with the shipment: first, it delivered the wrong product, second- time of the delivery. The automatic recording was left yesterday afternoon, saying that my delivery is scheduled for today, between 4-8pm. My building doesn't allow to have deliveries after 5. Ok, I call the delivery- that say no can do- have to call IKEA to reschedule.

At this moment that I am submitting a review, there are 539 complaints and 1 resolved. I guess that this sums up just about how much IKEA cares about your satisfaction once they have your money. So I bought a lamp one month ago and it no longer works. I called IKEA 'Customer Service' and the b***** told me I had to buy a new one in the 'as is' department for parts. Really? They can't even STAND BEHIND THEIR OWN PRODUCT? WTF. My store used to be so crowded and now it is a ghost town. They only had 2 registers open. Serves them right.

We placed an order for all new cabinets from IKEA. They ran out of drawer faces as we placed order. IKEA won't ship the item and has been uncooperative in helping get the missing piece. We've tried contacting the closest store and warehouse and get the run around. Complete chaos. They won't reserve pieces or guarantee they will ever be available. We now have a $4000 kitchen cabinet set with missing parts.

O ordered an office desk online to be delivered to my home. When the merchandise arrived one of the boxes had been dropped and the edge was crushed AND there were only 3 or 4 boxes delivered. The missing box were legs for the desk. When I asked when the legs would be delivered, the reply was "Sometime next week..." I don't think so. I turned my wife loose on them! LOL. We rejected the delivery and immediately called IKEA customer service. After being on hold for 36 minutes someone answered the phone and I was "transferred" to another department. On hold again for 22 minutes. THAT person placed me on hold for 9 minutes and FINALLY I got a refund authorization number.

Tried to return 2 trash bins that were the wrong size. Was within 2 weeks of purchase and had the receipt. IKEA wouldn't refund my money because even though my husband and I have the same credit account, the original payment was on his card and I only had my card with me. I'm calling bs on this- every other store processes returns to the original form of payment without needing a physical card, and I'm sure Ikea can process online returns without a physical card swipe. This restriction serves no purpose but to avoid allowing returns. It was a 45 minute drive to get there, plus I'd have to get my husband to go since if they are that strict about the card they probably require him to sign for his own card, so I just took the lame store credit.

IKEA's furnitures come in multiple pieces. While you purchased the first few pieces and waiting for the others to come, they discontinue the missing items. Do not believe in their claim that you can piece your furniture together by buying their pieces. It is a scam.

I've recently bought the Brimnes twin bed frame. The thing that is bothering me about it is that the two drawers don't fit the frame. I tired following the instructions as best as I can. After finishing the bed frame and making the drawers, it didn't fit the actual bed frame. It's starting to *** me off because I can't figure out why the drawers keep falling off the frame rails.

I HAVE HAD A MATTRESS FROM IKEA FOR TWO YEARS, THREE WEEKS AGO OUT OF NO WHERE A BULGE STARTED TO DEVELOP IN THE AREA WHERE MY LEGS USUALLY REST. I TRIED SEVERAL TIMES TO GET A CALL BACK FROM THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE DEPARTMENT, THEY TELL YOU THAT YOU WILL RECEIVE A CALL BACK IN 24 TO 48 HOURS; I NEVER DID AND NEITHER DID MY GIRLFRIEN. SO I TOOK IT DIRECTRLY TO THE STORE IN SUNRISE FLORIDA. AN EXTRMELY LARGE MAN WHO REMINDED ME OF FAT *** FROM THE MINI ME MOVIE TELLS ME THAT THE WARRANTY IS VOIDED BECAUSE THERE IS A SLIGHT TINT AS IF THERE HAS BEEN SWEAT. I REQUESTED THE TERMS OF THE WARRANTY BUT THEY WERE DENIED TO ME AND I WOULD ONLY BE HANDED A HIGHLIGHTED PORTION THAT STATES THAT ANY!!! STAIN WILL DENY THE WARRANTY.

BUYERS BEWARE I am usually a pretty happy IKEA customer, but this time they took it too far. I purchased a $400 INGATORP dining room set (which came in two boxes). Upon delivery, the second box (leaf extension) was damaged. I took pictures, emailed, attempted to call, and went to the store, but nobody was willing to help. I am literally at home on Christmas with a table that had a defect that IKEA is unwilling to restore/refund/exchange for a new one.

I am surprised IKEA still has so many customers. It is the worst consumer experience I ever had. They always are missing parts of your order, don't refund for this which is their error and deliver stuff that you didn't even order and then you are stuck with a huge box in your living room. It is the most poorly run company out there and there is a huge problem with their supply chain. Executive heads should roll... They need new blood that knows what they are doing or they should be shut down. I, for one will never shop there again.

Since I have no way of not giving zero stars they get one (though it pains me to give them anything) Warning to all men! Under no circumstances should you ever attempt to enter IKEA store. If you prefer opposite gender and have slightest trace of testosterone in your body I promise, you will hate your experience. Here is my experience. My wife suckered me into going with her and our baby (14 months old) to Ikea this morning. We knew what we wanted so idea was to just get in, pick what we wanted, pay and get on with our day. How complicated could that be? I guess more complicated that we thought.
Fire safety hazard always have the gates locked to get out why???

We paid Kitchen Helpers, inside our Portland Ikea store, but they did not finish when scheduled and in-fact have no-showed on us twice. They have also caused us to lose income from work by calling the night before, 12 hours, our first scheduled day and saying they would not be there. After promising that they would still get the job done when it was scheduled, they did not show up or call the last day of install. When we did contact them, they scheduled us three weeks out to finish and then no-showed.

I placed an order to be shipped. I placed only 1 order. Within days of the delivery arrival, a second, identical product arrived. I contacted IKEA about the order. They said that it was a mistake and would pick it right up. 3 weeks later it had not been picked up. I contacted them again and they said that there was an IKEA issue that caused the 2nd order to be shipped and my card to be charged twice. They also said that the charge that they quoted for a product pickup was incorrect. A plain case of no one knowing what is going on. My card got charged for a pickup fee. Today they told me that they would not refund the pickup fee that was charged because of their double-order mistake. That was from a supervisor.

I purchased three items on 06/05/2014 totaling $560.42. The items were 8025**** x2 and one 4022**** which is two bookshelves and one piece that joins them together. These items were delivered to my home and I paid a fee of $60.77 to do so, all charged on my credit card. Shortly after receiving these items I found that the quality was not satisfactory and decided to return them for a refund. I spoke to Kenya Jones from the Ikea resolution team who processed my case and told me someone would contact me within 48 - 72 hours about picking up the items. The only question mark was that I had already assembled one of the items but she said she would note that and it could be discussed when somebody called me.
Lines at IKEA Charlotte Ridiculous!!!! No customer show be expected to wait like this. Won't be back!!

Not only did they charge my credit card way before my order even shipped, they never shipped one of my items. After contacting them (and holding for 48 minutes + on multiple occasions), I was finally told my table would ship. Well low and behold, the table showed up, and it was the wrong one. It was about $80 cheaper than the one I had already paid for. I called them. They said it would take 10-15 days for a refund. It's been 13 days and I still have no refund, nor (after multiple email attempts), has anyone sent me a return label to send back the WRONG table. I am sick of trying to contact them and I want my money back and the wrong table gone. I just filed a complaint with the BBB and will be filing a dispute with my credit card company as well.

I too have never taken the time to write a review, but my current situation needs to be told so that hopefully someone can avoid this same hassle. I paid for next day delivery service on October 5th, the reciept and delivery confirmation printout stated that my delivery would be in route on the 6th from 5-9. I thought it was perfect because I was available that day. My total purchase came out to $1,475.68. On the 6th at around 7:30pm I called to check the status of delivery, she placed me on hold to contact the dispatcher of the delivery company. After taking me off hold she told me that she had spoken to them directly and they'd be at my location within 45 minutes. I waited an hour... After that I called back and a different rep picked up. This time stating my delivery was not scheduled until the next day October 7th. I tried explain my conversation with the previous rep and how she told me they were 45 minutes away, and all he could do is over talk me and say "well mam there's nothing I can do". I demanded to speak to his boss, he told me he'd have the boss call me back.

I ordered 1 center table and 2 side tables along one more item for kids with Ikea. After a week I received a mail that the order has been shipped and will receive by Tuesday [10/6/2014] as per tracking number of FedEx. I didn't receive this order till Thursday and the date of delivery was N/A on FedEx. I called Ikea customer service for the same and 40 minutes of hold I received a response that "Due to some reason your order was called back from FedEx by Ikea. Please let us know if you want us to ship it again or you want a refund". This is the response which I got when I called them. They didn't have the courtesy to inform the consumer.
IKEA Paramus worst return department . No urgency what's so ever. Poorly staffed.
IKEA ONE OF THE WORST COMPANY TO SHOP IN THE USA

IKEA planner measured wrong Bought a full kitchen. And mentioned I want to make a counter top desk. Would need a cabinet to hold my printer. Emailed her dimensions of the printer and she ordered what she said would fit. Not I paid for the install and went to place the printer in the cabinet and won't fit. She looked at the outside dimensions not inside where the printer would go. I have emails to prove she's said would fit. When I told her she said woops! And $130 for the right cabinet and $495 to install because that's the min.

I ordered a 96x84 flat white sheet. First off i find this huge box on my porch from Ikea. I open it and there is a sheet set inside this huge box. Next it was not even close to what i ordered. It is a queen size sheet with black design all over it. Then they did not enclose an invoice in the box. I have never ordered from ikea before and i never will again. I tried calling them and was on hold for an hour and still no one came to the phone. Then just a few minutes ago i tried to send them an email, but the email address is unknown.

I put one star since i can´t put zero... worst experience ever on an online store, i bought some furniture more than a month ago, i was missing the biggest one and the most expensive at the moment of the delivery, and the delivery guy hit another piece with a door so now is broken, after sending them 40 emails and calling 5 or 6 times for two weeks after that, now, a month later i don´t even know anything from them, and the funny thing is that they seem to hace check my emails since they sent something else last week but it was something i already had and don´t need.

I purchased some furniture 09/17/14. arrived 10/10/14. They forgot to send the dresser so I called back 10/11/14 the lady was helpful and ordered the dresser. It has been almost 3 weeks and I haven't received a status update so this morning 10/24/14 I called and have been on hold for 2 hrs!!! What is going on Ikea??? I will never purchase from them again and will make sure potential customers know about my encounter with Ikea... still on hold.

Well you get what you pay for 2 for 1.99. I am a chef and have a collection of cutting boards. Even some of these cheap flexible ones. They all have their different uses. It looks like a serrated blade was used on this type to get particles coming off. KeyMaster is correct a sharp blade and a light cut will leave only a mark not a shredded mess. The ones I use most, for possible cross contamination, are the thin hard white nylon type. Use it and get it away from your prep area. Wood boards are porous and you can't put them in hot soapy bleach water to sterilize so don't cut meats on them.

I bought several peices of furniture from ikea (malm unit, micke desk, shelf unit, hemnes chest) and all of them are emitting an awful chemical smell that wont go away. I tried letting it air out for weeks and spent days painting all open surfaces with a wood sealant. Nothing will make the smell go away. Awful quality furniture and $450 down the drain. Will never buy anything there again. Had to take all the furniture out of my room and get rid of it.

IKEA sold me a air purifier that was going to be discontinued and now I cannot buy filters for it and was tricked into buying the worthless air purifier. Talk to the manager but did not resolve anything just pretty much told me you bought it and you're *** without saying it. And by the way the manager did not look presentable to me she look like an alcoholic drug addict.

My daughter moved to Chicago August 15th and I ordered furniture for her online. We arranged to have it delivered for $99. When the delivery was made there were two of the same boxes for her bed. We were unable to put the bed together with two boxes of side rails. Therefore she has been sleeping on the floor. We attempted to return them to the Chicago Ikea and were told we could not because it was an online order. I then spoke with customer service and they promised a delivery of the correct box. That did not happen. I called again and was assured that the correct box would be delivered. Finally received notice that the delivery would be made on September 10.

I usually do not take the time to make complaints, however this one certainly warrants one. I paid for home delivery of a very large wardrobe yesterday, all in all spending just under $1000.00. The reason I paid for home delivery was because the unit was much too big and heavy for one person to carry. Two of the boxes were 9 feet long, 4 feet wide (approx) containing 4 huge pieces of particle board that was very heavy. The delivery guy showed up alone, and I had to help him carry this stuff up 4 flights of stairs, thus doing exactly what I did not want to do. So essentially I PAID to carry my own furniture upstairs.

Wondering.. why is there an option online to check product availability when it is nowhere accurate?!?! I drove 3 hours to the closest ikea... thinking I could purchase an item for my childs' Christmas. Once i got there... and let me add.. I checked availability online prior to going... The item I was wanting to purchase was out of stock. I asked about the item second of another family. The rep gave them a print out to go to the self pick area to check and I asked for one as well...

Unless you can walk out the IKEA store with your purchase (check its not damaged and all the pieces are there before you leave) don't shop there. Customer service via phone is the absolute worst. The average wait time I have found to talk with someone is 1 hour. My last wait time was 1 hour 35 minutes. This is totally appalling. A $50 desk, that took two weeks to be delivered - damaged. Two weeks after the initial delivery still waiting for the replacement. Ikea claim it will be another 7 days.

Store is poorly laid out and no one seems to know where anything is. The shopping baskets are a workout in itself trying to push them around. All four wheels turn, not just the front ones and people were running into things and other people and having to hold onto the back and side just to guide them. A lot of the things my wife picked out we didn't but because they told us at the checkout that they were just for display even though she picked them off a stack on the shelf. We spent all that time and when my wife tried to pay them they said they didn't accept checks. There is no one to sack your purchases but then why would there be.

We placed an order for a children's desk and chair. 5 days later the chair shows up. I called IKEA and they told me looks like the desk was misplaced and they will issue a refund. This all happened end of July. By August I haven't seen the refund as promised. they assured me it's in the "pipeline" and should see the refund in just a few days. To make a long story short, it's September 4th and still no refund.

Ordered several furniture items. Bookcases came, TV stand came, half of a couch came. Waited five days for the delivery company to call and say when they were coming with the second half. Never called. Called IKEA customer service - 35 min wait time then disconnected. Tried again, reached good old Bob after 32 min who said he couldn't help me but After Sales Web could. Ashley answered and said she would contact delivery and set another date and email the details. A week later she hadn't. Called back (28 minutes) and another CSA said delivery company hadn't called them back. She would take care of it. Never heard back.

Same old story. Missing pieces and no customer service after the sale. I schlepped to IKEA in Brooklyn with no car; I bought several pieces of furniture including a couch. I waited three weeks for delivery. Assembled couch; found out one whole box with the arms of the couch was missing. (How could Brooklyn let me buy half a couch, or deliver half a couch??) I have been on the phone three times with total hold time of over 2.5 hours. Promised new delivery; promised fed. ex. box to me.

I bought from the Pittsburgh store. It says at the loading dock that they will help you load. Waited 15 minutes. No help. Went to returns desk. Told some guys in green vests are on the lot to help. Went back out. Waited another 20 minutes. No help. All customers are loading their own or getting help from another customer. Called the national number to complain. Put on hold bY the computer for another 15 minutes. Went back into the store and asked for the manager. She came eventually...with an attitude.

I have bought a dresser in Ikea on July 2nd. It came damaged. Asked for a replacement that also came damaged. After inumerous attemps to contact customer service (1-888 number just hangs up on you), i was finally able to contact on Aug 19th (almost 2 months later). They said they tried to contact me and nobody answered the phone. Well, no unanswered phone calls in my phone and with my email, work phone and cell phone in hand, how hard can it be to contact someone these days?

NO ONE ANSWERS THEN PHONE, WHEN I GOT AN ANSWER 1 HOUR(YES 60 MINUTES) LATER I WAS TOLD THE DELIVERY WAS NOT SETUP RIGHT BY THE MOST INCREDIBLY RUDE GIRL NAMED LISA. SHE SAID I WAS OUT OF LUCK AND HAD TO GO BACK TO THE STORE TO FIX. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? IN STORE GREAT EXPERIENCE, BUT WOULD NEVER EVER RECOMMEND DELIVERY SERVICE OR NEEDING A PART AFTER LEAVING THE STORE. HORRIBLE!!!! TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE!

No matter how many times i called the 4532 # and jumped through the hoops when i finally got to the part where they were supposedly connecting me the call dropped instantly... EVERY TIME! SO I kept at it and finally got someone at a Mass. store and she put me through to the right dept. and NOONE COULD TAKE MY CALL RIGHT NOW! seriously? Can't they afford a full time customer service problem solver? I am DONE with IKEA.

They never delivered my Applaro storage bench ($70 plus $30 for shipping), I called right away. They made me wait for hours on the phone trying to reach the customer service. After getting my info they promised somebody will call me back within 48 hours to resolve the problem. Guess what - they NEVER called be back. So i tried to reach the customer service again. After a huge wait and listening of the advertisement I got the customer service again, they transferred me to the "resolution center" who NEVER picked up the call. This is an Unacceptable way of doing business.

I purchased a China and special ordered doors for it ,hand picked flowers at The Bayamon Location selecting colors and asking sales associate to note observations on my request,It is well known IKEA delivering at a 100 percent is impossible.with that said Delivery was made 3 days after purchase ,and without correct flower selection.Furniture was delivered without assembly instructions enclosed,is this a mere tactic to force clients to hire their assembly service? Though I called numerous times prior to delivery to make sure I was getting the doors I had ordered ,- and IKEA personnel assured me I would I waited delivery ,noticed doors not in boxes called 11 times to report it ,I did not get doors by the time of assembly which was a whole week later than my purchase date ,mind you that it was cancelled impromptu and change on the day and time of assembly 3 times .i have now a china with no doors and as per customer service one of the managers refuses to own up to it and send doors which I paid for deliver it service I paid for and far less assemble it .I will have to take this further to have it resolved I will never shop at IKEA again .I am appalled at their awful planning of logistic and such mediocre execution and a far poorer customer service training at the Bayamon Puerto Rico Location .

We have bought 1 couch and 1 love seat 5 weeks ago and have the following issue that Ikea has not responded to: 1. rude and angry installer - we have white carpet throughout the house. He was not willing to take precautions as not to dirty the carpet. Only after I told him I was going to call the Ikea store in Portland, OR did he listen to my request (10 min. into the conversation). He wouldn't give me his name either.

I bought two sofa beds last Fall from IKEA. The product was discontinued a short time thereafter. I know this happens, but the fact they knew months, if not years in advance of the line ending, and failed to warn customers that extra slipcovers would no longer be offered, makes me crazy. In my case, it was about three months. I would have bought two or three instead of waiting to change my room look. It’s not like they didn’t have my address or email. They delivered the sofas and I’m a member of their “family”. If this is an example of how they treat family, I shudder at the thought of what they do to strangers.

Terrible. They delivered 15 boxes, 3 of which they were supposed to take back with them because I cancelled the order. However, they only took 1 out of 3, and I found myself left with 2 boxes/half a furniture. I called, rescheduled for a pick-up. The delivery people came, and only called my secondary number and not my primary one. My secondary number is secondary for a reason; when I asked why they didn't call the main number, they said, they don't have to call my number at all.

ordered bedroom furniture for my disabled cousin early May. I had to save her money for a year to be able to afford it. IKEA has "lost" our order 4 times, I kid you not! I have 4 different order numbers because they keep cancelling/losing our order. No calls for delivery, no return calls to my questions, the shippers have tried to help, to no avail. I've spent hours on hold trying to talk to someone. It is now July 7th and we still have no furniture, but IKEA has the money!

I was a weekly customer of ikea Abu Dhabi for 6 years, then I moved to a new house and needed to buy new furniture for 11.000 aed but they asked me for 200 dollars to bring them home and some furnitures were out of stock , so I cancelled and bought all from the Home Centre. Then few months ago I bought from ikea some vacuum storage bags , after a week went again to buy some more and the usual word was said " out of stock " it has been 7 months now that I visit ikea weekly for the same bags and I get the same answer.

I've ordered in the store before and had ok experiences in the past. This in regards to an online order which after looking up after TONS OF OTHER PEOPLE HAVE HAD! I'm incredibley disappointed in the company as a whole. First I ordered 2 items the kallex shelving unit and the hallex dresser. The date and day did not match on what I clicked on so it was scheduled for the wrong day. I was told in my e-mail that I would be contacted by the delivery company 24 hours in advance... I was contacted 1 hour in advance and proceeded to call Ikea and spend 45 minutes on the phone TWICE which they arranged a reshipping with A FIFTY DOLLAR FEE.

I went to ikea and spent over three hours and bought nothing. We wanted to purchase a cabinet for our closet. After spending 30 minutes trying to locate the boxes to assemble we found out they were out. We settled for another unit but want glass doors. My wife found one she liked. We asked an attendant and he checked for us. He said the door was dropped and would never get anymore. Why is it on display? Another 30 minutes. We noticed another cabinet we would settle for.

Placed an order online. The delivery never arrived. The delivery logistics company contracted by IKEA for its central Texas deliveries - JW Logistics - lied daily about delivering the merchandise - this went on for three (3) days, at 4pm on the third day of no delivery and being lied to again, I cancelled the order. I then tried to contact IKEA to no avail - due to higher than normal call volume - I was placed on hold for 20+ minutes on three (3) separate occasions and still never spoke to a CSR before being disconnected.

Kitchen ordered from IKEA was projected to arrive June 13. Heard nothing and called IKEA (biting nails as contractor was already waiting to assemble and install) and after waiting, contacted IKEA to be told that - whoops - it will actually come the 20th. Ugh -- I have the place rented for July, so now we will have to scramble, but will make it work. Long story short -it didn't arrive June 20th as IKEA's delivery partner, Urban Express, is a total rip-off, f-up co. Text indicating a delivery widow were apparently sent in error as the items never found their way to the truck that day. Four hours lost from work and contractor is now indicating that July 1st completion date is going to be difficult. Same thing happens June 21st. Lots of screaming, teeth-gnashing and apologies ensue and I am PROMISED that the items will arrive on the 22nd (Sun) only after I tell them that a later date is unacceptable and that I already have paid a contractor for two days that he's done nothing. Did they show up the 22nd? No. Lied to once again and the blame game continues between IKEA and Urban Express.

The assembly team from Ikea failed to arrive. I will try to cancel the $600 payment for the service through the credit card but cannot gain access to Ikea in any way. Each call to Ikea customer service had a wait time over 30 minutes and then, after speaking with someone at least, I was given a new number to call in one case and call dropped in the other. It is impossible to seek a refund because there is no way to submit the request online or to get through on the phone. Everyone understands that this is a discount company and is light on service.

This is by far the worst delivery experience I've ever encountered and contrasts starkly with my experience at Macy's. I ordered a couple of furniture items at Ikea a few weeks ago. First, the delivery date was three weeks out for fairly popular and always in-stock items. Second, the driver did not follow my delivery instructions. Third, he refused to attempt a drop off 10 minutes after his first failed attempt. Fourth, I got a 35 minute wait to get a customer service representative on the phone. Fifth, he wasn't able to resolve the issue and punted me off to another team. As of now, I do not have my shipment and have no idea when and how this will get resolved.

I planned to order approx $2500 worth of furnishings (sofa, chair, bed, mattress, etc) from Ikea Pittsburgh. I emailed them the order three weeks ahead of time so I could guarantee a specific delivery date. My email contained the name of each item, size, color, article number, along with a picture of the item I copied from Ikea's website. Prior to placing the order, I checked on Pittsburgh's site that they had these items in stock. Things went downhill from here on Ikea's end. The next day, Home Shopping emailed me stating one item was not carried by the store. No big deal for me, I picked another item.

Ikea sucks the staff is useless and lazy, I asked for a product to be brought down because it was out of stock and they still have more on the top, they wouldn't do it because their reason was they have to do it tomorrow cause they have to bring the forklift to the floor? While the entire time I was staring at the forklift.

I ordered my purchase to be delivered. They said they had 3 delivery windows and someone would call in the morning to confirm time. No call ever came, so I called them, after waiting for over 45 minutes for someone to answer the phone, I finally had a women tell me it was on the truck, but had no idea when it would arrive. They told me the delivery company hadn't set a time yet, so clearly, there are not 3 windows, but 1, the one where they deliver when they want to...

I placed an online order and was told i would recieve an e-mail confirmation with order number and tracking information. The funds were taken out of my bank account and i never received any e-mail and never was given an order number. I tried to find information about the order on the website since I had to "register" to place the order - nothing, my cart was empty and there was no order history.

Spent 1800 on new beds, dressers, lamps, the whole works really. King mattress was too big for our car, so delivery for 99.00, plus a picking fee of 40. Ok, so it goes. The day comes, the truck arrives about the middle of the predicted time slot. Then, the three guys on the truck say, we can only put it in one place, if you want it in different rooms, we need cash to place it. We had 39 boxes on that truck, no way it would fit in one room! I called BS and said, take it all upstairs if you are playing that game. I carried most of the boxes, excluding the mattress and box springs. Its a scam I could do without. Then, they stood around after I hauled in the last box waiting for a tip.

Bought the slipcovered sofa. Looked OK in the store. It arrived in several small boxes. A giant mess. The delivery guys wanted me to sign the delivery paperwork before unloading the boxes. They didn't want to let me look inside to assure the right item. I insisted on looking inside the boxes. Didn't even look like a sofa. Had many many small heavy boxy things that had to be put together by a he-man with professional tools. JUNK.
Deliver service missed an item- huge run around getting item- customer service= F.

I tried placing an order online and at every step of the way, they have ruined the order in the following way: 1. Cancelled my order and blamed my bank when it was their billing department's fault 2. The automated online service hung up on me multiple times 3. The employees could not transfer me to the appropriate department 4. When actually delivered, they damaged a piece of the order so I could not build my shelving unit

I got a desk at IKEA and they the wrong drill bit size for all the holes. way too small drill bits they used. Maybe this works for the cheap plywood stuff but when your using solid wood size it up guys. I also had to buy non standard nails because their nails strip from basic screwdriver friction. I feel sorry for the single mom who buys here, and doesn't have the hammer drill and nails handy thinking quick assembly. Just some quality nails and correct sizing would probably work wonders for repeat customers and returns i am sure. Other then that the desk idea wasn't that bad.

Ikea has a Refund Policy stated on the back of the Register Receipt written for Law School Graduates, not consumers. No wonder they would want to tell you what they will and won't do. Every modern store will refund your returns to the Credit Card used for the purchase without any hassles. - NOT Ikea. The Store Manager told me they have antiquated equipment and use outdated software, so in order to give you a Credit Card refund they need the actual CC used for the purchase. If you don't have the CC in hand, they will just give you a Store Credit, so they can keep you money longer.

This place is disgusting just because the Manager by the name of Jasmine has no customer relations instruction, laughs at a disable customer and does not even apologize for the cashiers actions, who for the record she declined to give her name to me when I wanted to file a complain and this "manager" Jasmine declined to give me her name as well. Everything started when my Mother is online and she is putting our shopping on the table so the cashier could scanned, the cashier never greeted us and she had a nasty attitude an earlier customer left a set of lamps that he did not wanted and this unprofessional and nasty cashier instead of asking my Mother, who is disabled, if that item belonged to her she started screaming and her and being nasty and did not listen to my Mother trying to explain that the lights did not belong to us, then I arrived with a frame so I ask her the price and she get enrage, sorry is not my fault that there was nobody on the frame dept and on top of that the place was filthy and most of the items upside down and was unable to check the price and in a rush to get back in the line, then i hand her my Ikea Family card and she gave me a lecture that the card has to be handed and when and why and....oh God why this "professional cashier" did not ask the card at the very beginning when technically she has to, of course she didn't because she was too mad to even greet us, also im semi-paralyzed and it took me a little bit for me to take out my keys and i try to explain this to her and she stated "I DON NOT CARE YOU SHOULD GIVE ME THIS AT THE BEGINNING" so i ask to see the sign that states that and she tells me enough and give me this and softly states a racist remark towards my health situation and my accent and i scream at her and demanded to see the manager that i was not going to tolerate to be insulted by her and i wanted to see the manager, her coworker a big guy with glasses calls the Police Officer but he never did anything to stop her coworker from insulting and being racist to my mother and I, when the Officer arrives he ask what is going on to us and I have to tell you he was a very nice and caring Police Officer, I know that many people sometimes is not lucky, but this officer was caring and had compassion for our situation and he even try to explain to the "manager " Jasmine but this manager did not care, im not sure why she was so racist, she declined to listen to us, stating "THE CASHIER TOLD ME ENOUGH, DO YOU HAVE MONEY COME HERE TO THIS OTHER CASHIER AND PAY" and I was in shock so the officer ask her to be nicer and she did not even listen to him, at this point my Mother starts crying for all this discrimination and injustice so we told this so called "manager" (who should read a dictionary to understand what customer service stands for, because her lack of this service makes her not to be the proper person to treat customers AT ALL), to keep this stuff, the officer kept being so nice and told us to buy it since we did the line and we wanted the items and i explain that even do i need them i was not going to enjoy any of them since we were discriminated and nastly treated, the cashier treated people from her race cordially and with an smile and because we are not from the same race she was from minute 1 rude and nasty, is not my fault that i do not look like her, but i treated as equals and she was still nasty and unprofessional, so sad that we left the store and my Mother was crying all the way home, this should not happened if the people working here should know how to deal with customers instead of treating people like if they are running a gang, they need to re-evaluate who they are and not being so ignorant and unpolite to their customers.

I have been to two IKEA stores to purchase the Docksta table. Tempe store said it's in stock so I drove from Albuq., NM, to pick-up. To my dismay and after spending several hundred dollars, table was not in stock. Because I was new to the whole IKEA store, I thought, "my bad luck." I then drove to visit my daughter at college in Texas. I thought I would try my luck again and looked online to see if the table was in stock. Web said the store in Frisco, TX, had three in stock.

Several couple of months ago, we purchased $5,000+ in IKEA Furniture for a new business. We generally like the quality and finish of the furniture. They did a great job of picking the items and delivering them to our business location. A hand-full of pieces we purchased used a 3 number combination lock which we bought purposely to provide modest protection of some documentation. That said, we were never able to get the locks to work and in fact, locked ourselves out of two filing drawers and one large credenza with sliding doors. We had to take the furniture back to have it opened. We attempted to do this on the phone with the local store but they were no help. We attempted through email to corporate customer service and they were no help.

I got sucked into the "oh my God, it's European, and it's here in the USA so we've all got to own an Ikea product, because if you don't you are a nobody" frame of mind that has been going around. Ikea has inferior products bottomline. I purchased THREE Jannsjo (sp?) table lamps. Each one had a lifespan of between 1 to 4 months. That's it. Customer service when notified had a cavalier attitude on all three contacts and gave the impression that they just didn't give a ***. Three weeks ago I purchased an Antifoni floor lamp from an online seller. He told me it was an LED LAMP, as he checked the Ikea website, because their was NO indication on the box what bulbs it even used. I double checked the site and sure enough, LED. OK, so we are good to go and I purchased for $80. I received the lamp, set it up and...wait a minute.....thia is NOT LED. It turns out it's a freaking HALOGEN, which neither I or the Seller could ever have known from the lack of description on the box. And lack of consumer information on Ikea's website. I will not have halogen in the house because they are too risky, and would never have purchased had I known it was hallogen. It's not the sellers fault, and not my fault. When I contsctrd Ikea about this Ikea customer service told me that they are not responsible for third party seller information. HELLOOOO? The seller and I both got the information from the IKEA WEBSITE. Again cavalier Ikea attitude. The seller waz gracious in refunding my money while allowing me to continue looking for a LED bulb that might work. The one bulb that had potential did not work. So I had to return the lamp.

I wanted to share my big disappointment with Ikea this evening. I relocated from CA to MA 2 weeks ago, and like every time I moved, I directly visited Ikea store to buy my furniture. As a frequent mover and having done this 4 times before, I think I can count myself a loyal Ikea customer. I would not even want to mention how I have advocated your products to my friends every time they complain about the quality. Last friday, I was excited to buy my furniture for my new apartment (bed frame, mattress, table, all necessary things not like a ceramic cup) and I scheduled delivery for Monday (today) between 6-10pm. Its a business day and all of us get busy with unexpected things; so that I called customer support to reschedule. However, they asked me to visit the store to reschedule since I was late to let them know. There was no way for me to visit them, because I had an unexpected scheduling problem (that was the reason I asked for help; how come I could make the store to reschedule?). Then while I was trying to set my problem up to be able to meet the delivery truck, truck driver called me to make sure I would still be there to meet them. I told them yes, because unfortunately I had no choice given from the support number. Before 5pm, truck driver called me again and asked me to be there at 6pm. I was trying to rush 6pm in a boston rush hour and I realized I was running 15 mins (yes 15 mins) late so that I texted the truck driver. The response was negative. While I was trying to jump between subway stations and get a cab, they told me they would not even wait 15 more mins in a 4 hr (6pm-10pm) delivery window. I gave up; gave up on the unbelievably unhelpful customer service and delivery team. I called customer service to speak with someone to share my disappointment and to reschedule the delivery. I waited 20 mins to talk to a delivery specialist and I waited 18 minutes to wait for speaking with the store manager who suddenly hang up before even I could say hi. Then I called again waited for another 15 mins and then gave up because nobody would answer. So right now I am writing this complaint in a page that has a line "Please note that if you have a concern that needs to be handled immediately, you should contact us by calling 1.888.888.4532". Really?

I returned some pieces of furniture to Ikea and the Customer Service Manager accused me of being a Photographer who used the furniture for props and then told me I could never return anything to Ikea for the rest of my life after this one return. I tried to explain to her I was not a photographer but she refused to believe me. I went back to the store several days later to talk to another manager about how I was treated by the customer service manager and he told me to email the Customer Service Manager about why I returned some of the furniture ...which I did

I tried to return my mistress without a receipt and it took two trips to finally exchange. They wanted me to tell them last four digits of card number and exact date I purchases. I called my credit card company and gave ikea the date. For some reason they could not find my info. I was told they even looked at other dates so why did the guy at the counter ask me for a purchase date was to *** me off. I had to print my statement which finally after wasting four hours, they magically found my receipt.

I ordered a large amount of furniture including 2 couches, bedroom furniture for my son, bedding and bed linens. I did not receive the duvet cover for my son's bedding. I have emailed IKEA several times, contacted the shipping company who has gotten back to me and was timely about same. They did not recieve item from IKEA and have checked the Warehous. I have CALLED Ikea only to speak briefly to a representative and then to be transferred to a "dead man's zone". This is ridiculous!

I purchased the under counter lighting labeled GRUNDTAL which comes with three puck lights and a transformer to power the lights. I had a transformer fail and catch fire. The lights had been in service for less than six months. I am warning customers that this is a fire hazard. You do get what you pay for but this is dangerous. I installed the lights as recommended in the instructions. I have not replaced all the lights and you should too.
