When I brought this up to the store I was told that the lights were not meant to be in service for long periods of time.

I needed to return two lampshades today to the store. Due to severe understaffing and completely inefficient system, I literally waited 45 minutes for my number to be called. It was 18 when I arrived and I was number 26--it's permanently seared into my brain since I stared at it for 45 minutes. After I took my number, I watched helplessly as the poor counter staff struggled to take in the returns and then print and affix stickers to each returned screw, bold and hook that people had returned. Several people complained, nothing was done to send more staff over. Meanwhile other staff stood around at other areas with nothing to do.

IKEA kitchen installation chronology (summer of 2013): Apr 22: Finalized kitchen design with Tony Ramos at Tempe IKEA store and paid and received a delivery date of May 31. After this I called Great Spaces and arranged for an installation date and got a June 3 start (I called at least a month before this date) and a counter-top measure date of June 7 for Artisan. May 30: Received a call from Phoenix delivery company (CP3 or something like that) that they were missing one piece (rational shelf) and that they would not be making the May 31 delivery date. I asked if they could still make the May 31 delivery and I would get the shelf shipped to my home for the installation.

Please don't buy the Sundvik Crib from IKEA - SUNDVIK crib review I LOVE(D) IKEA. But now I am having serious doubts. We purchased the Sundvik Crib last year, and our youngest had been using the crib for less than 11 months when I noticed a huge defect- the bottom was bowing in the middle, quite significantly. You should not be able to see the bottom board that the mattress sits on, but there it is, drooping down about 1/2 to 3/4 inches past the bottom of the rail.

I recently started shopping at Ikea, and I must say I love their stores. I went in there hopeful. I was looking for the STORÅ Loft bed frame in white stain for $299.00. We put it together and it looked really nice. I really wanted it to be functional. Unfortunately, I discovered it isn't very sturdy. Not even sitting on the bed, just like grabbing the bed post while standing next to it, it's shaky.

13 days ago I spend thousands of dollars ordering furniture online at Ikea. The order said expect 7-10 days for delivery. 13 days has now passed with no delivery and we are sat on the floor in our new home! I had an email 2 days ago saying delivery would be tomorrow I would get a call 24 hours before to give me a 4 hour slot! Well, 18.50 and no call. I have taken tomorrow of work and have no idea if my order is coming or not! I've emailed with no response. Just called (why I am having to do the chasing is despicable) and I'm advised my order might arrive tomorrow but half will be missing as it was damaged! They can't tell me when the other half will arrive but should be by the 18th October! A MONTH after ordering it!

So, I was resting my head on the HEAD REST of my HOPEN bed frame and the piece snapped off!! I contacted Ikea immediately to ask for spare parts so that I could fix it.... I even took the blame for what was obviously a faulty part... after a year, I figured... what the ***..Ikea's response... "We unfortunately do NOT sell spare parts or provide hardware... Unless you purchased the item within 90 days... We can't help you. Feel free to browse our NEW catalog for a new bed." It's an awful shame that a company can deny a loyal customer the right to a fair deal. I will NEVER buy from Ikea again and I was a loyal customer for YEARS....

My girlfriend and I spent upwards of $3500 at our local Ikea in Canton, Michigan and paid the extra money to get our items delivered. The delivery happened as scheduled, but moving into a new place with a lot of other responsibilities to attend to we didn't have time to get to putting all our stuff together right away. So a couple days later we started to assemble everything only to find out that half of our $700 entertainment center was missing. They sent us the wrong couch. Our ottoman that we ordered was missing, and some small parts for the bed we ordered were missing. They failed to notify us that if we didn't call within two days that we had to return the couch ourselves (they wouldn't pick it up), and that they would not deliver any of the items that they failed to send.

We ordered a bedroom furniture set including a bed, dresser, night stand and armoire. The delivery and installation team arrived outside of the delivery window reserved. The delivery team also forgot to load the mattress for the bed at the warehouse, so they needed to return to the warehouse to retrieve it and then return to our building. This caused us to have to re- reserve the freight elevator. While assembling our dresser, the delivery team tightened down one of the screws too tight, causing a crack on the top panel of the dresser. The delivery team explained that we could either reject the piece and they would dismantle it and return it to the warehouse, which would require a claim process, or we could negotiate a discount with Ikea. We needed a dresser and could live with the crack, so we decided to pursue a discount. three weeks and several phone calls later, Ikea has informed us that they do not offer discounts. We asked why then the delivery team told us that we could pursue a discount? They responded by telling us that some stores do offer discounts on furniture damaged during assembly, but this particular location does not. We asked why these delivery people told us that since they clearly work for this particular store, and they could not provide an answer. They just kept telling us that we should have declined the piece. Essentially the delivery personnel blatantly lied about the discount policy in order to avoid having to disassemble and return the piece.

My roommate and I recently made a large purchase at the IKEA in Brooklyn. We paid for the delivery fee and were told that they will call us the day before and give us the time. The IKEA employee also explained we can easily change the date if needed. We received the call from the delivery company and they gave us a terrible time during the day. We both have jobs that require us to work during that time frame. I called IKEA to try to move the date, since they said it would be easy to do, after being on hold for 20 minutes I finally get a hold of a customer service representative and she explained that since I called after 3 pm that we would have to pay an additional delivery fee and have to go into the physical store to change the date.

Ikea has completely shut off the ability to call a local Ikea store to discuss a problem forcing customer to drive to the store. For one dead light bulb from one of their fixtures replaceable only at Ikea (not available on line) I can talk to anyone locally forcing me to drive 68 miles for a $4 bulb. I have $20,000 invested in an Ikea kitchen, and I shudder to think about dealing with other failing parts and the fact that I will be forced to drive there because no one can call an Ikea store. Their IT "Anna" has to be the most worthless solution to customer service that I have ever encountered. If I am forced (like in this exclusive light bulb) I'll have to go back, but to buy any new item I'll never go back. The big boys and girls at Ikea likely believe that they can never fail--they need to go buy some J.C.

the folllowing is a letter i wrote to these guys late last night. i didnt want to go here... but they have left me no other choice. i have spent 8,000 dollars and there solution is to give me a refund... To Whom It May Concern, I have been a loyal customer for the past 15 years. Every time I come to your stores I leave wanting more. I want you to read the sequence of events and see if they make sense to you?

We had a delivery slot of 1 pm to 5 pm. At 5:05 I call "3PD," their delivery outfit, and they said, "...oh he's just finishing up, be there soon..." 30 minutes go by, call again; this goes on another 3 times, each time we seem to move backwards in the que. When they get there, the "3PD" guys tell me they were to load at 7 am that day, but because of Ikea's fumbling they finally load at 11. Ikea needs to have a plan for this, to call scheduled customers and arrange for a new time so customers don't have to wait around in the dark. I called Ikea a few times in this whole caper, and they were not only no help they were arrogant; when I was about to cancel the whole thing, the Ikea rep offers, "...well, they may give you your delivery charge back..." But the implication was that if I cancel the whole thing I would be stuck with the delivery charge.

We recently bought an IKEA area rug for the bedroom. Within a day the whole house began to stink. When I came home that night I immediately removed the rug from the house and opened all of the windows to try to clear the air. I went to bed with a headache. It has now been a week - the rug is outside in the sun - and is still failing the sniff test on a daily basis. What is causing the rug to smell so bad? I tried to contact IKEA to no avail. VOC's?

I paid for a delivery of new kitchen cabinets to arrive on 7/20/13 from 3-7pm. I waited for the delivery, but the driver did not ring the bell. My phone was out of service however, so I did find that he called when it was back in working order. I called to reschedule the delivery on the following Monday, it we agreed that I would not be charged the reschedule fee, and it was for 7/27/13 from 10-2pm. This time my phone was working fine, but they didn't show up.

We stopped for food in the cafeteria. Pulled out a 20. When I got back change for a 10 I corrected the cashier, who had stuffed the bill into the drawer before making change. She continued to check people out and make change, instead of immediately calling a manager. Waited for a LONG time. Surprise, when they counted the draw it was correct. This was not a situation where I could have been mistaken, or I would have walked awat. I also had two other people with me.

In August 2011 I made good on a promise to our teenage daughter to repaint and spruce up a room for she and her friends to “hang out” in the basement of our old house. When it was all done I agreed to trip to Ikea to get a futon, some chairs, a TV stand, etc. After the usual hours of assembly with Ikea things it all looked great, at least for a few months. One day she and her older brother mentioned to me that there was something wrong with the futon. On examination I discovered that the frame supporting the seat cushion had broken squarely in the middle (see photo) making it completely unusable as a couch.

Terrible! IKEA hold times are over 30 min to get help. This is the most unprofessional company I have ever dealt with... 3PD was supposed to deliver a couch for me from IKEA... Both IKEA and the customer service rep at 3PD said they would remove the boxes for me. However, when the delivery team arrived 20 min later, they refused. I called the same customer service lady back and she told me that’s too bad, she can't make them take the boxes. Therefore, I refused delivery and told them to take it all back because I won't deal with a company that lies to customers and refused to honor their promises... The delivery guys did not even have a copy of the receipt/ delivery paperwork for me... that told me I could "take a picture of it with my phone.

Unethical behavior, I would never recommend buying from this company. The store had no 'local' number. The Delivery Manager promised me a refund the next day, kept my merchandise, and did not process my refund. I ended up speaking with a "Sue' who said to me rudely "well you shouldn't have left without your merchandise..." that was her solution. HOrrible experience, plus they rip you off with the delivery ($99) and the assembly charges (from $250 to $650) whatever pennies you save you end up paying. Employees hang around talking to each other refuse to help you.

Ikea Kivik Sofas come as 2 items: Frame and Covers. Each are shown as single item lines on the picking list. After shopping 5 hours and $1,500 later, we neglected to observe that the sofa actually has 2 boxes (frame and arm rests separately). Nobody upon check out alerted us to incomplete pick. We partly assembled sofa, then noticed missing arm rests. A call to IKEA the next day resulted in case# and pledge to have resolution within 72 hours.

Orders two mattresses and one foundation online. The delivery company arrived a week later with the foundation but no mattresses. Spent an hour on the phone with Ikea customer service (mostly on hold). Spoke to 2 different people and got nowhere, eventually I was placed on hold again for 40 minutes then suddenly transferred to someones voice mail. left a message but call was never returned. My spend another hour on the phone the next day and was eventually told that they would have to do a warehouse audit which would take 2-3 days.

The Problem: I bought some items from Ikea and believed their promise that they would deliver the goods when they said, more or less. The Promise: 2 e mails and 2 voice mails promised delivery between 11 and 3. I re-arrange my schedule and sit in my yard all day waiting. Good thing its a nice day. At 4 no show, we tracked down the number and called - coming between 4 and 6 the truck was running late.

I got a triple wardrobe wall unit delivered. It came in multiple pieces which were clearly difficult for two large men to carry into my bedroom. I could not open the boxes and take out the pieces without help. I saw that the corner of one box was crushed and the items inside were damaged. Not wantint to get the delivery men in trouble or go through the bother of getting a new piece, I glued the damanaged corner. A week later when I finally got to the last piece, which was the mirror door I saw that it was cracked.

We were attending a wedding in McKinney, TX last Friday, June 21st and decided to stop at the local IKEA store. We found some track lighting we liked. There were several pieces to this set. We went through a regular checkout line and purchased all pieces. When we arrived home in Nebraska we found out the clerk did not put all the pieces in our IKEA blue bag. The actual 'track' for the lighting was missing. I called IKEA at the 888 number on the receipt and was told there is nothing they can/will do. They admit they have the piece but will not ship it. I was told they "might" credit my account after 5 days if I don't come back and pick it up or they might issue a gift card.

Ordering stuff online wasn't working so we gave up and asked a friend to give us a ride to Ikea Elizabeth, NJ. Came with prepared list, paid for pick up and delivery, and happily went home. I was waiting home for the delivery, when my boyfriend calls me from work and says he checked the automated service #, and it says no one was available at home!!! (Seriously???) My phone, the door bell,... everything was working. We spent hours with representatives and sent multiple emails. They want us to come to the store and pay another delivery fee. (Yeah right!!)

July 19 I have placed order in Ikea Brooklyn. I was schedules to delivered today, July 25 I took day off and was waiting. I lost day wages (250) and nobody even call me. I call store and they start telling me a BULL *** that the items are not available and it takes more time to get them. When I ask for store manager, they just hung up on me. Called them three times. the same result - putted on hold and after few minutes call dropped.

My wife and I traveled 2 hours to visit your store in Orlando Florida yesterday dedicating an entire day with one purpose and goal, and that was to purchase an entire bedroom set for our house. We have always spoke highly about Ikea and recommended it to everyone we know, however after the lack of customer service at this location, the rudeness of your employees, and the failure to both listen and assist us in any way we will no longer be shopping with Ikea. The experience we had yesterday with your staff and BOTH managers was the worst experience we have had at ANY public place!

Full name: Asim Ahmed Contact phone number: 630-338-**** Location of your IKEA store: Bolingbrook, IL, USA Your Question: I wanted to buy Article Number: 702.430.38 (FRIHETEN Corner sofa-bed) and went to buy this at store: Bolingbrook, IL, USA. I checked in the afternoon today (8/18/2013) around 2:30pm and then went to the store. By the time, I went to the store somebody else had bought that one piece that was left. I then went to the customer service staff at the store and they told me that the same sofa might show up tomorrow (Monday). I enquired if I could put a hold on the piece they were going to get tomorrow but they told me that I COULD NOT put a hold on that the day before. Apparently I have to call the day I want to buy to make sure it is in the store before heading out and drive 16 miles to get to the store. According to the store I could not even put a hold on the day of when the item would be available again. Which If I am unlucky, could again be bought by someone else? They also cannot sell me an item that is not in the store. What a bummer….They do not even sell using a phone calls…bummer bummer bummer….

My husband and I went to IKEA to look at kitchens because we were ready to remodel. When I say remodel, I'm talking moving walls and completely gutting a kitchen down to the studs. IkEA happened to have a 20% discount on all kitchen orders....made sense to me. We told the sales person we wanted the entire set up of kitchen and laundry room. She informed us that we had to set up an appt. with Signature Services Group who is IKEA's only kitchen design and installation group (sub-contractor). We set up an appt on 3/26 and informed them we wanted the same set up that was in the IKEA Covina store. He said that Signature Services Group does NOT include any other cabinets in the design, other than "Kitchen". He would not take any measurements and said we had to do it ourselves and order the cabinets, but his company could do the installation. We did as he instructed. Even though our kitchen is not THAT big, it is the largest job Signature Services has done.

WE purchased numerous items at IKEA at College Park MD. We received a letter stating that 3 of the 4 chairs we ordered we not in stock and could not be delivered. They were in stock the day we ordered and paid for them at the store.They enclosed a gift card to cover the cost of the three chairs (not including the assemble, pick and deliver fee) and asked us to call to discuss options. We have called the 301 345 **** number three times a day for the past 3 days and all messages go to voice mail and no one calls back.. We don't want just one of 4 chairs and don't want an IKEA gift certificate...I am PISSED

I have been trying to reach IKEA for three days now. I let it ring for at least 1.5 hours. Why do you not answer? The phone rings and rings.no answer. I have lived all over the world and IKEA is a necessary evil. I hote IKEA, but sometimes have no choice but to buy from them. The Dubai store is by far the worst. Ramadan is over. There should be no excuses. The contact email address on their website is also inactive.

That *** girl at the playground area was very rude and a big time ***... She shouldn't be working at the children section ... You people should choose your employees... Seriously!!!! .............................................................................,,,,........................EMPLOYEES AT THE PLAYGROUND AREA SHOULD BE KID FRIENDLY AND SHOULD NOT HIRE *** EMPLOYEES WHO LACKS PEOPLE SKILLS!!!

This is with regards to an online order ($3400 total), made on ikea.com in June 2013. We are still sleeping on an air mattress surrounded by unpacked boxes. For three weeks, the order has been "in process". No updates. We called the 888 number so many times, I have it memorized. The call center staff are very rude and clueless. During my last call (yesterday) I asked to talk to the supervisor, and when he reiterated to me that they "do not have an estimate of when my order would ship" (seriously, I asked, do you think it could be 2 months, and he said "possibly") - I asked him whether HE HIMSELF would still wait for the shipment, or whether he would cancel if he were in my shoes - and he said "NO, I PERSONALLY WOULDN'T WAIT". Can you believe this? their own employee wouldn't shop with them.

I waited in line to check out for 20 minutes. Instead of ringing my items in individually or counting them, the cashier looked at the items pretty quickly and pressed the number for how many she thought I had. She totaled my order and gave me the receipt and when I saw the number was incorrect I told her she charged me for the wrong number of items. Instead of fixing it, she told me to wait at customer service: where 20 other people were now ahead of me!!! It took me another hour to get my receipt fixed and charged the correct amount. It was a huge waste of time.

We bought furniture 10 days ago (bed, mattress, tables, TV set, Chairs...), spent about 2,500 dollars, and more than 50% of what we paid for were just never delivered! We sent an email but get no answer from Ikea. We called them but they just told us that they did not know where our stuffs were. They do not apologized, and obviously, once they get paid, they just do not care about the consumer. Moreover, it seems that we can not be reimbursed because, of course, we can not bring the stuffs back to the store. That's just crazy!

I work for a Medical Clinic, On the floor Peter helped us with our order, told us the delivery would come the next day between 8 and 10am, so we unplugued computers, moved patient files, and could not work all through the day. After 2 pm, when the delivery had not arrived we decided to call and find out what was going on, then we were told the delivery would come between 2 and 6pm, this after a whole day of having the office not functioning. When it finally arrived around 5 pm, our delivery was not complete, I called to ask about it and was told that they did not ship it complete, gave me a case number, spoke to 4 different people in customer service, the first and second and third told me the missing items were in stock, the fourth in back line resolution, a Leshea, said they were not in stock and said she could not reach anybody in the store, even though I could, and then she finally said the items were not in stock, and that I would have to wait for 3 days until they could figure out where my items were. After 5 days, we call, and we are told that the items were not paid for, even though the 4 people I have spoken to before said they were paid for. So this whole mess started with the guy in the floor, then the cashier woman who did not include all our items, but still charged us for full delivery on all the items, and then the girl from delivery at the first floor that checked the receipt and told us everything was fine. Then all the customer service people that do not know what they are talking about and can not help a customer that is having problems with their order.

So I scheduled my delivery for Monday morning, but the Ikea delivered it on Sunday morning. When the delivery guy called me, I was in the bathroom, therefore I didn't pick up my phone. (the delivery guy didn't even knock my front door). after i finished taking a shower 20 minutes after, I already got a voicemail that told me to reschedule my delivery for another 60 dollar. First, if they knocked my door, my parents could open it for them. Moreover, they only called once! and the thing that troubled me is their mistakes of the delivery schedule.

I purchased a couch and coffee table at Ikea in Woodbridge, VA and paid to have it it delivered two days later. The delivery company calls a day later to tell me what time to be home to wait for them for the next day. Next day comes, and the delivery man shows up with the coffee table but NO COUCH! I ask, where's my couch, and he replies "Ikea said it was out of stock." That's it!!!! I call Ikea, wait an hour to tell them the situation where I paid for a couch and delivery of a couch and received nothing. They said they would call me back in the next 5 days....

I absolutely HATE your "Leo" commercial. What parent would allow a child put on a time out to ride their trike around the kitchen, bumping into cabinet drawers, and spraying the family dog. It's ridiculous! I'm sure there are other ways you can prove how durable your products are without "giving permission" for this type of behavior. I cringe each time this commercial play. Please tell me who actually think that it's "cute" to have a naughty little boy on a time out having access to ride around the kitchen like this?

Purchased Ikea kitchen cabinets and home delivery in June 2013. I did not purchase any assembly or installation services. Now that kitchen remodeling is moving along, determined I do need someone to install countertops. Per "customer service" because I did not purchase counter installation in June when I bought the cabinets, I basically I need to find a contractor on my own, or I might try visiting the kitchen dept at the store to see if they have any recommendations. Gee, only one Ikea in the entire state, might not be easy for someone to just pop in to ask a question. Er, um, how about providing a phone number.

I purchased items from the Schaumburg store on 7/31/2013. I used your picking service, delivery and setup service. An additional fee of $40, $59, $249. 1. When I placed the order with your floor sales representative, I gave him my list which included a bed frame for a full size bed, including the price on it ! When the price on the order changed by $20.00 I did ask him to check on the price difference - his response "the price on the item has changed" not that he had placed an order for Queen Bed Frame as opposed to Full size bed frame.

I bought almost $1000.00 in merchandise and It almost took a month to ship. I was told 8-12 to be available and waited. No call of confirm delivery. They called around 2 I wasn't there. Then 45 minutes after they came I called. Was Told I'm in ID. For 3 1/2 hours I waited on line with IKEA Customer Service to be shuffled around and told my stuff would be returned and $280 in shipping was non refundable. I was informed it was my fault and what ever miss information I received from there delivery dept was my mistake. And It would cost another $280 to deliever.

My son and I went to Ikea today to buy the towels that was on sale. We planned on having lunch and buy some kitchen stuff and lights. While I was at IKEA, we realize we need to go and got the sales towel first so we went and look for the towels. We were told 2 towels per person so we got 4 total. While waiting in line to check out, I was told that it's 2 towels per person and I ask can my son buy 2 and the woman said as long he pays cash. Since the line I was in only takes credit and debt cards so we change to another line. Once we got to the front of the line, they say it's 2 towels per family and my son cannot buy the towels. I told the cashier I was told it was 2 towels per person when I was in the other line. He called a supervisor (Indian woman name Shrain??) and she says it does not matter, it

I drove from New Jersey to the Ikea store in Stoughton, MA, to purchase several large beds and mattresses for my lakehouse in RI. This was a long day-trip for me. I scheduled delivery and set up for the first Sunday after that. I was told, that someone would call me on Saturday, which never happened, so I started calling Ikea around 12 noon on Saturday. I was then referred to the delivery company, which I called twice, to only be told, that a technician would call me with a time window. That never happened.

When the first loss representative followed our shopping moves, at first assessment I was protective of my daughters as I perceived him to be “looking strangely” at my daughter’s bodies. He stood unnervingly close to my girls and his gaze was uncomfortable and *** I told the girls that I was becoming uncomfortable in the store and had them pay attention to the folks around them, but they still wanted to remain in the store to shop. After that point, my senses were on guard and much to my surprise, there were no less than 3 (three) other individuals that proceeded to follow us around the store. At this point my personal radar, having been activated by unusual attention to the young bodies of my children, progressed to shock at noticing the loss prevention personnel who were quite frankly, not very good at “pretending” to shop while they “watched” our every move. They watched us very closely, and I watched them watching us suspiciously. What irony that my children had been so excited to visit your store and yet were met by a complete unwarranted breach of our sense enjoyment, and complete astonishment that we were being treated differently because of our skin pigment.

IKEA management has lied to me several times and still don't understand how to do customer service. Several trips to the store - 2 hours away - many calls to "managers" and still don't have parts to complete assy. Beware of the products. Open the box before you leave the parking lot and inspect and count all material required. Forget calling them as they waste your time. I am done purchasing anything from them.

I had a Hemnes bed from Ikea in past which broke down. I really liked the bed and talked to Ikea. IKEA told me that they have changed the design because they too realized it. I checked on their website and they had introduced extra support to the bed as per Instruction Manual - AA-492970-* I went to IKEA and purchased a new Hemnes bed hoping that it would be the new design. I opened the bed today to assemble it and noticed that it is exactly the same design which broke on me and the Instruction Manual was also the old one - AA-827976-*.

I called your customer service and here is the ikea answer : you need madam to change your E mail address because your are registered in another store location and we cannot do anything about it ! I was registered in NYC USA till 2005 then Paris France till a month ago and now I want to buy on line from my new home town Miami USA ! Every time I moved I used Ikea for my new home decoration and moreover big pieces dressers and kitchen.

We purchased a "teflon?" coated grill pan at IKEA. After using it for a few months, when hand washed, then towel drying it, a dark black residue covered my hands any dish cloth. I was horrified! What was this chemical in the metal and/or coating of this pan. It certainly could not be healthy. I returned it to IKEA, Portland, OR, and even though the name IKEA was blatantly etched into the bottom of the pan in large font, they would not let me return it without a receipt.

I initially sent this to the customer service on the ikea web site. I bought a desk and kitchen table. I am attaching two photos. The first shows the sealer on the desk coming off. The second a pop in the table top. What must I do to get these items covered under warranty? I really don't want to have to disassemble them to bring them in to show someone at customer service at the store They responded with this.

Due to incompetent sub-contractors our IKEA kitchen installation is going into it's sixth week. And...we have had no response from IKEA about this situation. I say incompetent...as they indicated that they lost our delivery and we had to cancel and installation, and later in that day after we canceled, they called and said one of there dock workers put something on top....and this was just the start...as we had to wait again, as all the appliances were damaged and we needed to get new ones. We understand that things can happen, but we can not understand the lack of care from IKEA (Tempe, AZ location). This situation has caused an extra undue expense and frustration.

Ordered over $1000 worth of furniture to be delivered to freight forwarding company which accepts freight from 6 am - 6 pm. Called as soon as I got delivery confirmation to give details on Freight Company and Hours. I had booked a truck to pick up freight when it came off the ferry, then got email saying the location was closed @ 3:30 in the afternoon. I called freight office, not true ready and waiting and no truck had been by with Ikea freight. Called freight company, they said they could not re-deliver unless Ikea told them to. Called IKEA 1.5 hours on hold...Told that it would take another week and half to deliver as they do not come to this area.

They have these plastic cutting boards that they advertise to be bendable, so that you can bend it and easily pour your chopped, juliened, whatever-ed food into the bowl. Well, you probably want to chop it with your fingernails because if you use a regular knife, little shavings of plastic come off and go right into your food! What a health hazard!!! I mean, we are all worried about the small plastic molecules that come off of plastic water bottles and go into our bodies, but why sweat the small stuff? I've been eating actual shavings for a few meals!

Bought a patio umbrella , used for a few months, cord that pulls it up snaps, no way to fix it! brought it back stood in line over 1 hour. Won't exchange, will not even listen to me. Accuses me of not buying it from ikea....it has all the ikea info on it! They have the exact same one in stock,the man 2 numbers behind me has the exact same umbrella with exact issue to return, I had called before driving 1 hour there , said no problem....manager of return area so rude! Walked away and said she would be right back, we waited another 40 minutes, then tried to give it back to me.....I said said keep it and throw it garbage yourself!

Ikea Covina (413), kitchen dpartment provides a terrible service. It started when I came to order kitchen. Even if you are the only customer on the floor, they say that they are busy and you have to wait minimum 2 hours to be served! That was several times when I came in the morning during week days, there were no cunsomers exept me, and I had to wait for hours to be served! More over, they scheduled an appointment for in-home instollation price quote on May 8, 2013 from 2 to 4, (service Order 14535****). I took a time off.

One person at checkout counter, took 45 minutes to pay with only two customers ahead of us on a slow morning. Set up and paid for delivery in advance. Bedding arrives but mattress does not . Case opened told will be contacted within 48 hours. After 5 days, place another call with case number, told will be called back. Called again, left another message. It is now ten days and still no return call. Very difficult to sleep in the bed you purchase when you do not have a mattress!

I paid a $99 flat fee on my online order for a delivery, initially estimated for June 15th. Now, on June 17th, I called IKEA and was told that my order had not yet reached the carrier, and would likely not be delivered before June 21st. I am extremely disappointed with IKEA online's delivery services, and will shop elsewhere next time I need to purchase furniture online. Now i need to write this to reach the 100 words minimum in order to make this post. This feature is annoying and unnecessary. A little more.

I purchased an IKEA kitchen but needed to use the delivery service. I have so many complaints it is not funny. First of all the items I thought I was purchasing did not get purchased, such as the matching dishwasher and under counter trim as I has thought. There were over one hundred items so I did not noticed until delivery. Second, I had to wait a month for delivery to my area and then they would not deliver to second floor as they had not appliance dolly. I had asked when I purchase if they could take to second floor apartment to sales clerk and delivery service representative.

Updated by user May 15, 2013 Ikea acknowledged that they were at fault. As compensation they gave me a $50 gift card PLUS they delivered six (6) Vardo under bed storage boxes AND four (4) pillowcases PLUS they promised to clean up their Better Business Bureau (BBB) "F" rating, AND to contact ALL nine (9) complainants that they had previously ignored. They also gave me the FAX number of the San Diego Ikea store manager and the direct line to the San Diego Customer Service Manager. I feel that they were sincere in their response and intentions, and that their settlement to me, having a cash value of about $250 was also fair. # 1 - I purchased a Nyvoll Queen Size bed, Sultan Flokenes Queen Size mattress, Queen Size sheet set, and Sultan Lade Queen Size slatted bed base (4 items) and paid for delivery and assembly, which included removal of my old mattress, box springs, bed frame, and headboard.  # 2 - Delivery was promised 2-6 p.m.  # 3 - Driver called at 8:30 a.m. waking me, and asked if they could make delivery immediately. I agreed for a 10 a.m. delivery.  # 4 - Driver arrived at 10 a.m., surveyed old bed, and said they could only remove mattress. I replied that the order called for removal of bed, box springs, and mattress, and if Ikea was unable to comply, I would have to cancel the order. Driver called his supervisor who told him to remove bed, box springs, and mattress.  # 5 - After old bed was removed, driver and helper delivered and installed new bed and then discovered discrepancy that bed was Full Size instead of Queen Size.  # 6 - Driver left Queen Size Mattress on top of smaller full size bed frame and told me to call Customer Service.  # 7 - Ikea Customer Service took the problem report and promised a call back "soon". When I didn't get a call back within 1-hour I called Ikea Customer Service again and was told this time that call backs take 24 to 72 hours even though I specified that this was a high priority, emergency situation, and that I needed to be able to sleep on the bed tonight, or be put up in a hotel until the situation was corrected.  # 8 - When I asked why Ikea would deliver a Queen Size mattress with a Full Size Bed on a set up and assembly order I was told (A) that Ikea does not question or verify their orders, and (B) "Human Error".  # 9 - I drove to Ikea San Diego. Customer Service told me to take a number and that there were 20 people ahead of me. I replied this was unacceptable and asked to speak to a supervisor. The Supervisor agreed that the mistake was their fault, and said that they would deliver the Queen Size Nyvoll bed that afternoon but could not set it up until 2 days later. I replied this was unacceptable and asked to speak to his supervisor.  10 - The new supervisor spoke to the delivery driver who agreed to deliver and set up the Queen Size Nyvoll bed that afternoon, and remove the full size bed. He was the same driver who had earlier delivered the wrong bed.  11 - Delivery, setup, and exchange was completed about 4:00 p.m. The driver asked me to put in a good word for him.  In my opinion, there is no excuse by Ikea for what happened. The order should have been scanned, checked, and double checked before it was originally sent out. That was not done. When the error was discovered, the driver should have contacted his supervisor, set up the exchange, and handled the details WITHOUT my having to take hours out of my own schedule. Instead there were MULTIPLE and CONTINUING problems. This is an example of how NOT to treat a customer.

Last year I purchased the Braviken sink with the Godmorgon bath cabinet from Ikea. About two weeks ago I noticed that a big piece of the enamel had chipped off of the sink. I remembered that the sink had a 10 year warranty so I called Ikea to find out what steps I needed to take to replace the sink. After being transferred to several different people over the course of two days, they transferred me to a representative from the sink manufacturer who told me that they would replace the sink and that I just needed to bring it back to Ikea. I spent half a day disconnecting the plumbing and removing the sink to bring it back to the store. When I got to customer service they told me they could not replace the sink because the damage was not a “manufacturer's defect” so it wasn’t covered by the warranty.

I purchased a Tarva 6 drawer dresser from the IKEA store in Fresco, Tx. I live 6.5 hours away in Clovis, NM. I got home with only one box. When I start to put it together, I find that half of the dresser is missing. I called customer service to see what could be done, and they want me to drive to the store to pick up the second box! WHAT!? I do not understand why they could not just ship it to me. They didn't even offer it to me as an option. If the shipping was reasonable, I might have been willing to pick up the cost.

Ordered furniture a month ago. In Tennessee, they have to use a 3rd party. The woman read the order wrong and called me a week later after the goods arrived to pick them up. When I corrected her and told her it was a delivery, I had to wait 2 more weeks, because she booked everyone prior. I called IKea to get them to expedite. The same *** woman lied and said no body called her back. I called on my cell and have the record of returning the call.

I BOUGHT A DAY BED TODAY AND IT GOT DELIVERED DAMAGED (BOX NO 1 - TORN CARDBOARD AND BROKEN PIECES) AND WITH MATERIAL DEFECTS (BOX NO. 2 - SIDE FRAME), AND AFTER BEING ON THE PHONE FOR 30 MINUTES I FOUND OUT THAT I WOULD BE PASSED ON TO THE RESOLUTION TEAM THAT WOULD CALL ME WITHIN 48 HOURS. THIS IS A JOKE!!! NOT ONLY THERE IS NOT AN EASY CONTACT METHOD OR NUMBER (JUST ONE LINE FOR THE WHOLE COUNTRY), BUT THE RESOLUTION OF PROBLEMS TAKES 48 HOURS???

i lugged home box. opened to assemble. take all the pieces out of the box. now i'm ready to assemble. when i try to match pieces to image, piece does not look like one in picture. one of pieces was missing. there were two of same piece instead of one of each. The inconvenience of this may seem minute but i drove 30 miles to ikea, had help getting it in my car. carried it around in my car for a week (making car heavier). Finally have time to put it together.

I purchased a limhamn shelving unit which is a stainless steel kitchen unit. I got it home to find that the top of the shelf was missing and in its place was an additional second shelf. The two pieces are configured differently... So I couldn't even complete the first step f assembly. the next day I drove 30 minutes back to the store and exchanged it. I got it home only to find THE SAME PROBLEM!!! These were both sealed boxes. How can ikea have such sucky quality control?

Bottom line Ikea is terrible. I bought a Galant filing cabinet which has a three lock dial. I followed the horrible picture directions on how to set the combination then locked it. Surprise surprise it does not open and no one in IKEA's customer service department knows how to fix it. They tell me I have to know carry this 75 pound cabinet back to the store. Worst POS I ever bought. If my wife would not be mad I would set the *** thing on fire just to feel better.

A few weeks ago, I bought $4000 worth of furniture from IKEA (Woodbridge, VA) for my brand new home. I had IKEA pick, deliver, and assemble them for close to an additional $900. The delivery guys showed up on time and had a thick layer of mud on their boots which they spread on the new carpet in every room they stepped in. They delivered wrong items and assembled the right items (multiple of them) in the wrong way. One of the guys was flat out rude and disrespectful while the other was nice and polite. They both seemed inexperienced in everything but hauling furniture, and totally incapable of following written directions with diagrams that came with the furniture. We prepared a decent meal for each and invited them to eat, but the rude guy (team leader?) said they would eat it later; they did not eat it at all! They initially refused to haul away packages that were incomplete (since they had nothing to do with IKEA as delivery people hired by ANOTHER employer), but reluctantly did so when I made it clear to them that they could not use my son's bedroom as their storage. During their "service" time, the guys used multiple bathrooms in my house and left their filth everywhere which we had to clean up.

I would like to file a complaint regarding an after service sales team member Melissa located in Paramus NJ. No one contacted me to tell me that my whole panel was destroyed in the warehouse the night before my delivery. I had to call the Delivery service the next day at 5pm to find out that this happen. With the economy today its really hard to get a day off and of course i wasted a whole day and didn't know i could of gone to work instead. So i called Ikea customer service to get to after sales because i cant get thru their phone line. I get a reschedule for 5/3 for delivery again, but this time i thought i was smart so i called on 5/2 afternoon to make sure everything was schedule and everything was fine and of course i cant get thru on After sales i had to contact customer service to confirm this was happening for 5/3.

On March 29th, I ordered 18 items on-line and paid for the truck delivery service. I received an email stating that everything was ready for delivery on April 11th. When the truck arrived, it only had 11 of the items. I called to locate the other 7 items and was told that I would receive a call back. I waited 2 days - no call back. So I called again - same answer; same result. I called again and was given a case number and was told I'd receive a call back. No call back after 3 days. I called a fourth time and was finally given a new order number for the missing items. No one knew why they weren't shipped/received.

This is the first time that I've ever written a customer review about anything. My experience with Ikea was comically terrible and I felt that writing a review highlighting my experience would give me a small sliver of recourse and hopefully save someone else from the exceptional levels of frustration that can go along with shopping at this retailer. I bought a bed from Ikea on a Friday that came in two boxes. When I got home, the materials in box 2 very obviously did not fit with the materials with box 1. I called customer service to try to figure out what happened (why materials that were in box 2 were incorrect).

I bought an IKEA dresser yesterday (12/29/12), came home to assemble it, on the very first step I realized that I had duplicate legs. Duplicate legs means screw holes are on the same side thus I am unable to build any of this. I call IKEA support, they subsequently call the store and ask if there are any more units of this available - they say there are several left. I questioned this because I grabbed the last one off of the shelf but the girl on the phone reiterates "we have more in back stock." I drive back to the store and there are not anymore though the computer is still showing that there are 3 in stock. Fortunately at this point I complained about driving back to the store and they gave me a $25 voucher.

Bought a bed and paid for delivery, which came within hours, but the bed came in three boxes, and instead of delivering 1, 2 , 3 they delivered two Of box 1 along with box three...after getting them on phone to say that would be remedied in 72 hrs, and they may be right...time hasn't. Lapsed yet... I noticed main beam they say is packed separately, so I'm also missing that. Can't get through to them on phone e,sceptic to leave message. I'm thinking of taking my 550 loss and reclaiming my sanity. Also some of the instructions are incomprehensible, showing a connection is both right and wrong.

We ordered our kitchen from IKEA, by phone on April 17 and were told deliver would happen April 25. We hustled our contractors to get everything ready in time and now it is May 7 and we still can't find out when our kitchen will be delivered. IKEA's customer service stinks; after numerous calls we are simply told "you may cancel the order OR wait for the delivery company to deliver" - and NO ONE can tell us when that will be. Meanwhile we are spending zillions of dollars eating out because our kitchen is gutted. All this after we were prepared to go and pick up our kitchen at the store BUT were told that to get the 20% kitchen discount we'd have to order online (by phone).

My name is Felicia Walden, I shop at the Round Rock Ikea. Im sure there is a list of my purchased items. I paid a "Conveniece Fee" for ikea staff to get the items in store ,I purchased delivery and assembly. Turns out the wrong color table was delivered. Getting a hold of anyone is nearly impossible. Finaly patricia trejo arranged delivery and assembly of the correct table scheduled for today from2-7PM. 7:18 PM black stornas table finaly delivered but of course theres another catch to it. It didnt occur to them that they needed to make sure they had their tools present before driving an hour to my house so you know I paid well over 250 for this service. The guy resceduled for sunday 2-9pm. Already took 2 days of early from work and how many weeks without a dining table to eat on.

This has been nothing but a horrible and stressful experience. I purchased approximately $1,000 worth of furniture on December 9th and paid the $129 to have the items delivered to my house. They were originally suppose to be delivered between 9am and 1pm on the 15th. At approximately 1:30 when I hadn't received my shipment yet, I phoned the delivery company who informed me they were unable to pick up my packages from the warehouse and that I needed to call the store directly. I phoned IKEA's 'Home Delivery' dept and left a message. When I didn't get a call back in what I felt was a reasonable amount of time, I phoned the store again and spoke to an individual in the 'After Sales' Dept. All I was told was that my order was lost. They could not tell me what would be done to solve the problem. Instead they offered to call me back when they had a better idea of where my merchandise was located.

This complaint has specifically to do with the Long Island Ikea in Hicksville, NY along with their 3rd party delivery company UX Logistics. One of Ikea's employees helped me process my delivery service and I made sure that the delivery would have to be after 7pm, the time I get home from work. He told me that the delivery company would call me the morning of the delivery date and that I could negotiate with them the time of the delivery. I paid my $100 for the delivery service and all was fine until the day of the delivery.

I'm in the midst of moving to a new place and finally can use one of my heirloom bedroom sets because I have the space, so I trotted off to Ikea for a mattress, box spring, and curtains. I got the mattress and curtains no problem. For the box spring I first had to wait in line to just be able to talk to a sales associate. (There were two for the whole floor on a Saturday afternoon in Philadelphia.) He printed me off a sheet of paper and told me I needed to pay for it before I could handle it. I did so. I then waited in line for fifteen minutes (with one person ahead of me) to wait for the box spring. The guy was clearly doing several different jobs and had no idea what was going on. When he wheeled it out to me, it was clearly too big for me to handle. (I'm small and clearly disabled.) He told me someone outside would be able to help me. Lo and behold, there was literally no one outside, except other customers.

IKEA long island Dec 2012. Brought specs of kitchen space. Kitchen expert made computer generated picture of finished kithen that was correct. Paid almost 3000 dollars. Paid 99 for delivery. Delivered on time. Delivery company people competent and efficient. On assembling cabinets i became clear that only 1/5 wall cabinets was correct and wold even fit given ceiling height. 30 inch high is correct however we had many 39 inch cabinets, actually too many to fit the kitchen even if the ceiling was higher.

And no one is willing to talk about it. It's been 3 days and the infested furniture is STILL here. Customer service does NOT respond. Bed bugs in NYC are a serious problem and IKEA Brooklyn should take responsibility for their buggy furniture and remedy the situation in at timely manner. I ordered a sofa from ikea to be delivered to my NYC apartment. I found bed bugs in it while I was assembling. I called and filed a claim with them asap. Skipped work the next day to go speak with IKEA Brooklyn directly. They told me they would have the furniture picked up and replaced the next day. NO one came to pick up or deliver. I called the truck company and they did not even have the order from IKEA. I called customer service 6 times, on hold for over 30 minutes each time. I was even transferred to Sr. services who didn't even speak to me, instead they transferred me to LEAVE a voicemail that would not be returned for 48 hours.

we pay Ikea to come to our new home to design our kitchen by using Ikea cabinets, in store we been told a designer will come to the house with state of the art computer aided design to design and give us an estimate for cabinets and installations. and they charge us $199 for. With big excitement and anticipation we wait 2 weeks for designer to come and to wow us because it suppose to be Ikea designer . Well my friends this experience was every thing beside the WOW

Before moving to Wake Forest NC I contacted the Charlotte store to ask about delivery and debated ordering online or driving to the store and getting the furniture. I was told ordering online would take 14 days to be delivered and could have next day for $199 if I went to the store. That was a lie the only delivery they offer take 4 days if not more and the woman I spoke with was not so friendly. I will never shop in the store again if I even buy ikea furniture again... It seems like no one has the same answer for a simple question

I have shopped at IKEA San Diego several times. Each time I have spent over $500.00 dollars. I live an hour away from San Diego so when I went to IKEA I had a long list of things to buy. I found that the customer service was horrific. I attempted to buy some cabinets but could never get a sales person to help me. I looked all over for one and I found them all together complaining about IKEA and refusing to work? IKEA's own employees hate IKEA. Well, I manage to get the cabinets and after I paid for them IKEA could not find any employee to bring them up front. There was a line of people waiting for items as well. Some people were so upset after waiting more than half an hour they went to get their money back.

Our kitchen started to fall apart after 3 months. The formica starts to bubble up from the plywood on the countertops, leaving a bubble on the top and an opening on the front. This also happened with a cabinet and one of the shelves bowed and there was not much on it. All our "stainless" steel handles are not stainless at all. The stainless coat is bubbling off and Ikea does not provide warranty for that. We have simply been told to buy new ones!!!

I had an awful experience. First the customer service at the store was bad, with employees that didn't have a good attitude, not helpful, were not trained to help you. I purchased a wardrobe, and I was having a real hard time hauling the cart to my car and I told the girl that it was too heavy for me, she simply said ,"oh, it is heavy for me too, but if I can do it, you should be able too. You have to bring all the way to the front and ask somebody to help you". All the way to the front was really far away, and thanks to some customers that helped me opening doors I was able to do it. The IKEA people just pretended I was invisible, didn't lift a finger not even to hold a door.

Hello - I just wanted to share my recent experience with Ikea. I spent an entire day at Ikea Brooklyn shopping for a few large items, including a PAX wardrobe, which I thought would be the most economical and easiest choice. After put together all the pieces I needed for this wardrobe in the store, printed out my forms and ordered them with a sales associate. I was told Monday, when calling customer services to verify my order items so that I could give the details to the person I was going to hire to assemble it, that one of the most important items for the wardrobe was missing from the order. I spent the next three hours on the phone with various very incompetent customer service people that told me the only way I could get my missing item was to come back into the store, even after repeatedly telling them that my original trip into the store took an entire day and that I was physically unable to come back into the store. I continued to get passed around from department to department, all telling me that there is nothing they can do for me except to reorder this item and pay another $99 for delivery.

DELIVERY COMPANY PROMISSES TO CALL HALF HOUR BEFORE THEY SHOW UP, WELL YOU KNOW THEY DONT. MISSED DELIVERY BY FIVE MINUTES, CALLED COMPANY AND WAS TOLD THAT DRIVER REFUSES TO TURN AROUND BECAUSE HES OUT OF THE AREA [IN FIVE MINUTES] IKEA TELLS ME THAT I HAVE TO PAY NEW FEE FOR DELIVERY, WHEN I ASKED FOR MY FURNITURE BACK I WAS TOLD THEY WONT BE BACK AT STORE FOR 3 MORE DAYS. GREAT SERVICE GUYS REALLLLY.

I'm sure that this email will never be read but it takes a significantly less amount of time for me to write a letter of complaint than it did for me to 1) travel to and from our local Ikea in Stoughton, MA four times, 2) plan on the Ikea computer the Pax wardrobe we intended to purchase, 3) purchase the items online, 4) deal with the delivery people, and 5) deal with the people at Ikea (over the phone and via email) after we were cheated. You see, we purchase a Pax wardrobe system at the advice of our contractor. We were a bit leery but the people at the store were helpful, the wardrobe had many features to recommend it and even with the delivery cost, it seemed good money for value. Well, imagine how shocked I am at this late date to find that our closet system, ordered Dec. 5, 2012 and delivered (sans packing slip) Dec. 20, 2012 was missing the doors? And most notably, when the the package was shipped, it was clear that the doors we had requested (there were only 2 styles available and the other style was ugly and unacceptable) were no longer made/available/existed but it was shipped nevertheless.

Over 3 moths ago, we bought a set of cabinets from Ikea to make a kitchen island in our new house. When everything was put together, the 2 stainless steel doors didn't quite fit. There was a giant, crooked gap and they wouldn't shut. no amount of adjusting the hinges helped. We returned those, got home and installed the 2 new doors. One was much better, but the other had the same problem. The particle board over which they put the stainless steel cover was warped. I recently took back that door, and got another. It's still not right, but at least it shuts now.

I recently visited IKEA and have purchased 4 items worth of $800, that includes an HEMNES bed frame. This was my first time shopping at IKEA and I was told by the employee working there that I should note down the Aisle and Bin number and go to the warehouse and get it billed myself. He never mentioned about the article number and I bought my Frame. When the products got delivered, I was surprised to see a totally different bed frame than I ordered(it was white in color and I wanted a black & brown). I called the customer service and she was straight away rude. I explained her that I picked the correct Aisle and bin mentioned in the show room, she also confirmed that the bin I looked at has the same item I wanted and someone there misplaced the wrong item I got.

I just moved to LA and mistakenly thinking that IKEA was a reliable company, decided to shop from there. In the end of the day I spent over $600 and paid an extra $217 for shipping. They said they'll be there between 1 to 5pm. So me and my mother ended up sitting at the lobby for 6 hours, waiting for the movers to do us the honor of arriving but they never did. Not enough? We called the customer services about 20 times and couldn't talk to anybody- press this press that.

I bought a bed at ikea the other week. i forgot a peice, went back to get it 5 minutes later. they charged me an additonal bed! Ikea sucks. Never buying from them again! I bought a bed at ikea the other week. i forgot a peice, went back to get it 5 minutes later. they charged me an additonal bed! Ikea sucks. Never buying from them again! I bought a bed at ikea the other week. i forgot a peice, went back to get it 5 minutes later. they charged me an additonal bed! Ikea sucks. Never buying from them again!

Purchased 2 end tables. Got home and began assembly, pre drilled holes don't come close to lining up with supplied hardware. Spent $50.00 on gas and most of a day driving there to buy this garbage and the response I got from IKEA, "you can return it". I will return it next weekend and rest assured I have spent my last penny at IKEA. Very disappointed. We had a whole bedroom suite chosen and were ready to spend well over $1000.00 but the customer "no" service sealed the deal for them. This store is awful, don't waste your time or money.

I've set up much IKEA furniture in the past, usually with much swearing, sweating, and crying, but setting up my IKEA BILLSTA bar table made me come to the pragmatic realization that IKEA engineers are in fact evil. The straw that broke this camel's back was the part where you need to balance a metal table leg with loose bolts, aiming them at a screw-hole in another rather heavy metal connector piece with a loose bolt holder, made to come together by the magic of the all-mighty Allen key.

I went to Ikea in Schaumburg, Illinois this past friday. I bought a MALM chest that online had a price ten dollars off if you became a family member. I became a family member in the store but they refused to honor the price telling me "the sale ended yesterday". I went to customer service and even though the price was still listed on the website, they refused to honor it. They also had listings of pillows that advertised a discounted price as a family member, but they refused to honor the price because the sale ended yesterday even though it was listed in the store as the discount price.

I bought an entire kitchen worth of appliances from IKEA. Fridge, microwave, oven, dishwasher. Oven went completely dead after 2 years, warranty did cover the repair. Dishwasher lasted just over one year, warranty conveniently is only one year so it was not covered. Microwave stopped heating, warranty only covered for five years if I had receipt which I did not. Fridge still works.. I am knocking on wood as I type this.

Updated by user Mar 10, 2013 I finally received my refund but now the girls in the customer service office will not return any of my e-mails there is GUY THERE IN ANOTHER OFFICE THAT CONTACTED ME AND WAS SO VERY KIND AND HELPFUL HIS NAME IS KEVIN HE REALLY MADE ME FEEL LIKE I WAS IMPORTANT TO IKEA SO I DID RE-ORDER ANOTHER DRESSER, AND I HAD PROBLEMS WITH IT MISSING A BACK PANEL AND THE DRAWERS WERE SO HARD TO OPEN HE THEN RIGHT AWAY SHIPPED ME OUT A NEW ONE AND ALSO GAVE ME A GIFT CERT.HE TAKES PRIDE IN THE CUSTOMERS AND HIS JOB I AM VERY HAPPY THAT HE TOOK TIME TO MAKE THINGS RIGHT AND SAID HE WAS SORRY MANY TIMES THANK YOU KEVIN FOR ALL YOUR HELP AND KINDNESS IKEA SHOULD BE VERY PROUD TO HAVE YOU

When I called IKEA about 2 items which I mentioned above, they registered the case,gave me the reference number: ,they said that they were going to call me in 48 hours. In the case,you will clearly see that I told them i will wait for the item, since I already paid for the delivery,assembly and I bought the matresses as well for that bed. I also informed them I got international phone number,if there was a problem reaching me and they said that no,they would defintely reach me and would inform me about the cases. they didn't call me. When I called IKEA yesterday, first they couldn't find my case number. then,they found it from my name and forwarded to someone else,and the same process has been done again.

Ikea sold us a coffee table with broken parts and screws that were too long (they went through the other side of the table when screwing in). They would not replace or refund without a store receipt even when credit card receipt was present. Was told it wouldn't be a problem, they would replace the parts and issue a store credit. When we got to the store, oh I'm sorry no such policy exists. Very poor customer service and am now stuck with a broken table.

This is not just about Ikea but the delivery company it uses, Urban Express. Since day 1, I have had issues with them. First, Ikea/Urban Express attempted to deliver my purchases on the wrong day. However, on the correct day, Urban Express came 3 hours BEFORE the scheduled window of delivery. Instead of returning the package to the store, Urban Express claims that I signed for the package at 5:47 pm on the delievry day. I tell Ikea that is not true and they then tell me that I didnt sign for it but that I denied the purchase. I denied the purchase at 2:30pm when they came 3 hours early.

I placed an order for over $2000 worth of furniture. Received emails from IKEA that furniture had been shipped to and arrived at local delivery company. "Local" delivery company is located nearly 200 miles away -- despite the fact that I live in a city of over 40,000 people. Delivery company was supposed to call me to arrange for delivery within 3 days - delivery company never called. I followed up with delivery company, they said that they only deliver to my area once a month! I followed up with IKEA Customer NON-service.

On Jan, 2 2013 I mad a purchase in Brooklyn IKEA store. I bought a PAX TONNES SLIDE DR - 301.605.63 and VIKEDAL MIRROR DR 300.233.21 (An assistant person on the floor checked the items on your system and said that it was in stock). Because the first item is so bulky (PAX TONNES), I also ordered a delivery for both items. (The second door is not that big and I could have fit it into my car, but I just took an advantage of paid delivery). The following day the truck came to my house, however he delivered only the small door saying that the PAX TONNES SLIDE door was not in stock.

Ikea had a very popular fabric called benzy skepp, it was beautiful and I purchased a large project with it. Actually redoing the interior of a boat. I ran out and of course they had discontinued it, when I made a third attempt at customer service I actually got someone who actually attempted to help me. She stated she got phone calls each day about people wanting this fabric. You advertise a textile dept, then I suggest you get some textiles, get people in there who attempt to help and then once a fabric becomes popular I strongly suggest you do not discontinue it!!! Will not ship ikea fabrics again and secondary to the poor customer device think I will avoid you altogether!!

I recenty purchased an entire kitchen to be installed by Ikea contractors - - by recently I mean June 2012. I just learned [september 2012] that the contractor [Osprey Bay] is not even certified to work in Florida! This means that the contractor must take an exam given by the state of Florida; pass the esxam, and then submit applicaitons with my city to obtain permits , to then commence doing the job. I'm looking for ways to get out of this most deceptinve practice. If Ikea is gooing to use a contractor to iinstall its [roducts, the least they can do is assure the consumer that the contractor is qualified to work in the state in which it is doing business. Fair warning when dealing with Ikea!

We bought a wood bunk bed for my son from ikea and assembled it and loved it until a week went by and we noticed our boy having multiple bites all over his body. We were confused and didnt know where they were coming from. A another week went by and he was still getting bit and we identified the bites as bed bug bites. We searched everyhwere while cleaning and vaccuming everything. We thought for sure they were in his mattress but low and behold they were in all the slats and screw holes of the ikea bunk bed. Never never never again will i purchase anything from ikea, i would rather pay 1,000 for a bunk bed instead of 200 and house infested with bed bugs and a little boy afraid to go to bed.

I ordered a matress and bed on Nov 6. It is no Nov 20. The set was supposed to be delivered on the 19th. I NEVER received a call that the delivery would be later. Now I find that the delivery company has 10 to 14 days to deliver the set AFTER they receive it...which was the 19th. Terrible communication and service. IKEA makes it very difficult to complain. My computer will not send the email using their email address...although I can send to every other business I use...LOWES, HD, AMAZON, etc. The phone service does not have a complaint/customer service for internet orders.
