The *** that shipped over my lamp broke it and now it is useless. The delivery men have no consideration what so ever for your things. They do not know what handle with care means! Please do not use there home delivery service. It is not worth paying one hundred dollars for the service when they don't care if they break your items. The item was purchased in the As-Is section, and I bet they won't want to return my money. I would have to lugg the *** broken thing there.

I placed an order on their website for a mattress and base. They only delivered the base after saying that the entire order is ready on the day. So there goes my day waiting for half the order. After calling their customer service which is literally a 40 minute wait no matter when you call, they said that someone will get in touch with me in 24hrs regarding the mattress and gave me an another order no. No one has called and its been 4 days. Finally, I got through customer service again and the person was pretty indifferent about the time I have wasted and said that I to restart the process because apparently I didn't write in on the delivery notice that I didn't receive one item in spite of calling them immediately after their screw up. I am still on hold for more than 2 hours now.

I have decided that I hate Ikea. We just got a store in Centenial, Co in the last year and a half and I was so excited. We went down to take a look and the experience was HORRIBLE. Too many people, layout is confusing, and the product availability was spotty at best. But that was okay I can online shop and decide what I want and just go pick it up (2hr drive later). So when I went to get a bathroom sink set up that I liked online and checked the availability online it said the store had it.

Warning do not use ikea for kitchen counter tops in Orlando and their partner international granite and stone. I paid for counter tops October 5th , after lots and back and forth told counters to be installed by December 1st. Told today counter type chosen not available and not available till Febuary . Unbelievable. Do not use ikea for counter tops , they are a rip off and their partners are useless . International granite and stone. Look for local providers who are more hungry for your business.

We placed an order for quite a bit of furniture with Ikea which was probably the first mistake. After the delivery company held it hostage for three weeks while they "worked out" a delivery date, we got the items. One of the pieces was completely messed up and as we put together another item, we discovered we had two right sides and no left. We got through to customer service who assured us they would send us the right part and replace the damage piece. That was in August. The delivery company contacts us, holds the furniture hostage for its usual two weeks before they bother with getting it to us and then call with a delivery date and time.

three and a half weeks ago i ordered bedroom furniture. i received an email stating the delivery would be 12-3-12. on 11-30 i received an email stating i would receive a phone call about the delivery within 2 or 3 business days. at the end of the 3rd business day i noticed a local number called my cell phone but didnot leave a message. i called that number over and over for an hour.. finally someone answered.. she could not update me on the delivery.. she referred me to their 1888 line.. so far i have been on hold for 52 minutes.

Eat For FREE* Offer valid Friday, November 23 - Sunday, November 25, 2012 How it works 1. Purchase your meal in our restaurant. 2. Receive a coupon with your receipt. 3. Give your coupon and receipt to the Check-outs cashier and receive the total amount of your meal deducted from your purchase of over $100.

I had a very bad customer experience I had today with IKEA. I am a 49 year old professional who makes a living as a consultant in the area of customer service / experience and interaction center related service. My wife and I were excited to visit the Centennial, CO IKEA - our first visit since we live in the northern burbs of Denver and have been curious since it opened up. I am re-doing my office and thought I'd at least give it a shot to see what IKEA had for storage and some other office furniture.

We purchased a TWIN daybed for my college aged daughter's apartment in Philadelphia. We were told that it would cost $59 to deliver and $79 to assemble. Assembly alone would be $79 based on the price of the item. My carpenter husband decided to do it himself. The bed came in 3 packages numbered 1-3. We followed directions to the bin and took the numbered packages to the checkout along with a mattress, dresser, lamp and some bowls. We got to the apartment, unpacked the boxes, and the last one had the directions, we discovered the box was for the QUEEN bed. There was small print on the box (about a 12 point font) that did indicate this, but the person at checkout missed it, we missed it and it was in the bin we were directed to. I called the Philadelphia store and waited a half hour for assistance and was told that it was our fault we took the wrong box and when I asked if we could pay for assembly and have them simply switch the boxes, they told me, no, I would have to return them. I asked for a supervisor and waited another half hour for someone at a call center in Baltimore that told me the same thing.

I went to the store to purchase bathroom cabinets and used the product numbers purchasing with a $275 gift card. At the time of checkout the applied a charge of $275 instead of applying a credit. I had to wait at the service desk to get the $550 owed to me. After receiving a credit slip I kept checking my bank account and no credit. I called and they told me it takes 7-10 days to get my money back. They made the error and yet I had to wait for the reversal. I was short 2 boxes for the furniture and had to return to the store for additional boxes. Very little to no assistance in the store or for loading boxes. No instructions for assembly was included.

We bought an almost $1000 couch at IKEA. It arrived missing the cover which has yet to arrive. WE have called them over 10 times and been left on hold for over a half an hour. Their customer service specialist has not answered any of our e-mails. Short of driving 50 miles to their store, there seems no way to REACH THEM. What a rip off! In addition, their delivery service picked up our old couch and left all of the seat covers on our front porch. One single guy arrived for the delivery so I had to help carry the couch and remove the old one. It was a disaster!

I got a very bad experience from Ikea Brooklyn home delivery service. This Satursday, I spend more than $3,000 at Ikea Brooklyn store. I payed for the delivery and assembly fees, but I only got delivery service yesterday and I found they lost something that I already payed. The company who charges for the delivery and assembly told me that Ikea only arrange for delivery not for assembly, I need to call Ikea. So I called Ikea back then the nightmare began. My phone call either was tranfered to voicemail system or when they heared my voice, they just hung out, or the different people gave me different answer. I left my meassage in the voicemail box, but I never got any response. It took me more than 3 hours keep calling them, but I still didn't get any information. This is really very frustrated and drive me crazy. I asked my friend to help for calling them, and I was told that they said I didn't pay for the assembly. It's ridiculous, I payed for the delivery and assembly fee's totally more than $300. And what I want is just the information: What time I could get the assembly service and what happened for the staff that I didn't find? Nobady gave me a proper answer.

Hi my name is Ahmed Refaat, and I have ordered a bed online from IKEA store in Wembly I have had the be ddelivered but was missing the sides (you can not assemble without it) I have tried to reach the customer service on the phone but that was impossible, so I have sent an online complain, I got a call back stating that they missing items will be delivered, took the day off to wait for the delivery and no one showed up

IKEA Paramus, located in Bergen Co, NJ has no customer service. Just returned from the store, where only 5 registers were open on a Saturday evening. How cheap can they be? The lines were 8 - 10 people deep, each with a cart or two of goods for purchase. Also, they had no one to bring flat carts to the customers in the store. There was a line to get them. On the other hand there had to be 5o of them outside. Service today was non existing.

I drove the hour to the closest IKEA store, bought a couch, waited 20 minutes and was brought a cart with two boxes on it, one I presumed was the couch, the other the cover. After driving the hour back home I opened my boxes to discover I had only part of the couch. Keep in mind the lady at IKEA gave me a cart and said "here is your couch," not "these TWO carts have your couch." My wife was with me and she heard the same thing. I called immediately, and as the other person on this site to have dealt with IKEA noted, no one is impowered to do anything. The woman in customer service said someone would call me within 72 hours with a case. In exactly 70 hours I got a call and a message.

I ordered a sofa and a couple of other things from ikea and opted for home delivery. The delivery guys not only left scratch marks on my walls but also forgot to bring one item. The phone line for customer service keeps you on hold forever. They told me the item would be delivered in 7 days but they didn't. I called again-they said someone would call me the next day-no one called. I called an extension number I was directed to but it went to voicemail for two days.

Went into Ikea and bought a shoe rack that I saw on display in the model room area. When cashier(Sarah B.) scanned the item, it was double the price. When I questioned her on the item, that its supose to be 24.99, she then trys to resolve the problem. she started by calling around, then had a guy come look at it. All that didn't help resolve anything, then we had to actually walk all the way back to the model rooms to manaully see the tag on the item. The item indeed did actually have the wrong location number on it.

The model show rooms had a discrepancy on their tags with their item connected to item location. The cashier, Sarah B. took forty five minutes to solve the problem, felt like she was more worried about the discrepancy than my own time. We had to walk all the way back to that show room area to show her where we got it. In the end, ikea was out of stock of the product we were anticipating to buy and we were pissed off that all she could say is that that item is out of stock. We felt like time was wasted into solving ikea's problem, not ours.

Terrible!!! DO NOT EVER use their delivery services! After hours spent on the phone and being stood up 3 times I still don't have the furniture I bought 3 weeks ago! I'll pass on the detail and how frustrating it is to have to call them an know in advance that you will NEVER get anybody on the phone before waiting 1HOUR listening to some *** elevator music!!! Who is going to pay for my missing furniture and my phone bill ? I have spent more than 10 hours on the phone with them this month and the issue is still not resolved!

We bought an Ektorp sofa (the l-shaped one) and lounge chair. The first time we tried to wash the slip covers the zippers broke and since we had misplaced the receipt Ikea refused to exchange them for us. Then the next time we tried to wash the slip covers one of the cushions disintegrated. We were shocked. My husband called customer service and after lots of waiting was tranfered to the closest store about 3 hrs away. He was told they could do an exchange for the cushion but they couldn't check whether the sofa was in stock.

I patronized the Tampa, FL IKEA store to buy what amounted to an exclusive style of bed. For starters, the unbelievable size of the store (warehouse) was intimidating and totally customer unfriendly. It is perhaps the largest retail building I have ever seen devoted to a singular entity. In fact, when one enters an associate hands out a "road map" of the store interior. The concept is for the customer to make a selection, figure out where the item(s) are, and put them in one of their heavy-duty carts. Since I was looking for a particular furniture item, I was finally able to locate the item on the lower floor storage area. The color I wanted, I was then told, was in an area off-limits to the customers. This began a multiple series of waiting periods totaling over an hour.

I have a defective mattress that I purchased in 2010 that is now indented. Firstly - searching their web site for a customer service tel number other than chatting to "Anna" that came back and said "she" did not understand what I was requesting, secondly trying their email they did not respond for 5 days - so attempted to call them. On their web site for customer service they say you can call them between certain hours - but no tel number listed to call. They have a Phone icon - when selected it asks for your address or zip code. It then gives you a list of stores closet to you with their store number - and by the way they only open at 10am. No where is there an 800#.

Due to my relocation, I ordered all my furniture from Ikea Pittsburgh given that they provide delivery & assembly services for a fee. Â I thought that this will be a breeze.Â  It turned out to be quite a disaster.Â  1) Delivery of wrong mattress - delivery was on time but wrong mattress was being delivered. Called Ikea Pittsburgh.... Waited for 45mins before someone answered my call. Told her my order number & she pulled my order from the system. While telling her about the wrong delivery, the call got cut off. She didn't call me back. Given that she has my order number & my phone number is available why didn't she call me back? What type of customer service is Ikea offering?

I cannot put my anger into words right now. I have called Ikea twice and the have put me on hold for over 2 hours. They say our call is important to them yeah well if it was so important to them they wouldn't have one of their customers waiting for 2 hours to get hold of a sales representative. The last time I called my call was transferred twice and I still had a wait time of over 3 hours. I have minutes on my phone and I now have gone over my limit and have to pay over 100 dollars just for hours because of Ikea. I am very angry and will never again order from Ikea.

I ordered 4 items to be shipped to my daughter in college, about 120 miles away from the store. When the truck arrived late, only 3 items were delivered... apparently the 4th, a coffee table, wasn't even on the truck. My 19 year old signed the manifest at the driver's instruction for the 3 items, and then called customer service. After 90 minutes on hold, she gave up. I called the next day and got through within 30 minutes. The rep told me that if he entered a case regarding the missing item, it would take a "very long time" before the error would be resolved as they had a huge backlog. He said my best bet would be to go back to Ikea and just pick up the coffee table myself and then get it to my daughter. However, my daughter had the original invoice and delivery order, so I had to wait until she mailed it back to me (apparently knowing the invoice # and delivery # weren't good enough for Ikea; the rep said they wouldn't have a record with all the necessary information ----- seriously?!?)

Trying to buy a NEW product - these outside hanging lamps, listed under NEW, and only appeared on the site within the month - so it was NEW. It was not available in my local store and when I called they said it was a discontinued item and the store would not be getting it. I was referred to the 800 number, waited 14 minutes to speak with someone only to be told that I needed to call the Houston store directly because it was the ONLY store that will ship direct. I called the Houston store, only to be refered , BY RECORDING, to the website for the Houston store (ironically, the recording also said that "online shopping just got easier" - HA). So I went to the Ikea Houston website and tried to make the order - you fill out this order form and it advises you that you have to wait for a rep to CALL YOU - to get the total price and to give your credit card number. So I called the Houston store back and waited 24 minutes to reach a representative, I explained what I had been through up to that time, then she proceeded to tell me how to do THE VERY THING I JUST DESCRIBED TO HER THAT I ALREADY DID -IT'S LIKE SHE DIDN'T LISTEN TO A WORD I SAID.

I purchased a a MALM 3 drawer chest ( 8014****) from IKEA Atlanta. While setting up the drawer one of the back panel is missing . I called up IKEA Atlanta and after all the computer generated options finally someone named Virginia picked up the call. when i told he that the back panel is missing all she can say is that we are sorry and please come and pick it up from their store and there is nothing that they can do . on being asked for the supervisor i had to hold on for 2 minutes then some one named Tiffany picked up the call and repeated the same thing that i have to come to IKEA and pick it up.

I bought a bed from ikea and paid $100 for shipping to our house. The shipper gave me a 12pm to 4pm window of time. I arrived at 12:10 and they had come and gone -- my fault. I called them and they refused to circle back to deliver. I paid ikea an additional $25 redelivery fee and then the shipper's website failed to let me schedule it.... giant chunks of time on hold and on the phone to get it delivered, only to find that they sent the bed back to Ikea.

I visited my local Ikea store in Atlanta to purchase drapery rods in brushed steel. I had purchased this product last year and was impressed with the quality. When I arrived at the store these were no longer available and the sales person stated this 'high quality' product had been discontinued. What was available were cheap plastic looking rods that were not a substitute. Ikea had been known as a company that provides good design at very reasonable prices. My impression is that the company is moving to cheapen their product line to increase their profit potential. But if this is the case then they will lose many in their customer base who will no longer shop there.

Over three weeks ago I purchased the Manstad sofabed from the Ikea Emeryville, CA store. I paid $799,00 for that sofabed plus delivery to my house. When they delivered the couch I began assembling it and one of the arms wouldn't attach to the rest of the couch. After hours of attempting (I'm very good at assembling) it became clear that there was something wrong. I called their store customer service, filed a complaint and they told me my case would be answered within 48 hours. 5 days later...nothing, not even a call. I called back and they told me they didn't know why that happened, apologized and said someone would be contacting me within the next day. Nothing again, this went on for 3 weeks now, I've called 7 times and have yet to receive a call back or resolution. every time I call, customer service says they either can't contact anyone in the store or the store clerk says they can't do anything about it but will pass it along and call me back within 24 hours.

the delivery time was 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. But I didn't receive my items and called to ask why. they just said that the delivery time was estimated and they cannot promise the delivery will make on time!!!! I waited whole morning for nothing!!!!!!!! That makes no sence!!!! They said they'll deliver my furniture by 2 p.m. and cannot help me with my loss of whole morening because the delivery time was estimated. But no one told me the delivery time is estimated!

I tried to order an IKEA kitchen and it arrived with 6 cabinet doors missing, and additional cabinet and panel which i did not order, after having exchanged over 50 emails with the kitchen department in Brooklyn in an attempt to receive the correct merchandise. The saleswoman who made the error refused to accept any responsibility or help correct the error. The company appears to be a less costly alternative, but in reality, by the time you have spent hours on the phone and multiple trips to the store, it is in no way worth whatever money you might save.

My six year old child pulled on the end of her wrought iron daybed frame and snapped it in half and went flying. Thankfully, the jagged metal did not cut her! I purchased two of these beds, one for each daughter, approximately 5 months ago and I no longer have my receipt. When I called IKEA to ask what could be done, I was given the standard '90 day with a receipt' response. My focus was not getting my money back, or replacing the bed, so much as having someone care that a 6 year old little girl could snap the metal post of her bed in half with out trying!

I've never had an issue with Ikea because i think they have good variety and the quality, while not great, is equivalent to its lower price range. I bought a whole bunch of things and agreed it to be home delivered on a certain day since any other earlier date wasn't possible. When I received the paper service order copy, the service date was two days later (which would be too late since I would be really busy already). We corrected the IKEA worker who handled our order and she changed the mistake and said it would be changed in the system as well.

Ikea delivery guys show up with a 5 minute warning, threaten to leave because I don't have all the appliances unplugged (when it takes me 2 seconds to unplug). It was terrible. I have had delivery services come all this week and have been great and this has me in tears. I've received 5 calls from their customer center telling me that the guys won't remove my current appliances because I didn't have them unplugged prior to their arrival. Again, I had my stove/Range out in 5 minutes ready to go. I'd rather pay extra money and have an easy delivery experience

Today, December 29, 2012 I went to Ikea in Frisco, TX and experience the worst treatment in my life. I was reaching for some $1.99 plastic tubs when Linea and Monica yelled at me to stop getting tubs. I got the amount that each household could (2). There were several people getting tubs, but I was singled out. I told them both to stop speaking to me and they continued and I became threatened. I spoke to Tony the Duty Manager who was no help.

I hate Ikea. It is too overwhelming and they make you carry your sh..!t. I take hours trying to find my furniture in the huge warehouse thingy. Its just frustrating and I never want to visit again. I've been there only ONCE. A friend asked me to go with her to get a couch and I was like FUUUUUCK THAT! I'm not even going NEAR one anymore. Its overly expensive for toy furniture that gets ruined easily. I bought a coffee table and its falling apart. I took good care of it.

My husband and I are low-income working parents who finally saved enough money to make our house comfortable. We always liked the design aesthetic of IKEA and spent nearly $500 on other items we needed: curtains, a dining set, bathroom fixtures, etc. We were able to take home all these items with us, so they weren't a problem. Our major splurge, however, was the EKTORP sofa bed, which retailed at $799. The IKEA in Burbank, CA charges a $59 flat rate next-day shipping fee, so we were excited at the prospect of finally having a comfortable couch to come home to. I took off work the next morning in order to be sure I was present for the delivery.

I've been looking for the right outdoor seating for a couple of years. It's all terribly over priced and usually ugly. I recently shopped Ikea's website for a few hours and finally found exactly what I have been searching for! I was thrilled. The price was right. It was beautiful, the right size, style, weight and color. I was ready to order. But NO! Not available online. So I called.

Iam an employee there. I must say...the shoppers there are the worst group of people Ive ever dealt with. *** as a box of rocks...needy as ***..cant read a tag if their lives depended on it...maybe if we werent so busy reading the tags to people they could read themselves....we'd have more time to help with real customer service. People have no clue of the concept of shopping there. They expect Rob and Stuckey service with ikea prices...NOT! Do your research before u shop and it will be a better exp for everyone!!

first last and only time to shop there. i live 50 miles from store so i called to see if i could put 200 dollar item on my debit card and have son pick it up with his truck was rudly told no i had to order on line and pay 350 .00 for shipping. so i drove the 50 miles walked for at least 20 minutes to find checkout finally ask they said downstairs i passed stairs 3 x then still had to walk at least 15 more to get to check out then loaded 4 heavy boxes on cart and outside ask load clerk to load it he just took off so i loaded 4 heavy boxes my self and since i am 71 no easy task. very rude staff and worst thing is the maze 1 must go through like going to oz only the road is not yellow.

I just hung up on the computer phone operator that kept telling me that someone will be "back" to help me "shortly". No one EVER picked up in the first place, they just put me in the que and left me there... for 25 minutes! I purchased a dish washer there a few months ago and now need a service repair (the 2 year warranty suckered me in), but I suppose they got my money so who cares if I need help or would maybe come back and buy something else. Oh well, lesson learned, NEVER AGAIN. I waited over 1/2 hour to get assistance in the store, so I should have expected this terrible customer service.

Bought this 9 months ago and there is still a nasty toxic smell to it when opened. Underscores how this stuff is being manufactured cheaply - thought it would wear off, but it hasn't. This thing took forever to put together and now smells up the room its in. I'm going to have to dismantle it and discard it...it's too huge for someone to haul away in a pickup. Warning: do not buy IKEA Odda. I wouldn't be surprised if this didn't extend to other furniture since its all mass produced in China, ugh ugh!

My complaint is about Ikea, specifically the products and service I've received in Japan. You can also read this complaint on facebook by visiting here; https://www.facebook.com/notes/james-moore/why-ikea-japan-suck-by-james-moore-a-tale-of-corporate-incompetence-and-consumer/101501****351**** I'd appreciate you reading, "liking" and commenting on my facebook based complaint as I'm having trouble being heard over here and a good responce to my facebook page would help. Below is the same content in text formet if you prefer to read it here.

The following product is shoddy: http://www.ikea.com/us/en/catalog/products/6016****/?cid=en%3Epc%3Ego%3Eproducts_search#/6016**** - Ektorp replacement cover - it has flimsy inset panels, which ripped the first time I tried to wash the. I did not was the cover soon enough to receive any help form customer service - you have to do that before 90 days. Also, the ironing instructions say to use a hot iron, but the grey inset panels disintegrate when you get near them iron. I learned that the hard way. In addition, even with a hot iron this fabric is difficult to get ironed out. Unsatisfied all around.

I bought two units from online site at ikea and the color is wrong. I have contacted their customer service during their working hours and after a 17+ minute wait got a voice mail which said they would contact me within 48 hours. It is over 10 days, no one has contacted me. My emails are returned and the chat person can only sell stuff not take returns. I would recommend that one never buy anything online from Ikea as trying to return goods is impossible. I wonder if anyone else has had the same experience with trying to return items bought online?

IKEA will not reimburse for damages to computers as a result of their glass desktop shattering and the computer CRASHING to the floor! So beware, if you buy a glass desktop from IKEA you are taking a chance. Their insurance company Liberty Mutual denied my claim. Researching the internet I have found that IKEA's shattering glass desktop happens often enough for it to be an issue.

My purchase is damaged. Here is what they responded with: On Apr 17, 2012,IKEA Houston Customer Service wrote: "Someone will call. it usually takes 3-5 business days but someone will get back with you Soon. And I apologize for the wait." So 3-5 days for someone to call you, then what? Another 5-7 days for them to redeliver an undamaged product??!!!Â

Ikea store in Denver, Colorado, on County Line Road. I and my wife started looking for a chair, the place is a Maze from ***. Once you get in you can never get out. I guess if you are a billionare you can put up and anything. Will never return to the Maze of no RETURN. Poor customer service, we had to searh down the sales people. Nothing is assembled, you have to do it all. It comes in boxes to your home. Its like walking into a nightmare, only you are awake.

Last week i purchased a new faucet for my Ikea Kitchen. On my way out to pick it up i grabbed another item. When I approached the pay area ,I asked if I could pay for the item at the pick-up area, where the faucet was waiting. I was granted permission. NO PROBLEM. Today I purchased a new sink for the new faucet. The sales girl, showed me a cutting board that sat on the sink which i also took. I asked her if I could pay at the pick-up counter to avoid the lines,her answer was of course.

I bought a sofa and armchair from IKEA and purchased home delivery scheduled for a Monday night between 5pm and 9pm. The delivery man called and said he could not come until 11pm. At 11pm he called to say he could not make it up our street. He then said he would come the next day. He did not! We had somebody home all day but, he called the secondary number. He then said he would come the next day and he did not!! When I called him on the third day he said he had taken it back to the store.

The Swedish word "IKEA" translates into "bend-over". IKEA is a blood-sucking corporation that sells *** made in sweatshops all around the world to unsuspecting customers. The seemingly well built *** then falls apart almost before you get it home. When you try to get your money back for the ***, that is when the true IKEA shows it's ugly face. It starts with it's management. The managers at the Centennial IKEA, have no clue and are all little robots with no brains.

Their Faucets will not install like every other other North American sold faucet. You'll have to buy adapters from a specialty plumbing store (Home Depot/Rona like stores does not carry thread adapters) Also all Portable dishwashers will not work on these European threads. Portable dishwashers use an adapter that screws onto the faucet after you remove the aerator. However you cannot buy an adapter that will fit onto their European standard threads so you will never get it work like every other faucet sold in North America. When I complained to IKEA they gave me the corporate line - "buy adapters" they don't include the adapters nor do they sell the adapters and they won't take it back as there is nothing wrong with the faucet.

I have been shopping at Ikea for abt 8 years now. truth be told, every time I assembled an ikea product I ended up not liking it for various reasons. But I never returned any product just 'cos I was too lazy to re-package and return (most of their furniture ends up becoming pretty bulky after assembly). But here's what happened recently-- I purchased 2 bar stools. After assembling them at home I found that they looked really cheap and unsturdy. They looked so bad that for a change I decided to fight my laziness and return the lousy stools . Being somewhat of a perfectionist I re-packaged them neatly (very neatly in fact). I expected no issues in returning this product. But to my utter disbelief this return turned out to be a shocker. The Ikea agent's first question itself kind of gave me a clue that this company does not know a thing about customer service. The agent asked me "so sir, why are you returning this product?". I have never been asked that question at any retail store in my last 10 years in USA. Anywayz, I told him the reason and he went on to open the package to see if all the content was inside and if there was any damage. fair enuff, I waited till he finished. To my utter shock he tells me "sorry sir I cant take this back. You have assembled and unassembled this and we have a policy that we dont accept returns on assembled products. Plus there are a few scratches on the bar stool". despite being shocked at that response, I tried to politely reason with him but he just insisted that it was store policy and he can do nuthing to help me. in shock and disappointment I just walked away promising myself that I will NEVER EVER return to an IKEA store again.

I made an in-store purchase and paid for collection, delivery and assembly of two wardrobes. The order was suppose to be delivered last week. The order was delivered incomplete and hence the wardrobe was not assembled. The driver had no explanation so I called ikea which had NOT forewarned me about the incomplete delivery. The representative i spoke that had no knowledge of why the order was delivered incomplete and how the situation could be rectified. He said he would call back. Its been several days and no one has called me back

IKEA sells a set of LED lamps for which the plug is a *custom adapter made specifically for IKEA* by an electronics manufacturer in China named Helms-Man. My (otherwise very nice) lighting fixture needs a replacement adapter in order to restore the fixture to working order. Today IKEA customer service put in writing for me a flat refusal to allow customers to buy replacement adapters that are *only available through IKEA.*

I purchased 4 Ingolf bar stools from Ikea in August, 2011. When I was putting them together, I noticed that the wood was a bit warped on one of the stools, but I thought it was just a cosmetic issue and I live one hour away, so I kept the stool--and pitched the receipt. In January 2012 the stool became very unstable and when we would try to tighten the bolts, we could hear the wood splintering. I contacted customer service who instructed me to return the stool for an exchange. When I got the store, they refused to take it back since I did not have a receipt--seriously--in this day and age??

Ikea delivery service is a piece of joke, I ordered a table on May 5, 2012 and the expected delivery date is May 11, then I called Ikea on 10th to see if it will delivery on 11th. I have been given 4 different number to call and finally get hold on someone and said it will be delivery either today or tomorrow. Then I waited until 12th afternoon and called their customer service again. Then lady told me the thing that I order just came in and it will deliver on next Tuesday May 15. And until now I still not received anything yet. I called them again, they said the thing just came in today and hopefully will deliver today before 5 pm.

Updated by user May 06, 2012 Update: I contacted customer service and to my surprise they were very responsive. We rescheduled delivery and install of broken elements. Unfortunately Urban Express continued to miss delivery times and assembly. IKEA would make commitments and Urban Express would not meet them. The customer service agents were very effective at pushing Urban Express and ultimately the products were assembled to my satisfaction but it was extremely painful. I did get a credit for the delivery charges but would never do business there again.

All the IKEA cribs have their mattress base made of fiberboard which emits Toxic VOC. These toxic gases can cause severe conditions including cancer in babies. The IKEA in Minnesota is doing a massive remodel, although when I had done my pre-shopping, as you do for an IKEA shopping expedition, there was no mention of an upcoming remodel. Same thing when I walked in the store - it was not until you were in the throes of the madness that is IKEA that you saw the mess. Most of the items I had preselected a few weeks earlier were not available anymore....the few employees that you can usually chase down were now a part of the remodel and truly it was customer helping customer. In my 55 years of shopping, it is the most poorly operated remodel of a store trying to remain open I have ever seen.

Nowhere on the online purchase page does it say that when you order online for some inexplicable reason we will ship the items NOT FROM your nearest IKEA Store but from an ONLINE DISTRIBUTION CENTRE. My receipt CLEARLY STATED DELIVERY ESTIMATE DATE FEB 15 - when I called to confirm I was told that that date is when someone will call to SCHEDULE a delivery/ The person on the phone could not understand the confusion obviously IKEA is Swedish for no syntax or semantics.

Basically I ordered a couch and paid to have it delivered. They said it would be here on Friday between 1 and 5 (4 hour window). No delivery driver. I tried to call IKEA and waited on hold for 20 minutes before someone was able to give the delivery service phone number. I called the delivery service number and left 2 messages on their voice mail. I didn't hear anything until 9:15pm when the driver said they would be here in 45 min. at 10pmk, they called and said they would be here in 30 minute. At 10:45pm, they called and cancelled and said they would schedule for the following day. I told them I didn't think it was fair if they made me wait around for them for another 4 hours. They called the next morning and said my window of delivery was between 5 and 9pm.

I puchased cabinets and shelving from Ikea, 43 boxes and over 600 lbs. I paid Ikea 586.00 for delivery and set up. when they arrived not all the products were there so they assembled what was here after 4 hours they were done. Later I walked outside to my front yard and found that all the boxes were left here for me in my driveway. When I called them they said that they don't haul away the boxes. Now I have left with all this garabe to get hauled away.

I was thrilled when an IKEA opened recently in the Denver Metro area as I was beginning a kitchen overhaul. As a first step, On 3/12/12, I bought a small table and stools knowing that "It is okay to change my mind". I assembled the stools and realized that they were too tall for my kids to sit comfortably on. When I returned the stools with the original receipt on 3/15/12, I was told that I could not get a refund because I had assembled the stools. I was dumbstruck. Throughout the store the walls are plastered with the return policy in which writ large is a welcoming heart that says "It's okay to change your mind". Nowhere on the return policy written on the walls does the qualification about the product having to be unassembled. I asked the customer service rep to turn aroud and read aloud the policy posted DIRECTLY behind him and tell me where it says that items can no longer be returned when assembled. He agreed it did not say that; yet, he insisted that this is your policy. This lack of complete disclosure of your policy is deceptive at best. I would have never bought the items had I not been comforted (and reminded by never every wall in the store) by the idea that I could return my item for a refund.

EVERY PIECE LAST NO LONGER THAT A COUPLE YEAR. THE STUFF IS POORLY MADE OUT OF THE CHEAPEST PARTICAL BOARD I HAVE EVEN COME IN CONTACT WITH. BOUGHT A BED WITH SLATTED BED FRAMES AND THE WOOD PIECES BROKE INTO A THOUSANDS PIECES AND THE PIECES OF METAL WERE BENT AND BROKE WHEN WE TRIED TO REASSEMBLE THEM. UNFORTUNATELY THE BED ITSELF IS STILL IN GOOD CONDITION IF YOU LIKE LAYING ON THE FLOOR.

We bought childrens beds and the lines to go with them. Of course we washed them before making the beds....but the linens do not fit!! They were sold in the Childrens sections NEXT to the beds and mattresses. So now we have furniture with odd sized bedding ("Twin") and cannot make the beds. No returns on the "washed" bedding! Whatever, not going to shop there anymore. You get what you pay for!

I usually love IKEA. I have to set aside a chunk of time to go, as the closest one is 45 mins away, and we all know how much time can be spent once inside the store. HOWEVER. Why, IKEA, why put big sticky labels on glass candles??? How ridiculous is that? It took me longer to get the label off than it did to put together the coffee table on which I will place these candles. By the time I was finished, I wanted to hurl the candle through the window, rather than use it to decorate my house.

I know ikea furniture isn't the best. I don't care; I'm a student on a budget. I decided to purchase a couple items online from Ikea. I decided to have them ship to make it easier on myself. Boy, was this a mistake! First they give me an estimated delivery date. They also require a signature or person to be there. They provide only a date, not a time window, and its only an estimate. So am I supposed to sit around all day and hope they come? And what if they don't, should I waste two or more days waiting?

Bought 2 Hemnes glass door Black Brown cabinets (item 401.763.42), comes in 2 packages for each unit. The sides, the shelves, the glass door have dents, scratches, unstained parts, wood showing through, it looks like put together from a trash dumpster. And where is it made, of course China. I drove 250 miles with a rented truck to get this and some other stuff. Moral, if you must buy Ikea, please take the time to open the boxes in the store so you can exchange/return any stuff that is not quite right. What a shame !Ikea does not seem to have any quality control.

I purchased the Sultan Tafjord memory foam topper from iKEA. When I got it home and opened it the chemical smell almost knocked me over. After one month of outgassing the topper in the garage and washing the cover, it is still not usable. When I tried to sleep on it, I woke every morning with a headache and sore throat, not to mention all my bedding smelled strongly of it. I'll stick to the toppers at Macy's next time. Don't waste your money.

Updated by user Nov 22, 2011 I received a call from a customer service manager at Ikea this morning and she apologized for my trails and tribulations. I really appreciated her professional but kind manner. She is arranging a replacement of my duvet. Further, she said she felt my case would serve as a good learning opportunity for the customer service staff and that they would be discussing it. She felt the item should have been returned without issue. I bought a duvet cover at Ikea Portland. I realized after a while that the snaps were mis-manufactured.  They just don't snap. It is a bit of a drive to the store so it took me a while to get back and I had no receipt. But since the issue was so small (a plain duvet cover, $50) and since I assumed Ikea would stand behind their product(and having never had any problem exchanging things w/o a receipt before) I wasn't worried about it. They examined the duvet and first told me that they couldn't take it back with a stain.  When I pressed them (what does a stain have to do with the faulty snaps?) they said they don't accept exchanges of linens w/o receipt. Long story short, I ended up speaking with four "managers" and wasting an hour waiting for them to find time to come out and speak with me. I wouldn't back down and accept that the world's biggest furniture store would actually want me to buy a mis-made product. Good customer service and confidence in quality is one of the main reasons I--and most of us--shop at "reputable" retailers like Ikea.  All fou "managers" were all surly, snarky, and curt. I was really surprised. I've had such a different sense of Ikea as a company! Now I have decided to never shop at Ikea again (and I've been a very loyal customer for over 10 years...I buy nearly all my household items there).  I am still pursuing the problem. This morning I got the same weird snarky, no-can-do mean-teenager attitude from the first person I spoke to at phone customer service. I asked to speak to HER manager (I was getting so tired of saying that!) and the guy was the first person who spoke like a professional (not mention an adult). He said he couldn't over-ride the store managers but he could give me corporate CS headquarters and wished me the best.  Now I await a return call from corporate HQ. So silly! I can't believe Ikea tolerates such poor management. Something is really wrong at the Portland store...my sense is that they have a store permeated by weak customer service culture.  But in the end I feel this is all for the best. Now I am more resolved to buy what I can from smaller, local stores.

Last week I purchased a bed frame from IKEA. My husband correctly assembled the bed frame (BRIMMES). It was the daybed. Three nights later, my son went to bed and turned over on the trundle part of the bed and it broke. 10 screws popped out!. The particle board that they make the frame could not support 105 lb child. I called IKEA regarding the safty of this item. I am still getting the run around. It takes over 25 minutes for a human to answer the phone and then another half hour to be transferred to the store you purchase it from. I have called 4 times and it the same process every time.

Updated by user Feb 04, 2012 OK. Here is our follow up to IKEA Return Policy Sucks. Fortunatly I am handy with tools. So instead of fighting IKEA I took matters into my \'own hands\' and repaired the deffective futon. Now it is level no thanks to IKEA. We kept the futon and pledged never to buy IKEA again! Original review Jan 04, 2012 We purchased a futon at the IKEA Burbank store. As other customers say over and over again, FORGET ABOUT IT!  How do you know if an item is defective through the cardboard box it comes in? Or unassembled, or unused (their description of unused is open and assembled) Our futon when assembled and in a bed position is 1" taller on one end than the other end. So you roll down hill when you lay down on the bed! WHAT!  So I call up the customer service rep. and, you got it...the beginning of the IKEA blow off!  By the way we spent over $600 cash to purchase this item and all the bedding, pillows etc. We are still in the thick of it, up date to follow.

This morning I moved from Palermo to Catania (200 km), just because I wonted to go to IKEA. The shop was closed because of bad weather (!!!), but there wasn't any notice on this fact in the website! I have lost a lot of time, a lot of gasoline, my ecological footprint became larger than average, today, without reason! Other big malls in the surrounding area (Decathlon, Auchan, Carrefour) were all open.

Last Sunday afternoon I was in the area and decided to visit the Renton Ikea to pick up some household items. The store was jam-packed, but I expected that on a weekend. What I didn't expect is that Ikea wouldn't be staffed for a large crowd of shoppers. I selected the items I needed and proceeded to checkout. There were multiple long lines of 20 or more customers--many with carts overflowing--at all the attended and self checkout registers that were open. However, at least FIVE checkout lines were closed!

NOBODY AT IKEA IS RESPONSIBLE WHEN MONEY ON YOUR ACCOUNT DISAPPEARS. AND WHEN THEY CLAIM TO REIMBURSE YOU, THEY EVEN TAKE MORE MONEY OUT!!! I purchased a kitchen for over $4000 on 11/8 for delivery, because they were going to take a lot of time to deliver I returned 11/11 to get it myself and I realized I had used the wrong card to purchase. "No problem" said the friendly guy after about an hour of waiting and let me know I would be reimbursed. I paid with the intended card and waited for my money to return. Nothing happened.

We've been shopping at IKEA for over 12 years and this was the last trip we will ever make. The sheets we purchased were defected-- 1/3 too short to fit IKEA brand mattress. Since IKEA has a very difficult return policy and we live 3 hours away, we are not able to get a refund. Thus far, we had at least 6 e-mail exchanges, were asked to send pictures, and then fed-exed the whole thing. After all this trouble, the store reps have stopped responding. I have never, ever had such experience with a return, never mind one that is a defected product.

After spending hours at the showroom, you grab a cart and head to the warehouse only to learn that the items you selected are not available and were discontinued. Not only they do not post that information on their web page, the floor attendants are either not aware that the merchandise has been discontinued or are not willing to help. Customer service in their stores is very poor. They have a restaurant with good food and I can see why. Since you waste an incredible amount of time at their store, walking around, lifting heavy merchandise at the warehouse, etc.,etc. they know you will need to feed your family at some point.

1.) Ikea is not even a Better Business Bureau company. Well they do have a rating and it is an F. 2.) Ikea's website inaccurately displays incorrect stock levels that they actually have in their store. Once I arrived at the Houston, TX store the manager Kim had told me that their website is completely off. Their system was off by 29 TV stands. What I mean is that on my IPhone their store (Houston) shows that they have 29 of the specific TV stand I was looking for. The manger Kim, said that they are off by 29 and they cannot accurately keep track of their products. Why can companies like Target figure this out? Horrible customer service as well as she would not help us figure out a resolution.

Back in 2005 my husband and i bought our first house. We live on the Kitsap Peninsula in Washington state, and decided to travel to the Ikea in Renton. We purchased several thousand $ worth of products including bed frames, dressers, night stands, computer desk, matress, kitchen items and the biggest scam the Ektorp sectional sofa. We liked the design (fit our living room perfectly), as well as the fact that this line has removeable, washable covers. This was perfect for our young family (at the time our son was 3 and our daughter was soon to be born). We now have 3 children ages 10, 6 and 4.

I scheduled a date for shipping, and when the item did not arrive on the day scheduled I called the delivery service - turns out Ikea had cancelled the order since 30 days had passed (even though I had taken the earliest delivery date offered to me), refunding only the item price, not the delivery price. After many hours with senior customer service they agreed to reship the item without charging delivery, and I was to call back the individual with my credit card info. I called her extension 5 minutes later and got voicemail, but no callback. Called again an hour later, and a few hours later again. Called again the next day. Called a week later.

1st time at IKEA - the stores are arranged as a maze to force the shopper to see every item in the store. The carts are available only at the entrance, and at the exit - tough luck if you need more space. The staff often times will move your cart if in the isle. I even had my cart UNLOADED by the staff while I was searching for the storage containers for a shelf system halfway back through the maze they call a showroom. Also, watch out for items being on the the wrong shelves - especially in the self-serve furniture department.

We spent over $700 at Ikea and one of our purchases was a small dresser. When we opened the box it came with so many parts it was comical until we tried to put it together. About half way through a piece of the junky particle board broke. We tried to return it- I had my receipt, my ID and my Credit Card. The customer service rep wouldn't even look at them. She just said we had screwed up so we were out of luck. Although she was in returns she claimed she did not have the authority to return my money. She offered to go in the back to see if she could find the part. I just left the broken dresser there and will never shop there again. I am out $100 but they are out what was a loyal customer who raved about them.

Customers please beware of IKEA's cleverly written & deceptive return policy!! While browsing their store, you will notice an abundance of signs stating "It's ok to change your mind", and "If you are not entirely satisfied with your purchase, simply return the unused item in its original packaging within 90 days". Please know that if you remove any IKEA item from the original package what-so-ever, the item will be considered "used" & non-refundable. Case in point: We attempted to return a brand new coffee table. There was nothing wrong with this table; we just simply decided it wasn't quite what we wanted. I called the store to inquire whether or not I needed to disassemble the table & repackage it before returning it. I was told, "We prefer you do not attempt to repackage the item to avoid damaging it, and we will need to inspect the item before refunding you". This seemed legitimate & fair. After arriving at IKEA's returns/exchanges department, we were told "Because this item was initially removed from the packaging, this item was considered 'used' & was non-refundable." Please note that I had my original receipt, all original packaging, and was well within the 90 day return policy limit.

We bought the expedit shelving for our nursery. We brought it home I put it together in my living room and then carried it into the nursery. Only to find out the Ikea's brand of white is not white. It is a off/ creamy white. It didn't match our white furniture we already had. So took it apart, put it back in the box. The only different between now and 12hours previous is that the box was taped to keep it closed and the plastic bag that holds the hardware was ripped. We walked into customer service to find that we could only get store credit after maybe 16 hours of having purchased the shelves. Because the item is now used. They told us because it was already assembled and taken apart that when it had to be put together again it wouldn't be as sturdy as the first time it was put together so now they had to severely discount it. They don't care if their white isn't white. They told us we should have brought in a drawer from our existing furniture to make sure it matched and for that it was a preference problem and not a product default. But it is false advertising. They label it as white and as long "as it is close enough" then it is ok to label it white. After realizing that they would not budge on giving us our money back for our shelves that were put together for maybe 10 mins. They offered us store credit.

My husband and I were looking for a round table to entertain guests. We had been all over looking for one and were so excited when we came across one here. It seemed odd, but there was no number to go pick it ourselves, it said write down the name and color and ask them for help. So we did, the only question the man had was how tall was the base, 29 or 48"? We told him 29", he printed out a "C&C Full Serve", we paid and then we waited. About 20 minutes later, a woman comes out and says it shows 6, (yes she said 6), bases in stock but there isn't a one there.

One word, do NOT fall in to trap of IKEA kitchen sales. We ordered an entire set of cabinets, flooring, and counter-tops from them (IKEA draper at 67 West IKEA Way (1-15 & Bangerter Hwy.) Draper, UT 84020). Some counter-tops were not available at the time (it was in March), they promised arrival in 4 weeks. We thought the installation is going to take about a month anyways, so we bought the rest. We got coupon to get the rest once they arrived; 1 small counter-top near the stove and one island.

I have written to IKEA many times to ask them how come the Billy Book Case does not have a height extension in black -- never heard back from them. Not even the courtesy of a reply. Does anyone know why IKEA does not make the height extension in black? I think they should alert customers to the fact that they don't sell the height extension in black, when someone buys the Billy bookcase so that they are not stock with bookcases that's can't make the best use of the product.

After careful consideration I purchased a bathroom vanity (Godmorgon series) from Ikea. I had a 48" cavity to fill and purchased the sink top and 4 drawer vanity. Sample on floor measured 47 and 1/4" wide and box purchased said unit was 47 and 1/4" wide. Assembling was a nightmare. Finally put together and guess what - - - it was 48" wide (not 47 and 1/4") - had to rip down two newly textured and painted walls and replace with thinner wallboard, texture and repaint. Thought the worst was over --but no, the sink top was 48 and 1/2" inches so I had to gouge out the new walls and slide it in.

Ivar System I went to IKEA to buy this system. First, they were out of stock on the uprights for this system. But we went ahead and bought the shelves since I was afraid by the time the uprights came in that they would not have the shelves. I went to the customer service desk to find out how long it would take to get these back in stock. I lady told me they should be in by the next weekend. I live forty-five minutes away so I checked online before driving the distance. Not in stock. Three weeks later it still says not in stock. So I call. After waiting twenty minutes to get someone to answer the phone (this was on a monday) I told the lady I wanted to speak to a manager. Ten minutes later I get a manager on the phone.

I went to Ikea Pittsburgh yesterday and had THE BEST customer service by Tiffany T in the TV media department. This young lady went out of her way to get me what I needed. When she wasn't able to find what I needed she sold me the floor model at half the cost. Another piece of my order (which was the last beech besta in the store) was found on a shopping cart near the bin it belonged. Without Tiffany T's help I would not have be able to have what I wanted. What a great day when it all works out!!!

I made a 1600$ purchase in Ikea Tempe, and when I was mounting my brand new table I noticed that a hardware came defective. Not a simple screw, but one of those hardwares make exclusively for Ikea furniture. I sent them a spare request and was informed, by email, that I should wait up to 9-14 business days! It happened in October 6th. Today (October 14th) I decided to call to know about the status of my request, and I was informed that I should wait, because the hardware is coming from... SWEDEN!!!

I placed a order at Ikea Brooklyn, paid for delivery and assembly. Ikea store gave me delivery window time and the delivery company gave me another. The day of the delivery, that was all day because of the two windows, nothing arrived. I called the delivery company and they said that the delivery was waiting for 25 minutes and left. After trying both companies, Ikea and Urban Express Assembly. The solution was that I have to pay for another delivery, even though, I was home all day waiting. Results for me to miss another day at work, where I get pay plus pay $100 again...great

Shocked to find my local IKEA no longer refunds your money on returns but forces you to take a gift card - even on completely new, still-in-the-box merchandise that you bought the day before and for which you have a receipt. Worse, when I questioned this policy I was patronizingly told, "The law doesn't require companies to take anything back, so really by offering a gift card we are *adding value*" *** I'm in Finland, where service sucks as a rule so I avoid shopping as much as possible.

purchased kitchen cupboards from Ikea and from day one they were not stock the door for one of the cabinets, I purhcased these back in Oct. and anm now just getting around to installing but have not been able to secure one of these cabinet doors, they tell you to check stock on line and you are the one who spends the money and chasing them for a part, I am not impressed, even had my daughter check at another store 60 miles away from us, did I mentin we are 35 miles from the nearest store and went there on Sunday past because they told us the door was in stock, got there and nothing. so be careful when you purchase from Ikea get the parts first, o one of the doors was incorrect also right number wrong door, had to return that as well, guess Ikea doesn,t really care they are making money and the amount of complaints doesn,t bother them but sooner or later it will catch them

IKEA Dublin has big posters about their mattress refund policy hanging around at the Costumer Service and the bed section in their Dublin branch. It says that You can try out a mattress at home and if You're not content with it, You can give it back within 90 days with total refund.That sounds very costumer friendly and tempting. What they don't tell You is that a) You get the refund only in form of a voucher (What the *** do I do with an IKEA-voucher when all I want is a good mattress?)

Had to use A & E Factory Service - unethical, lying technician refused to provide service unless I paid for it, after making me wait ALL day for service call, then he insisted I was not under warranty , which is false, I have a 5 year warranty, receipt of purchase 2 years ago! He tried to put words in my mouth and said he was cancelling the service because I "refused to pay". I said I did not say that, he refused service because he incorrectly insisted I was not under warranty. and said he didn't appreciate my sarcasm! Company now says I have to call IKEA again, I have to reschecdule service appt.

To Whom it may concern at IKEA customer service: I have had the worst experience trying to buy this laptop table. Not only have I been misled to customer service representatives, been told I couldn't order a certain item due to my location and I continue to be unable to contact anyone in your organization who can give me a straight answer. I have been extremely wary of purchasing anything from IKEA in the past- I should have trusted my instincts. I find it unacceptable for an "international" company with locations all over the United States and the world to not have a 24 hour customer service line. Additionally, the limited "customer service" your company does offer is utterly pathetic. The representatives not only seem uninterested in customers questions, they demean customers with their responses.

Our dental office purchased more than 14 thousand in furniture and cabinets and we could not be more upset. The employees were unknowledgable about the products and seemed to be overwhelmed when asked to help. Upon delivery of our order we discovered items duplicated, items that were ordered missing and most of all items we thought to be ordered not even on the order. All in all this purchase has proved to be time consuming, frustrating and my belief not worth the savings!

People kept saying "order your furniture from IKEA, they're really great". Well, those people are wrong. Ordering furniture from IKEA is actually one of the most frustrating experiences I have gone through. See, I just got an apartment in New York City and I wanted my room to be done before my roommates moved in. So I went to IKEA, looked around, and ordered it online when I went home. I needed someone to assemble it so when they called to confirm my delivery date, I asked for assembly.

My husband and I have spent 5 hours putting together the dresser we got from IKEA. We got the wrong part, we got a medium size drawer where we needed a large size drawer. I called customer service. The representative told me that I could bring it back to the store and they would exchange it. I told her it was an hour drive and we shouldn't have to drive down there when it was their screw up, they should deliver it. I was really aggravated by the representatives attitude that it wasn't her problem- in my opinion the customer is always right, so I did say a swear word (which I don't condone but I was really upset) and she said in a horribly rude voice that she would hang up on me if I swore again.

I was told three weeks ago that my delivery would arrive today, I phoned Ikea three times to make sure it would arrive today and it hasn't come. They phoned me at 19:15 to tell me that it would not be delivered today and they would try deliver it tomorrow! I had to take a day off work in order to wait for the delivery! Now I must take another day! Who is going to pay for my days lost? Also, there is no complaints process and all the lines are busy!!!!! Totally unacceptable! Then I get told they don't deliver on a sunday!

Brought $350 home media center (Besta) item #201.021.54 at Ikea in West Sacramento. Went home, opened a few days later to build... No hardware in the box! Then, went back to Ikea to get hardware and they wouldn't give it to me.... I asked for a manager who told me the same thing and offered absolutely NO suggestions about how to fix the problem or make me feel like they even cared. We called customer service only to hear the same story, but had the pleasure of listening to the customer service representative yawn repeadedly during thr conversation.

Quality of material is gone down no support if the material in the package is not right. You are on your own to carry back and return at the return desk. But if you are buying big wardrobe or something heavy be careful you are not sure what is in the package. I had this issue with there PAX systems and really upset. Future not more furniture buy from IKEA. Bought PAX wardrobe but back covering turns out to be wrong cut somehow managed but there was no support no phone number no one to help you.

Employees in IKEA raise up in the barns. They throw tempers on customers with hostile and hatred. Me and my mom were looking for help to get those heavy boxes from the shelf in the store of IKEA in Covina. Guess how the employee serve us? I have to say that their ability is just can press their fingers on the computer and chatting with other workers. Even a pig can do a better job than them. That employee called "Franz" working in the section of storage area. He threw the products that we need to buy so hardly and with temper on our shopping cart. There're glass shelf underneath it, and he just didn't care. If you did not like to serve us, why you still work in IKEA?

Purchased a vanity and sink. Assembled the vanity. It could not be centered under the mirror and light because the shelves to the left made it line up uncentered due to necessary the placement of the plumbing. I took the assembled piece along with the metal leg which had fallen off because my plumber said it was glued, and returned it assembled to IKEA Frisco, Texas. The clerk said he could not accept it because it was "used." He read the policy on my sale slip which is the same policy as on the web and on the wall by the return station. I stated that "assembled" wasn't "used, but he pointed out that the hinges had been screwed into place and now that hole would never be the same - thus "used." I left the piece of pressed board and paper finish vanity bottom at the store.

Don't buy any sheets from IKEA. They are the worst quality, wrinkle horribly and after 15 washings still feel like sandpaper. You can't return them once the package has been opened. I washed my new sheets, put them on the bed and within minutes got up and put an old set back on. So rough and scratchy. I even soaked them in hot water with fabric softener for hours and that didn't even help. IKEA has horrible return policies and horrible customer service. Should have gone to Wal-Mart!

I was at the IKEA store in New Haven, CT today to shop for a crib. We chose a particular model (SOMNAT) and noted down the aisle and bin number after consulting the customer representatives. We also picked up the crib bedding and some other nursery related items and then went down to pick up the crib from the designated area downstairs. On reaching the warehouse, we did not find the product. On further inquiry, we came to know the crib was out of stock. We were surprised to find that:

When I checked my IKEA receipt yesterday (Sunday, 9/18/2011) I saw I'd paid $49.99 for an item that I was sure came from a bin marked $19.99. I went straight from the check out to the Exchange area and got a time-stamped ticket, 16.35 (4.35pm). It was an hour before my number was called, and for much of that hour there was only one person processing returns, although there were numerous IKEA workers in the area and dozens of customers waiting. There was no evidence of a supervisor or manager. While waiting I tried to call the store phone number on the receipt, but was cut off 3 times, I was on hold for the 4th time when I finally got to the counter. I said something to the clerk about having to wait so long, and she got angry and said she didn't want to deal with me, and told me to go stand at another (empty) counter.

I have been buying furniture and food from Ikea for over 20 years in different cities in the U.S. as well as abroad. I have nothing but good things to say about it. I have never had a problem with any furniture I have purchased there. It is good quality at a reasonable price. Starting on your first house and need to furnish it? I would recommend Ikea. It is also good for furniture for schools too. I do not work for Ikea or get any benefit from this. However, I believe pissed consumer is the most unreliable source of information on any company as there is absolutely no verification of anything.

This is a copy of the email I sent to IKEA here in Texas. My wife and I drove almost 2 hours to visit the IKEA in Round Rock, TX. Being from Sweden she was very excited to experience a bit of home. Imagine our surprise when we arrived only to realize that not only did IKEA bring Swedish products but also European socialist anti gun policies here to Texas. We are licensed and carry our weapons everywhere we go. Suffice to say that we will not be shopping at your store and will encourage others to boycott IKEA until you take down the 30-06 you have posted that prevents licensed law abiding citizens from carrying their defensive weapons. This is Texas, we love our guns a lot more than same overpriced European trinkets. I carry my weapon because when seconds matter the police are only minutes away. I'll not be disarmed by your management and made an easy target for criminals.

We bought a book shelf at IKEA in Houston. Houston because we live in San Antonio and we went to Houston to visit family. The book shelf has two boxes. We only walked away with one. NO system there to tell us that we were missing the actual shelves. So, can I go to Austin IKEA (which is a mere 90 miles and not 190 to Houston) to get the second box? NO. Because Austin's inventory would get screwed up. SO we have to plan another trip to Houston IKEA to get the second box. I cannot wait to go there to see if they will even be able to help me.

I have purchased a lamp minut brand at ikea in palo alto last year.i have been trying to get a replacement glass globe for it.The minut brand is untraceable on line.there also is no place to order replacement parts either in the store or on line.They are still selling this lamp with anew expanded line along the same brand,minut.we went to the store today and found out that not only do they not carry spare parts,but they have no idea how to get them.we decided to contact customer service at the store but guess what? There is NO customer service!ARE YOU KIDDING???

"First time buyer of Ikea furniture for my daughter's room. Glass Hemnes bookshelves had missing wood pieces. Spent 2+ weeks on the phone with customer service trying to get the parts. Was lied to several times that items were to arrive by the end of next business day for them never to arrive. Bookshelf was half put together and sitting in upstairs hallway for over 2 weeks due to the inefficent customer service. Not one person that I spoke to over the 2+ weeks was honest about the situation.

i am undecided about IKEA i was shopping and i was enjoying it, until i noticed one of the managers/workers being very rude and disrespectful to there workers, I'm sorry but I'm a business woman and when someone is miss treating they''re workers its just reflects on their store, and it was very rude and very unprofessional, if your going to do your dirty work (which you shouldn't in the first place) do it behind closed door..oh and IKEA....START TREATING PEOPLE WITH SOME *** RESPECT, and stop taking everything so serious your pathetic and unfair.

Went to Ikea on Saturday and bought two white Billy Bookcases. One is fine, but the second bookcase is not completely white and on the top shelf it is just plain particle board. Sitting side by side, one looks fine but the second shelf will need to be painted to cover the particle board. Unfortunately, once you get the shelf together and notice the particle board showing it is too late to return it because taking it apart and getting a new one is such a hassle, Guess you get what you pay for and $49.99 is what I got. Lesson learned. Now I have to get a can of paint to fix this.

Ikea lies about its surveillance in its parking lots. Don't be fooled by those signs that tell you "For you safety this area is being monitored." Those assurances ar intentionally misleading to make you feel safe and are false. There are no video cameras and there is no protection for customers relying on this promise of security for themselves, their kids, their cars and their belongings. IKEA is endangering its customers through intentional misrepresentation. If you've been a victim of a crime at IKEA, or been lied to by IKEA please send you story to IKEAlies@***.com for consideration in lawsuit in development.

I recently purchased a MALM bed & Hopen dresser and It was damaged shortly after removing it from the box. The Bed and Dresser is hard to assemble.I decided I no longer want the furniture and want a full refund but the manger told me I would have to come up there so he can see it to see if I can get a refund. I will be pissed if I have to pay a delivery driver to IKEA (College park) 15 miles away from my home get to the store and he cant return the items which was damaged

I purchased a book case ( they could not get that right.wrong color) and asked for it to be delivered. First error, my phone number was written wrong so I have to go through different channel to get the number corrected for delivery.The next error was when they delivered the item it was the wrong color..LOL... Now to get that exchanged done; a person could of went around the world and they still would of messed up. They gave me different times and the Manager was adamant that she has highly trained staff, which in all du respect she needs to get trained her self in giving the correct information.

Do not by any IKEA beds I had my receipt in hand and the bed put back in the box within 24 hours of buying it and it fell through to the bottom when I layed on it(I weighed 120lbs and am 5'7)and I injured my back. What junk! I met all their demands and rules for returns and some punk at the return desk decided he just didn't feel like returning this item. I had another $400.00 dollars worth of merchandise that I walked out and left there. I will never shop there again and the maze they call a store when I tried to by a bedroom vanity. First they sent myself and my husband up to bathrooms and I tried to explain, this was for a bedroom after 45 minutes of up and down and back and forth they had them not only in the wrong section but also the wrong price.

I brought a chair at IKEA the Saturday after Thanksgiving. I still can't sit on it almost 8 months later. The chemical smell is still terrible. I had it in my sun room all winter and spring and now it is out on my upper deck. Every time, I see if the smell is gone, my month and nose goes funny. I was told that without the box, I could not return it. I had brought a smaller chair before and had no problem with that one. I thought the smell was the covering the chair had in the box.

I bought a trolley from Ikea about a month ago. When I got it home, parts were missing. I telephoned Ikea and they offered to post the parts out out to me. I explained that I would return and pick them up because I needed the trolley urgently. The member of staff checked and told me that they were in stock. When I returned to the shop, the parts were not in stock. I was told that they would be posted to me urgently and I would received them quickly. I kept telephoning and being told that they were on their way to me. I had a new business and needed the trolley with an attached magnifying light to run the business.

I ordered (on-line) a dresser from IKEA and found some of the hardware was missing. I tried numerous times to reach customer service by phone. I got disconnected, transferred then disconnected, told it was the wrong department, hung up on, and found options where there was no way to get customer service. Even the option on their website (Home shopping) didn't exist. I am still waiting for an e-mail reply. The dresser isn't usable without hardware. Their customer service is one of the most frustrating I have ever encountered.

I have never been so insulted or indignified in my life than when the Costa Mesa ikea would not accept the drapes purchased without the grey cover slip of paper. Three ikea employees including a return worker named Hedda and store manager named Erin, disrespected and chuckled while my fiancÃ© dug through the garbage looking for the sheet of paper. They stated how policy is policy and continued to say how the drapes were considered bedding and they shouldn't be taking them back at all, which is the exact opposite of what was said when purchased. The attendant was specifically asked if the drapes were returnable when purchased, she said yes and all that was needed was the plastic bag and merchandise. I explained to Erin how I understood policy is policy, but being understanding is human.

Ikea does not seem to stand by their warranties. My refrigerator broke and I called for warranty repair They dispatched a service tech who came in, stated the appliance was out of warranty because it was 13 months old (the framtid refrigerator has a 5 year warranty)and walked out even when my wife showed them the user guide which stated that the appliance had a 5 year warranty. I called Ikea to have them fix the situation and have the tech routed back to my house and was rudely told that that would not do that either my wife or I would have to take another day off in 2 days. With the money we lost from 2 days of work, we could have bought a new refrigerator.

Although IKEA has great looking merchandise for good prices, the customer service is so bad, that I dont think it is worth the savings. They treat customers with an arogant disdain and contempt that I have found to be the worst I have ever exoerienced in my life. This includes dealing with the IRS, long distance companys and even bill collectors. they all are more helpful and caring about the customer then IKEA. If you go there, just realize that once you have made the purchase and paid, tou will be treated with absolute contempt and arrogance. be ready to be very frustrated.
